loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod was born in 1987. He is a very hardworking man. Dilshod is married and has a child. His wife is Subhiya and she is a housewife. Dilshod is the only breadwinner of his family. He works hard every day. 

Dilshod has been busy with a bakery more than two years. He bakes flatbread and sells it in a local market where he has regular customers. 

Dilshod is going to buy a car for transporting flatbreads. Dilshod is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy a car for his business. This loan will help him to improve business and maximize profit. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase shop inventory.

loans.name: Kibriyo

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Кибриё. Она из района Дангара, где живет с родителями, братом, невесткой и племянником. Кибриё 36 лет, но она еще не замужем и не имеет детей. 
Кибриё у себя на дому предоставляет услуги швеи и зарабатывает этим на жизнь. В течение 10 лет она берет заказ на пошив женских таджикских платьев. Эту умение ей передано от матери. Кибриё все эти годы шьет на старой машинке и теперь она хотела бы ускорить процесс и качество шитья. Она запрашивает кредит, на сумму которого собирается купить новую швейную машинку. Кибриё нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: This is Kibriyo. She is from the Dangara region, where she lives with her parents, brother, sister-in-law and nephew. Kibriyo is 36, but she is not married and does not have children. Kibriyo earns a living working from home as a seamstress. She has been taking orders for Tajik women's dresses for ten years. For all these years she has been using an old sewing machine, so now she would like to speed up the process and the quality of her sewing. She is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. Kibriyo needs your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer emprendedora de 45 años de edad  que habita en vivienda propia junto a su desde hace 6 años al lado de su esposo, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar donde vivir. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado mantener la estabilidad económica de su vivienda. Rosa siente que puede darle un poco más de seguridad a su vivienda, construyendo un muro perimetral, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda, que le permita brindarle una mayor seguridad a sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en: Rosa is an enterprising woman, 45 years old, who has lived in her own house for the past 6 years alongside her husband, for which she is happy to be able to have a place to live. She is a hard-working woman who earns her living with a business selling tortillas, work she has done for 6 years, and it is thanks to this that she has managed to maintain economic stability in her house. Rosa feels that she could give a bit more security to her house, building a perimeter wall. For this reason, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build the perimeter wall around her house, which will allow her to offer better security to her few belongings.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
El señor José de 53 años  de edad es casado,  vive con su esposa  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de camarón y también tiene un molino,  su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don José en su negocio el vende, camarón por libra a las pulperías, restaurantes y personas que les gusta este producto, también atiende a los pobladores de su comunidad en la prestación de servicios de moler maíz para hacer tortillas, tamales y rosquillas.
 Don José es un hombre trabajador con deseos de seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de  bloques y cemento para mejorar su casa ya que desea hacer una cerca,  con el  apoyo  de este crédito el mejorara su calidad de vida, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es que sus negocios sean más grandes y prósperos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
José, 53 years old, is married, and lives with his wife in their home. He has worked for 5 years in a business selling shrimp and also has a mill. His business is located in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

In José's business, he sells shrimp by the pound to the grocery stores, restaurants, and people who like this product. He also serves the population in his community by offering his services to mill corn to make tortillas, tamales, and donuts.

José is a hard-working man with desire to continue working to get his family ahead. He is asking for a loan to purchase concrete blocks and cement to make improvements to his house since he wants to make a wall. With the support of this loan, he will improve his quality of life. He is very happy to continue working with Prisma.

His dream is that his businesses will be larger and more prosperous. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks and cement for his house.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 23 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza para sostener a su familia a base de esfuerzo y dedicación apoyada en su negocio de venta de cocteles de mariscos como conchas y camarón, además vende bebidas frías para acompañar obteniendo un poco más de ingresos. María desea cambiar el techo del corredor y reparar la cocina de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorada, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines, canales de lámina, etc. Para cambiar el techo del corredor y reparar la cocina, para tener un lugar adecuado en el cual preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
María, 47 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two daughters, ages 23 and 6 years old. She is an enterprising woman who works hard to sustain her family with her efforts and dedication, supported by the business of selling shellfish cocktails such as shells and shrimp. In addition, she sells cold drinks to go with them, getting a bit more income. 

María wants to replace the roof on her outdoor walkway and do some repairs on the kitchen in her house, which is deteriorated, and for this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in laminate sheeting, beams, pins, laminate gutters, etc. to replace the roof on the outdoor walkway and make repairs to the kitchen, to have a fitting place to prepare her food.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, beams, pins, laminate gutters, etc. to replace the roof of the outdoor walkway and make repairs to the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in two doors, cement, sand, gravel, brick and re-bar to build a toilet and install the doors on his house.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y cerdos, comparte su día a día con su esposo y 6 hijos, que están estudiando, tiene tres hijos mayores que ya se han independizado; su negocio surge hace 35 años por la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos para subsistir con su familia, es así como ha logrado que sus hijos se superen académicamente, el hijo mayor estudio en la universidad.
Comprará cerdos, fortalecerá el negocio, los cuidara para luego venderlos a mejor precio, espera que sus ganancias le permitan cumplir con sus obligaciones y aumentar el ganado.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos a que puedan estudiar y tener un mejor desarrollo en la sociedad.
texts.en: María works buying and selling cattle and pigs. She shares her daily life with her husband and 6 children who are studying. She has 3 students who have become independent. She started her business 35 years ago because of the need to have more income to subsist with her family. In this way her children has excelled academically, her eldest son studies at university. She will buy pigs to strengthen her business which she will sell later at a better price. She hopes that her profits allow her to comply with her obligations and increase her gains. Her dream is to continue working to support her children so they can study and have more opportunities in society.

loans.use: to buy pigs which will strengthen her business and she will sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Aichurok

texts.en:
Aichurok is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. During 8th Grade, she became interested in this field. After a visit of free training for students in 11th Grade, she decided to become a successful businesswoman. Aichurok read many books about business and received advice from businessmen with stories of leading companies of Kyrgyzstan. She participated in various debates and Olympiads related to business. 

Upon finishing high school Aichurok won a AUCA full scholarship for the New Generation Academy. She is now a freshman at AUCA and her parents are unable to cover her university’s tuition fees so she requested a loan to pay for her education.

Aichurok lives with her parents who have health issues. They often go to the hospital. Her father does his best to provide for the family. He constructs buildings, fixes cars, and does other jobs, what require no special skills. Aichurok hopes to receive a good education so she can be a professional with a stable future to provide for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, es de 33 años de edad,  reside en un cantón, estudió 9 grado de educación básica, es casada vive junto con su esposo y tiene una hija de 13 años de edad, es hija única. Ella elaborara tortillas desde hace 15 años, manteniendo así su casa, Santos es una persona luchadora que siempre busca la manera de mejorar cada día su hogar.  

El préstamo es para mejorar su vivienda y comprar materiales para el techo de la casa tales como: laminas, tornillos, maderas, mano de obra entre otros gastos.-  Santos, también quiere cubrir los gastos escolares de su hija.

En un futuro desea mejorar y ampliar el local de su negocio y vender otros productos como: comida y refrescos naturales, mejorando así los ingresos de la casa.
texts.en:
Santos, 33, lives in a canton.  She has a ninth-grade education.  She's married and lives with her husband, and she has a daughter, 13, an only child.

Santos has made tortillas for 15 years to support her family.  She's a determined person who's always trying to improve her household every day.

The loan is to improve her home and buy materials for the roof of her house such as metal sheets, screws, and wood, and to pay for labor and other expenses.  Santos also wants to cover her daughter's school expenses.

In the future she wants to improve and expand her retail space and sell other products like food and natural beverages, improving her household income as a result.

loans.use: to improve her home and buy materials for the roof of her house such as metal sheets, screws, and wood, and to pay for labor and other expenses

loans.name: Dúo La Exelencia Group

texts.es:
Dúo La Exelencia.
Don Carlos Tiene 52 años de edad, empezó su negocio hace 4 años su venta es de mercaderia de plastico como casos,baños,cubetas,etc para tener mejores  ingresos en su hogar y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos empezó invirtiendo q.1000.00 y luego su negocio así fue subiendo,  el agradece a Dios y a su familia por apoyarlo mutuamente, por eso solicita su crédito para llegar a tener mejores ganancia y mejor su producción, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en: Dúo La Exelencia. Carlos is 52 years old. He started his business 4 years ago. His sales are in plastic merchandise such as cases, baths, covers, etc. to have more income in his household and provide a better life for his children. He started with an investment of 1000 GTQ and his business has grown thanks to God and the support of his family. So he is requesting a loan to be able to have better profits and improve his production. He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.use: to buy plastic merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Yuli Natalia

texts.es:
Yuli es una joven de 27 años de edad que a partir de un crédito quiere iniciar su propio negocio de fabricación de artesanías, y quiere aprovechar la temporada de diciembre para entrar al mercado con diseños tejidos a mano bien hermosos y diferentes a lo visto en almacenes.
Yuli es una madre de 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, inocentes y expectantes pro la temporada navideña, esperando que santa Claus les traiga un detalle y la misión que se ha trazado Yuli es mantener viva la inocencia, esperanza que tienes sus hijos.
Con el crédito comprara hilos, y adornos navideños.
texts.en:
Yuli is a young woman aged 27, who, through this loan, wants to set up her own business making handicrafts. She wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to enter the market with a beautiful range of hand-woven fabrics to be sold in stores. 

Yuli has two children aged 7 and 2, who are innocently looking forward to the Christmas, waiting for Santa Claus to bring them a present. Yuli's aim is to keep her children's innocence and hope alive.

She will use the loan to buy thread and Christmas decorations.

loans.use: to buy thread and Christmas decorations to make beautiful fabrics for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Al Hayat Group

texts.en:
Hayat is the featured borrower for Al Hayat Group. She got together with the other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and also their standard of living.

Hayat is a 36-year-old divorced woman who sells clothes in addition to shoes, bags and accessories. She has been doing this for seventeen years to cover her needs and expenses. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with the new winter collection of clothes and shoes to satisfy her customers during the Christmas season. This loan will help her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

Hayat is the first lady on the right of the photo. Regarding the other group members, Maha is the second lady on the right, Sahar is the first lady on the left, and Najah is the second lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with the new winter collection of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Aida Rocio

texts.es:
Aida es una joven de 25 años de edad, madre de una pequeña de 7 años y se dedica a la venta de alimentos la cual aprendió a través de su madre.
La competencia en el sector y el alto costos de insumos han sido un impedimento para que Aida pueda invertir en ciertos implementos y activos fijos que necesita como lo son una estufa y utensilios, por ello Aida quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar estos dos activos y aparte comprar materia prima para fabricar alimentos para las distintas reuniones, eventos que se dan en el mes de diciembre. 
Su ayuda puede mejorar las ventas, incrementar la utilidad y apoyar a Aida en mejorar las condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en: Aida is a young 25 year old mother of a 7 year old child. She works selling food which she learned from her mother. The competition in the field and the high costs of supplies has been a problem for Aida to invest in purchasing certain tools and fixed assets such as a stove and utensils. So Aida wants to request a loan to buy these two assets and besides buy raw materials to make meals for the various reunions and events are are being given in the month of December. Your help can improve her sales, increase her profit and help Aida to improve the condition of her house.

loans.use: to buy a stove and utensils urgently for her business.

loans.name: Shipra Sss Group

texts.en:
Savitri is the representative of the Shipra Sss Group. She is married and has two children who are in school. As the group representative, she advises the other members and helps them to improve their businesses so that they are all able to repay their loans.

Savitri plans to use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her gram (chickpea) farming. The remainder of her money will be used for laborer expenses. The other members of this group will use their portion for their respective activities.

Once Savitri has sold her product, her profits will enable her to further strengthen her business. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this support and help.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her gram farming.

loans.name: M.ishfaq

texts.en:
M.Ishfaq is 39 years old and has one child. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He has been operating a cigarette and pan shop for many years near his house.  The business does very well. To meet his customers' demands, he wants to offer juices, soft drinks, cold drinks, etc., which are necessary and consumable in the daily routine. 

M.Ishfaq requested a long from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to buy cigarettes, pan, juices, soft drinks, cold drinks etc. for his shop. He will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pan, juices, soft drinks, cold drinks etc. for his shop.

loans.name: Celidonio

texts.en:
Celidonio has been engaged in the buying and selling of cows and carabao since 1986. With his hard work and determination, he was able to improve his business and maintain his livestock. Now, he has 7,000 square meters of rice farmland.

Celidonio buys the cows and carabao here in Isabela, then he sells them at Urdaneta Pangasinan. He wants to keep his business profitable; that's why he is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) which will be used in buying more cows and carabao to sell to his buyers in Urdaneta Pangasinan. He hopes to avail himself of this loan amount so he could increase his income and send his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to have additional capital to buy cows and carabao

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en: Dominique is 33 years old. He is not married. He is a motorcyclist and has been driving a motorcycle for seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation services. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: V.m.nazareth School Group (D)

texts.en:
Nemting, age 43 years old, is a resident of Gangpijang village, about 25 kilometres from Imphal town. She is a widowed mother of three boys. Her son is very brilliant and takes an active part in school activities. She is pictured with her son; both have their hands raised. 

She is a weaver and weaves traditional shawls comprising khamtang, pon mong vom, saipikhup (local names) and sells them in her residence. The small amount she obtains from her business enables her to meet her daily household expenses, but it creates problems and difficulties to meet her children's educational expenses since she has to pay her children's monthly school fees. 

Therefore, she wants to apply for an educational loan from Kiva for the youngest son, Seikam, who is studying in high school, so that Seikam could study throughout the year without any lack of basic student requirements. With the Kiva loan, she will pay his annual school fees, including his school admission fees. Her son will be able to attend school on time. 

She is filled with so much joy to know that Kiva is lending a helping hand. She is also an example of a strong widowed mother who never wavers. The rest of the group members are very happy with the loan. They are striving to give their children good formal educations and thank Kiva lenders for lending a helping hand.

loans.use: to pay her son's annual school fees for the session of 2015.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four dependents ages 9 to 18. Analyn lives with her family in the town of Carles, Iloilo. Analyn has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy nylon and sturdy types of fishing nets. With this loan, they will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. In the future, Analyn wishes to save money for the schooling of her children, as well as living a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy nylon and sturdy types of fishing nets

loans.name: Mbogayif Bacobof Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit » Mbogayiif Bacobof », regroupe des femmes qui évolue dans l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis plus de 15 ans. Elles possèdent des terres héritées de leurs ancêtres qu’elles exploitent avec leurs maris et leurs enfants.
Celle qui est à droite de la photo (foulard rouge) est la responsable du groupe, elle s’appelle Yvonne, elle mariée et mère de famille. Elle fait du stockage de céréales locales : mil, arachides. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans ce domaine. Yvonne est active toute la journée, car elle travaille de 8h à 17h et le reste de son temps, s’occupe des travaux ménagers. Elle appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison et s’occupe de ses propres besoins. 
Yvonne désire être autonome un jour et diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Mbogayif Bacobof loan group are women who have been running farming businesses for more than 15 years. They own land inherited from their ancestors, which they farm together with their husbands and children.

The group leader, pictured on the left of the photo in the red headscarf, is called Yvonne, and she is married and a mother. She has more than 15 years' experience in storing local cereals such as millet and groundnuts.

Yvonne works all day, as she works on her business from 8am to 5pm and then does housework. She supports her husband with household expenses and pays her own expenses.

One day, Yvonne hopes to be able to diversify her business and become independent.

loans.use: to buy cereals to store and resell.

loans.name: Ramon Jr.

texts.en:
Ramon Jr. is a 46-year-old man and a resident in the town of Ormoc City, Leyte. He engages in raising and selling  hogs. He has been engaged in hog-raising for  more than 20 years.

He is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy pig feed and pig vitamins. These will help Ramon Jr. improve his hog-raising business. In the coming months, his earnings will slowly go higher and eventually set some of the savings.

 In the future, Ramon Jr. is hoping that he could manage his hog-raising business well for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pig vitamins

loans.name: V.m.nazareth School Group (E)

texts.en:
Hineilhing is a 48-year-old mother of two boys. She is a resident of Gangpijang village and is skilled in weaving traditional wraparounds and shawls. She and her son are pictured with their hands raised. 

She is the featured borrower of the group. Her husband is a carpenter and nourishes his family from his carpentry work income. Though they have different businesses to generate income, they face a lack of finances when there are few customers and low demand, resulting in a low household income. They can't pay their children's monthly educational expenses on time when business is bad. Therefore, Hineilhing would like to take an educational loan for their eldest son, Ngamgougin, a 14-year-old boy studying at V. M. Nazareth English High School, so that their dearest son could study wholeheartedly. Their son takes a keen interest in his studies and always does well in his exams. He is well-mannered and loves to spend time with his parents. 

The loan will be used to pay the annual school fees and admission fees for the 2015 session. The loan will enable her son to join school on time. She is very grateful to Kiva for their endless support to her family. She sends her thank you to the lenders. The rest of the group members are also very happy. They will use the loan to pay educational fees for their children.

loans.use: to pay annual school fees and admission fees for her son.

loans.name: Ayélé Lucienne

texts.fr: Lucienne est âgée de 65 ans et est veuve avec  trois enfants. Elle vend du maïs, des ignames et du charbon depuis 1989. Avec ce crédit elle acheter 2 calebasses d’ignames deux fois dans le mois au lieu de 4 fois ce qui lui permet d’avoir de économie sur les chages en déplacement, éviter la rupture de stock et augmenter les revenus sur activités qui lui de se prendre en charges et être autonome et faire face aux charges de famille qui lui revienne vu son statut de veuve.
texts.en:
Lucienne is 65 years old and widowed with three children. She has been selling corn, yams and charcoal since 1989.

She will use this loan to buy two containers of yams twice a month, instead of four times a month. This will allow her to save on travel costs, maintain her stock levels and increase her earnings. 

Her income allows her to remain independent and pay the family expenses that are her responsibility as a widow.

loans.use: to buy two containers of yams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, metal sheeting, and beams, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Durga Shakti Sss Group

texts.en:
The Durga Shakti Sss group is comprised of 13 members and run by a president and secretary. Kiran is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied and include: selling vegetables, selling clothes for kids, selling cosmetics, selling fruits, selling craft work, selling food, a grocery store, etc.
 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs, including Kiran. She says that she has been a member of Peoples Forum for two years and joined as a result of a massive promotion that the institution carried out in her area. Currently, she has a grocery store and sells basic household items. She lets us know that she started this business some years ago; when she learned financial planning, she decided to start her own business.
 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her business capital. She will buy sugar, edible oil and biscuits in bulk to resell. She buys from the wholesalers in the city of Chhindwara, and then makes and sells her items in her store. This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family economically. She is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, edible oil and biscuits in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tyres and inner tubes.

loans.name: Maha Laxmi Sss Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a 51-year-old woman and lives with her fourth son. The other three children live separately with their families. For the past 14 years, Lakshmi has been running a general store from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. 

Lakshmi is the group leader of a 12-member loan group, all of whom live in a small village of Chhindwara district, Madhya Pradesh. In the picture, she is the lady standing first from the left with her hand raised. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Lakshmi is requesting a loan to purchase better quality and a greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that face her family.

loans.use: to purchase products, such as food and beverages, to restock her store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Wilma has been engaged in crab fishing and the selling of dried fish for more than two years now. Her husband is a fisherman. Wilma is standing next to the crab cages and nets which are used to catch crabs and lobsters.

Wilma is asking for a loan to buy more crab nets and additional stock of dried fish. With a loan, Wilma will be able to improve their catch, thus allowing them to sell more to the market.

In the future, Wilma has hopes of making her business sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more crab nets and additional stock of  dried fish

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is a hardworking woman. She is divorced and has two children. Her children are Manuchehr and Parvina. They are adults. Hafiza is a higher educated woman, and she works in the university. She always tries for the well-being of her children. 

Hafiza’s daughter Parvina studies at the Khujand State University, and she is a student of the 2nd course. She studies banking. Hafiza must pay for the tuition of her daughter, but she hasn't the money. She is asking for a loan to pay for the education of her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the education of her daughter

loans.name: Baturiya

texts.en: Baturiya is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Baturiya would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Baturiya can now store her maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Baturiya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is a 49-year-old married man. He resides in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of three sons and three daughters. He is a vehicle mechanic by profession. He provides services to repair vehicles. He has been running a vehicle repair shop in the market, where he performs his services. He also has spare parts in the workshop. He needs to purchase some equipment for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase materials for his vehicle workshop. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axels, brake shoes, etc. Khalid is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy materials such as tires, tubes, axels, brake shoes, etc. for his vehicle workshop

loans.name: Mavliuda

texts.en:
Mavliuda is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Psychology. Here is her story:

“My parents divorced when I came into this world. My mother brought me up alone, for which I am thankful to her. Of course, usually she had a hard time, but she believed in a bright future and was happy to be a lovely mom. She has always been a strong woman and she tried to do everything to allow me to study at AUCA, but I think she can’t do it without your help. I hope to receive a Kiva loan in order to continue my study at AUCA, which will be of great help to my mother.

There are three people in our family. Except my mother, I have my grandmother, 76 years old. She is a pensioner and also depends on my mother’s salary. My mother has a small business, which allows her to support us three and pay for my grandmother’s medicine. 

I always wanted to help my family. I knew that I couldn’t earn money at school, so I tried to be active and was a diligent school girl who liked to take part in many competitions and concerts. Those my efforts made my mother smile and understand that not everything was lost. I should, I must and I will be deserving [of being] her daughter. 

I am requesting this loan to pay university costs for my degree, which will allow me to keep fighting to grow every day, make something of myself and be able to serve not only my family, but my society.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Alice Group

texts.en:
Maria is the featured borrower of Alice Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown Philippines to work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in Philippines.

Maria is a 52-year-old married mother of six children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's university tuition fees.

Maria is the first lady on the left in the photo. With respect to the other group members, Josefina is the lady standing in the middle, while Alicia is the lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and rice for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more material for his plastic molding business

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 30-year-old married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who has lived and worked in a Palestinian camp since he was born.

Unfortunately, Husein only had the chance to reach the intermediate levels of education - as he had to financially support his family, he had to quit school and start working.

He has worked in selling used-car spare parts since 2009. He learned this business from his brother and he is developing it gradually.

Today Husein is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a used car at a special price and then start selling its spare parts at attractive prices.

He hopes that he can remain able to provide his children with the best education so they can have a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy a used car at a special price and then start selling its spare parts at attractive prices

loans.name: Dúo Jardin 2 Group

texts.es:
Dúo Jardin 2
Doña Kimberly johanna de 28 años de edad, Empezó su negocio  con una cantidad  mínima de q500.00 pidiendo al crédito a una su amiga para poder tener un negocio y a la ves otra entrada de dinero ya que el gasto de su esposo no le alcanzaba, para poder ayudarse uno con otro agrade a su mama por haberle enseñado a negociar y sobre todo a Dios  por tener un mejor ingreso de dinero, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta ya que es una oportunidad para salir adelante con negocio.
texts.en:
Kimberly Johanna is 28 years old. She started her business with a minimum amount of 500 quetzales ($65 USD) by asking for a loan from her friend to be able to help each other. She wanted to be able to have a business and to have another source of income as that of her husband didn't cover their expenses.

She is thankful to her mother for having taught her how to run a business, and above all to God for now having a better income. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy cosmetics to sell, since it is an opportunity for her business to improve.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of a fifteen-year-old dependent. She is from the community of Carles in Iloilo. She works hard to support her husband in their fishing business.

For three decades, fishing has given them income to support their daily needs and for the schooling of their children. Now Raquel wants to borrow a loan worth 30,000 PHP from CEVI, a microfinance partner of Kiva in the Philippines, to buy a new fishing boat, fishing nets, an engine and crude oil, and to pay for labor (people who will be helping them). 

Raquel believes that this loan could help them to improve their income and make it more stable.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat, fishing nets, an engine and crude oil, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jose Diego

texts.es: Jose de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de plátano su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, el quiere mejorar su vivienda con la construcción de un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra y asi el su familia pueden vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en:
José, 32, lives in his own house with his family.  He earns a living selling bananas in his business located in the town market.

José wants to improve his home by buying a room in the area shown in the photograph, but the money he earns from his sales isn't enough to do the work.  Consequently he's requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, rebar, and metal sheeting, and to pay for labor.  That way he and his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, rebar, and metal sheeting, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Diamond Sower Academy Group (D)

texts.en:
Chinneikim is a homemaker and devotes her time to looking after the household. Her family members are inhabitants of Thangkanphai village, which lies in the outskirts of Saikul town. She is 26 years of age and has two lovely daughters. Both of them went to Diamond Sower Academy for schooling. She and her daughter are pictured with their hands raised.

Chinneikim is the featured borrower of the group. Her husband is a cultivator and a part-time private teacher in a primary school. With the earning of fewer amounts in a month, he cannot support the needs of the household adequately. They are not able to afford to send their children to school, due to the irregularity of fee payments at school.

Accessing the Kiva education loan will ease their financial insecurities. The loan will be used to pay the school admission fees and other schooling expenses. Her daughter will be able to attend school regularly on time with complete needed materials in class. She is content with the Kiva loan, which lightens her burden to pay the schooling fees. She thanks Kiva lenders for helping them in the midst of their financial insecurities.

The other group members have a common interest to get a loan that will be used to pay the educational fees of their children.

loans.use: to pay for school admission fees for the new session and to buy new textbooks, exercise books, and stationery items for her child.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Basiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Khalidu, Garish and Rafia.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Basiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Basiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Basiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and his hope to eventually ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Thomas joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Adamu, Zainab and Blessing.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Thomas would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Thomas can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Thomas spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mathew joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Fibi, Yosisa and Lovena.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Mathew spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, maize and rice for his business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Amos joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Yusiya, Philimon and Filo.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Amos would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amos can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Amos spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To cover immediate cash needs like child school fees and uniforms, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices right after harvest time.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo est âgée de 51 ans, elle est veuve et mère de quatre enfants. Elle fait  le  commerce d’alimentation générale, elle s’approvisionne  4 fois par mois au grand marché  de Lomé et vend à domicile. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter  3 cartons de tomates toutes petites boîtes et 2 cartons des boîtes moyennes et 2 sacs de riz. Les revenus de cette activité lui permettront de faire face aux charges des ses enfants.
texts.en:
Améyo, age 51, is a widow and the mother of four children. She runs a grocery store. Four times a month, she gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. She resells at her home.

She's seeking this loan to buy 3 boxes of small tomato cans, two boxes of medium-sized cans, and 2 sacks of rice. The profits of this business will enable her to cover her children's expenses.

loans.use: to buy tomato cans and rice

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Adoa est née à  Anfun, elle vit dans le quartier  de Mayakpopé à Lomé. Elle est   âgée de 32 ans. Elle est  veuve et mère  deux enfants. Elle fait le commerce bois de chauffe et de céréales   à domicile. Elle va au marché 4 fois par mois et avec ce crédit elle veut acheter  6 sacs de charbons  et 1 sac de maïs. Avec les revenus sur les ventes  Adjoa arrive à contribuer aux charges  et besoins  quotidiennes des ses enfants qui sont à sa seule charge.
texts.en:
Adjoa, age 32, was born in Anfun and she lives in Mayakpopé, a neighborhood in Lomé. She's a widow and the mother of two children.

She goes to the market four times a month, and she would like to use her loan to buy 6 sacks of charcoal and one sack of corn.

With the profits of her sales, Adjoa manages to contribute to cover expenses and the daily needs of her children, who are solely in her care.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of corn and 6 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi  est  divorcée  et mère d’un enfantes. Elle est née à  Lomé en 1981, elle vit dans le quartier  d’Awatamé. Elle  est coiffeuse et vent aussi de mèches et des défrisants qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne   deux fois par  mois. Avec ce crédit elle peut acheter  15 unités de mèches et 21 unités de tissages.
Les revenus lui permettront  à faire face aux charges  t à l’éducation  de son enfants et aider ses parents.
texts.en:
Essi is divorced and the mother of one child. She was born in Lomé in 1981 and lives in the neighborhood of Awatamé. 

Essie is a hairdresser and also sells braids and detanglers which she buys at the big market in Lomé. She gets her supplies twice per month.

With her loan, Essi will be able to buy 15 braids and 21 pieces of hair weaves. The income from this will allow her to pay for her child's education and to help her parents.

loans.use: to purchase 15 braids and 21 pieces of hair weaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of used clothing, lotions, and a blender to make smoothies and juices to sell

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis un hombre de 41 años de edad, felizmente casado con dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad el cual tiene un negocio de salsamentaría donde distribuye bebidas básicamente cervezas con lo que ha podido generar el sustento para su familia y busca mejorar las condiciones de vida. 
Aprendió a administrar su negocio solo, y a través de un crédito busca darle sostenibilidad a su negocio comprando mejor surtido ya que lo tiene en el momento es muy básico.
Comprará surtido en bebidas de alcohólicas, frituras, empaques de papas, dulces etc.
Su idea con el crédito es atraer un mayor número de clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener dinero para pagar la matrícula del estudio de sus hijos.,
texts.en: Luis is a 41 year old man who is happily married with two children aged 12 and 17 years old. He has a business which is a deli where he distributes drinks, mainly beer. Through this he generates sustenance for his family and looks to improve their living conditions. He learned to manage his business by himself and through the loan he is looking to provide sustainability to his business. He will buy a greater variety as what he has at the moment is quite basic. He will buy an assortment of alcoholic drinks, fried foods, chips, sweets, etc. His idea with the loan is to attract a greater number of clients, improve his sales and have the money for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of alcoholic drinks, fried food, chips, sweets looking for greater profits to send his child to school.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Sani is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, tiene una venta de comida, es una mujer que enviudo y ha tenido que salir adelante con tres hijos, actualmente 2 de ellos ya tienen su propio hogar, vive con una hija, que aun esta soltera; su negocio funciona desde hace 4 años en el mercado municipal de la cuidad en que vive, lo hace con ayuda de su hija.
Remodelaran el mercado y Santos necesita capital para invertir en el mejoramiento de la imagen de su local, le facilitara tener un negocio más competente y atractivo para sus clientes, espera administrar de la mejor manera el préstamo y cancelar con puntualidad sus cuotas.
Santos anhela tener su negocio con vida para subsistir y no llegar a depender de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos has a food stall. She was widowed and has had to support her three children. Two of them now have their own homes, and so she lives with her daughter, who is still single. She has had a business in the local market in the city in which she lives for the past four years. She runs it with her daughter's help.

They are going to remodel the market, and Santos needs capital to invest in improving the image of her premises, so that she has a more competent and attractive business for her customers. She hopes to be able to manage the loan optimally and make her loan repayments on time. 

Santos hopes to have a lively business to survive and not have to depend on her children.

loans.use: to invest in improving the image of her premises, so that she has a more competent and attractive business for her customers.

loans.name: Zanjiramo

texts.ru: Занчирамо 48 лет. Она живет в маленьком городке под названием Куляб. Куляб расположен в южной стороне Таджикистана. Зачирамо замужем. У нее четверо детей, двое сыновей и две дочки. Сыновья работают заграницей в Российской Федерации. К сожалению они не нашли работу на Родине и были вынуждены уехать на заработки в чужую страну. Занчирамо на Родине живет с мужем и дочками. Она занимается выращиванием крупнорогатых скотин. Занчирамо приобретает крупного скота, откармливает в течение определенного времени и перепродает на рынке с наценкой. Таки образом она приносит в дом источник дохода. Сейчас у Занчирамо мало скотин, и она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом, чтобы спасти свой бизнес и сохранить источник дохода. На заемные деньги она купить пару телят и бычков.
texts.en: Zanjiramo is 48 years old. She lives in a small town named Kulob. Kulob is located in the south of Tajikistan. Zanjiramo is married. She has four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work abroad, in the Russian federation. Unfortunately, they were unable to find work in their home country and were forced to become migrant workers. Zanjiramo lives with her husband and daughters. She is growing cattle. Zanjiramo purchases cattle, fattens them for a while and later resells with a mark-up. This is her source of income. At present Zanjiramo’s livestock headcount is low and she needs to apply for a loan in order to keep her business afloat and maintain her source of income. She plans to use her loan to buy several calves and bulls.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, in her late 30s, is single and has one daughter who is still in school.  For five years now she has been selling cosmetics, working from 8 am to 6 pm daily and earning a good monthly profit.  

Zainabu used previous loans, all since repaid, to increase her stock of cosmetics and to start selling fabrics. The profits were directed toward school fees and household expenses and to purchase a plot of land. 

Zainabu is now requesting her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy the most recent and fastest-moving cosmetics and fabrics to resell.  She appreciates Kiva's support, and dreams of building her own house.  

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group "Asernal," which consist of nine members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date and fast-moving cosmetics and fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Beer Hasan Group

texts.en:
Nelly is the featured borrower of Beer Hasan group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua.  They have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to earn better incomes to support their loved ones back in the Philippines.

Nelly is a 35-year-old, single lady who is working hard as a housekeeper, to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved family and to improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan  to cover her mother's necessary surgery expenses. This loan is very important to Nelly, for it will cure her mother's pain. Nelly is the lady standing in the middle, with respect to the other group members. Marie is the first lady on the right, and Marife is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to cover her mother's necessary surgery expenses

loans.name: Anibal Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr Anibal antonio es trabajador de una empresa que presta servicios de agua potable como agente de de seguridad, su trabajo es por turnos de 24 horas por 4 veces a la semana inicia  a las 6:00 am terminando sus labores a las 6:00 am del siguiente dia.
El Sr Anibal antonio con mucho esfuerzo a ido construyen su casa de habitacion sinembargo hoy necesita el apoyo de Kyva para darle a el y su familia una mejor calidad de vida ya que su familia va creciendo y necesitando espacios por eso esta solicitando este prestamo para contruir un cuarto de habitacion donde puedan descansar sus hijos memores de edad.
texts.en:
Anibal Antonio is a security agent for a company that provides potable water services. His job is for shifts of 24 hours, 4 times a week. His work starts at 6:00 a.m. and ends at 6:00 a.m. the next day.

With much effort, Anibal Antonio has built his house.  However, today he needs the support of Kiva to help him and his family obtain a better quality of life as his family is growing and needing space.  This is why he is asking for this loan to build a bedroom where his younger children can sleep.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is 27 years old and from the small village of Zugdidi district. She has a large family, her husband, two daughters, two sisters-in-law, and a pensioner mother-in-law. Monika runs a newly opened cafe and generates income. Nowadays, the cafe is the only source of income for such a large family, as Monika's husband is no longer employed. 

Monika decided to start an additional business to generate more income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get once more a loan of USD 2,500 for starting an additional business. With the received credit, Monika will purchase clothes and will sell them from home. She is a very hardworking woman, helping the whole family. She hopes that the business will be profitable and she will be able to provide a better future for her children. Monika awaits your kindness once more.

loans.use: to start up an additional business, in order to generate more income and to provide a better future for her children.

loans.name: Jennifer Andrea

texts.es:
Jennifer es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad que gracias a su negocio de venta de comidas puede pagar sus estudios y dar un pequeño aporte a su hogar, una actividad que la hace sentir feliz ya que ella misma genera sus propios recursos y no debe depender de nadie.
Está talentosa mujer investigo y se capacito empíricamente en el negocio y hoy su negocio de venta de limonadas naturales es casi que le único que se ven el sector y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de otro carro para vender productos líquidos.
Esta Emprendedora mujer aspira en un periodo de 5 años tener una franquicia de carros por el municipio ofrecer sus bebidas y muy pronto los acompañara con alimentos.
Jennifer estará ansiosa esperando tu ayuda.
texts.en:
Jennifer, 20, is a young woman who's able to pay for her studies and give a bit of support to her household thanks to her business selling food.  Her job makes her happy because she earns her own income and doesn't have to depend on anyone.

This talented woman did her research and taught herself the business, and now her natural lemonade business is almost the only one in the area.  That's why she's requesting a loan to buy another cart to sell beverages.

This enterprising woman wants to have a franchise of carts around town within five years to sell her beverages, and soon she'll follow up with food.

Jennifer will be awaiting your help anxiously.

loans.use: to buy a cart for beverages and offer work to another person

loans.name: El Naranjal Group

texts.es:
Naranjal es el nombre de un grupo ubicado a una hora del centro del municipio, cabe mencionar que para llegar a la localidad donde se consolidó el grupo se debe viajar en trasporte particular o taxi colectivo pues la ruta del autobús ha cambiado. El camino por recorrer es terracería, a los costados se pueden apreciar sembradíos de caña, potreros y parte del cerro, la mayoría de las viviendas cuenta con un pozo del cual se abastecen de agua.

El nombre  del grupo surgió debido a que en la casa de la señora Francisca donde se llevan a cabo los pagos hay más de 15 árboles de naranjas.

El grupo está conformado por las siguientes personas:
Francisca - Siembra de caña
Rosa - Siembra de caña
Angelica –Venta De Ropa
Ricardo –Venta De Refrescos

Ricardo es uno de los integrantes del  grupo, tiene 25 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en el campo para poder  solventar los gastos del hogar y ayudar a que sus 2 hermanos continúen estudiando. Por la misma razón, hace 2 años decidió iniciar a vender refrescos en casa e incrementar sus ingresos. Al recordar cómo inició su negocio, Ricardo comenta que había clientes que no le terminaban de pagar e incluso pensó en dejar de vender, mas al darse cuenta del  apoyo que significaba para su madre, continuó trabajando y hoy en día vende más variedad de sabores de refrescos y en mayor cantidad. Ahora que la época de cosecha de caña ha iniciado en su región, vende refrescos a la gente que trabaja en los sembradíos. Ricardo disfruta mucho esta temporada no sólo porque aumenta sus ganancias sino porque le gusta el olor a caña quemada después de que los trabajadores limpian los terrenos. 

Ricardo necesita un préstamo para invertir en bebidas de distintos tamaños y vasos desechables para ayudar a refrescar a todas las personas que trabajan durante todo el día en los sembradíos. “Doy gracias a dios por permitirme ser quien soy y darme la gran familia que tengo ellos son la fuerza principal para continuar trabajando arduamente".

*La fotografía se tomó en una localidad cercana de donde se encuentra el grupo.
texts.en:
The group's name results from the fact that at Francisca's house, where the group meets to make their payments, there are more than 15 orange trees.

The group is composed of the following persons: Francisca and Rosa, who sow sugar cane; Angelica who sells clothes; and Ricardo, who sells soft drinks.

Ricardo, a member of the group, is 25 years old and works in the countryside to cover household expenses and help his two brothers who are still studying. For the same reason, two years ago he decided to begin selling soft drinks in his house to increase his income. Commenting on how he came to start his business, Ricardo says that there were customers who never finished paying and he thought about ending the business, but after considering the help it meant for his mother, he continued working and today, he sells a greater variety of flavors of soft drinks and in larger quantities. Presently, sugar cane harvesting season has begun in the region, and he is selling soft drinks to workers in the fields. Ricardo enjoys this season, not only because his earnings increase but because he likes the smell of burned cane after the workers burn off the land.

Ricardo needs a loan to invest in drinks of different sizes as well as disposable cups to help refresh the people who work all day long in the fields. He says “I give thanks to God for permitting me to be who I am and giving me the large family that I have. They are my principal motive for continuing to work so hard.”

Naranjal is the name of the group, located an hour from the center of the municipality. It's worth mentioning that upon arriving at the locality where the group was organized, one has to travel in personal transportation or by collective taxi, since the bus route has changed. Along the road we use to reach this terraced area, one sees the cane fields, pastures, and part of the hill. The majority of the houses have a well to supply their water.

*The photograph was taken in a locality near where the group meets.

loans.use: buy soft drinks in distinct sizes to sell and, also, disposable cups for customers.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Shakshi Sss Group

texts.en:
Sunita, 45, is married with three children. She lives and works in the Chhindwara District, a rural area in Madhya Pradesh state in India.

She has a retail business selling fruit and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Sunita is the leader of a ten-member group, the Shakshi Sss Group. In 2012, Sunita joined Peoples Forum. This will be the first loan with Peoples Forum for Shakshi Sss Group.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Sunita is her lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell.

Sunita hopes that her business will do well. With her profits, she hopes to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Good Samaritan Public School Group (E)

texts.en:
Nengcha, age 30, is a resident of Ichailamlam village which is situated about 30 kilometres from Imphal town. Both she and her husband are engaged in cultivation for their livelihood. They live with their three sons. She sends her sons for schooling at Good Samaritan Public School, Saikul. She is the featured borrower of the group and pictured with her hand raised, along with her son. 

The family could hardly pay for the children’s school fees regularly since their income is irregular. The children sometimes skip classes due to non-clearance of school fees to avoid discomforting moments from the peers and the school authorities. It hinders their attendance performance which is not good for a student. 

Considering all theis, Nengcha feels unhappy as a mother and thought about a solution to their problems. Fortunately, she came across a friend who told her about the education loan. She feels excited and very happy to hear the news. She feels relieved and enlightened because she does not need to worry about her children's annual school fees anymore. The children will no longer face those discomforting moments in their school environment for non-payments of fees. With the Kiva loan, she will pay the school admission fees and annual expenses of her son for the academic year 2015. 

All the group members are very happy to get the loan and send their warm wishes to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay for school admission fees and other annual expenses for the new academic session 2015.

loans.name: Black Tiger Group

texts.en:
Elani is the featured borrower of the Black Tiger Group. She and the other group members have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come to work in Lebanon in order to earn a better income to support their families back in the Philippines.

Elani is 42 years old, divorced, and has three children. She is employed as a housekeeper. Her earnings covers the expenses and needs of her children. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to pay her children's school tuition fees. She hopes to improve their living conditions.

Elani is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 34 years old, married to Eunice, and blessed with three children ages ten, four, and seven months. He has been farming for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He has applied for his fifth loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for basic family needs. He hopes to grow his business and venture into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 22 years old, married to Wanjiru and they are blessed with a 2-year-old child.

James is a farmer and has been in business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

James has requested his third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 24,000 to buy potatoes for resale. As the festive season nears, the demand for potatoes is increasing so James is hoping to realize more profits. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

James desires to see his children educated for life. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to pay their school fees. 

His hopes and dreams for the future is to expand his potato business for a better life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 34 years old and is married with three children, ages 8 to 13  and all in school. He is a Tigo mobile phone distributor and has been in a business for four years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more air time and mobile phones to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and welfare.

loans.use: To buy more air time and mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim is a Ugandan married man with two children. He lives in Kagadi where he sells produce and operates a decoration shop to earn a living. Despite a lot of competition, he has a dream of expanding his business to greater heights and to become an events manager, thus strengthening his relationship with his customers and gaining more profit. Karim is requesting a loan to buy decorating materials for selling ahead of the Christmas Season.

loans.use: to buy decorating materials for selling ahead of the Christmas Season.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 30-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift Valley. She owns a small piece of land together with her lovely 45-year-old husband, and they have been blessed with three children. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for five years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a farm-produce-motorcycle-transportation business.

From Kiva lenders, Sarah is seeking a loan worth KES 50,000 to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Sarah access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Sarah’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 40 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 8 and 20, all of whom go to school. She has a salon and has been in business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment such as machines and combs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more equipment such as machines and combs for sale.

loans.name: Abudara

texts.en: Abudara is a hardworking, Ugandan married man. He lives in Kagadi where he operates a wholesale and retail shop to look after the family. He hopes to grow his business despite competition and high license fees, which hinders his development goal of opening up outlets in the nearby centers, hence reducing net profits. Abudara is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 37-year-old, hardworking man living in Kagadi-Uganda with four children. He operates a boutique selling first hand clothes to the young and old to generate income. He has a dream of growing his business into a modern business, though he is challenged by competition. John is asking for a loan to buy clothes to sell, targeting the festive season when demand is high.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hard-working, married Ugandan man living in Kagadi. He has been selling produce and teaching since 2009. He hopes for success in his business despite price fluctuations. Joseph intends to use a loan to buy rice and ground nuts for selling.

loans.use: to buy rice and ground nuts for selling.

loans.name: Lina Paola

texts.es:
Esta temporada de diciembre es inquietante, de mucho movimiento, y esto es lo que quiere aprovechar Lina una joven de 24 años de edad propietaria de una tienda que ella misma inicio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente.
Lina aprendió del negocio sola y su propósito con su tienda es poder generar recursos y sustento para su hijo de 7 meses de edad, por ello trabaja y siempre busca mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
Lina le incomoda algo y es pagar un arriendo cada mes y esa molestia es el principal motivo para trabajar fuertemente pues quiere comprar una casa y su idea es que para el otro año sacar una casa e ir pagándola poco a poco.
Para completar esta meta Lina debe mejorar sus ventas, es por ello que solicita un crédito para comprar variedad de surtido entre carnes, frutas, verduras, granos, gaseosas, cervezas, víveres pues se la meterá toda a su tienda que presenta la mayor cantidad de ventas en el mes de diciembre.
texts.en:
The December season can be worrisome because there’s a lot of activity, but Lina wants to take advantage of this. She is a young woman who is 24 years of age and the owner of a store. She started her business with great pleasure and now works independently at her chosen vocation.

Lina learned the business on her own and her intention for opening a store was to generate income so that she could sustain her seven-month-old son. For this reason, she works and is always looking to improve and expand her business.

Lina is bothered by having to pay rent each month and this annoyance is her main reason for working hard. She wants to buy a house and her plan is to acquire one within another year and begin paying it off a little bit at a time.

In order to accomplish this goal, Lina must improve her sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a variety of inventory such as meats, fruits, vegetables, grains, sodas, beer, and other provisions. All of this will help her store achieve a greater amount of sales in the month of December.

loans.use: to buy meats, fruits, vegetables, grains, sodas, beer, and other provisions for her store.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is a 28-year-old married man from Gaza City who lives with his wife and one small son. Ramiz works for a local firm and earns a low income. During the last wave of violence in Gaza, the family home was damaged and now it is uninhabitable. Ramiz needs to fix the building first and then buy furniture because the old furniture is unusable. 
Ramiz took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy construction supplies to fix and rebuild parts of the family home. By taking this loan, Ramiz and his family will be able to live again in the family home.
Ramiz appears in the photo in his damaged home

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to fix and rebuild parts of the family home.

loans.name: Dúo Somos De Esquipulas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Somos de Esquipulas 
Doña Vicenta de 53 años de edad,empezó su negocio hace 3 años vendiendo   ropa interior invirtiendo q300.00 hasta llegar a tener un mejor negocio como el que tiene hasta ahora, con la ayuda que le ha brindado kiva agradece a Dios por darle cada día mas salud y sabiduría para seguir adelante con su negocio,esta solicitando este credito para la compra ropa interior en variedad para la venta.
texts.en:
“Somos de Esquipulas” Group

Doña Vicenta is 53 years old. She started her business of selling undergarments three years ago by investing 300 GTQ. Now she has a better business than when she started with the help that Kiva has offered. Thanks to God, she is able to be in better health and have the wisdom to continue forward with her business.

Vicenta is requesting a loan in order to buy a variety of undergarments that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Nuwa

texts.en: Nuwa is aged 34, and he is married with four children and two attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He started his business of operating a depot slowly, mainly selling sodas and beers. He hopes to grow his business and to construct his commercial house to avoid paying rental fees, which are quite high. He will use the loan facility to buy more sodas and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Beneditor

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Beneditor. She is a 46-year-old, farmer from Kapkoi village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She lives together with her husband and nine children on a small piece of land, where she keeps poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. For ten years, her primary sources of income have been eggs and horticultural produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs.  Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. 

Beneditor made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities. Sometime last month, she applied for a loan for expanding her horticulture farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to her children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Beneditor's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Katikengeye Tulibamwe Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, who sells second hand clothes, is a married lady living in Kagadi Uganda.

She started her business in 2014 to supplement the income she earns from a restaurant, farming and rentals. She desires to grow her business despite challenges of competition and price changes of food products.

Rosemary is asking for a loan to buy clothes to sell. She is a member of Katikengeye Tulibamwe Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 50 years old, married to Vincent and blessed with four school-age children. She has been buying and selling dry maize for the last 14 years and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000.

She has applied for her second loan of 10,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more dry maize for sale. 

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more dry maize for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Navdurga Group

texts.en:
Navdurga is a group which consists of 14 women from a small village in Chhindwara district of Madhya Pradesh, India. They applied for a loan of 210,000 INR from Peoples Forum.

Sonam is the leader of the group. She is a 23-year-old married woman, and a mother of two children, living with them in a small house which needs expanding. That house is not enough for all the members of the family; it consists of few rooms. Sonam is an uneducated woman, and works as a laborer for others, with a small daily wage. That wage is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family and to expand the house. 

Sonam wants to start a grocery shop so that she will be able to expand her house by saving some money to do that. For this reason, Sonam turned to Peoples Forum and took out a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase basic household items in bulk to resell.

Sonam is happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase basic household items in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Alshayma

texts.en:
Alshayma is a 25-year-old, married woman from Jenin City. She is a mother for two young daughters. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family’s needs. Alshayma and her husband have an agricultural farm where they plant olive trees. It is a very good business and supports the family with a good income. 

Alshayma took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm. This will help her to increase the production and also the income. Alshayma appears in the photo in the family farm.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old. She is married to Ngaruiya, and together they have been blessed with three children who are 13, 10 and 9 years respectively. Mary sells groceries, a business she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Mary has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenyan of KES 78,000, which she will use to add stock of groceries to sell. Such groceries include potatoes, carrots, assorted indigenous green vegetables, tomatoes and kales. 

With the anticipated profits, Mary will be able to repay her loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to attract more customers and to keep making profits.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
