Esperance is 47 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 24 and 27 years and both of them are married.

Esperance sells fruit and has been in business for 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more mangoes and oranges to resell.

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes and oranges to resell.

loans.name: Emma Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the featured borrower of Emma Group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. They have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their loved ones back in the Philippines.

Josefina is a 57-year-old, married mother of three children, who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and to improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Josefina is the second lady on the left of the photo with respect to the other group members. Josephine is the first lady on the left, Rolet is the first lady on the right, and Gemma is the second lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Este pequeño fogón de 2 puesto le ha dado la oportunidad a Sandra de generar sus propios ingresos a partir de la venta de alimentos que su madre le enseño hacer. 
Es una bella morena de 21 años de edad que inicio su negocio por necesidad económica y aspira a poder generar empleo, y quiere ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que en muchas ocasiones no tiene para un alimento, para pagar una cuenta lo que hizo a Sandra salir a buscar oportunidades y capital para apoyar a su madre.
Con la ayuda de un crédito Sandra quiere comprar utensilios y ampliar su negocio comprando otro fogón y más implementos para preparar comidas para un mayor número de personas.
Sandra espera tu ayuda, esta joven que quiere apoyar a su madre y que juntas saquen la casa y su familia adelante.
texts.en:
This small two-burner cooktop gave Sandra the opportunity to generate her own income. She uses it to sell dishes that her mother taught her how to prepare.

This lovely 21-year-old woman started her business out of financial necessity. She aspires to create jobs and also wants to improve her conditions at home. On many occasions, she has had to go without food in order to pay another bill. This motivated Sandra to look for opportunities and capital so that she could help her mother.

With the help of this loan, Sandra wants to buy utensils and expand her business by acquiring another cooktop. As a result, she will have more equipment for preparing food for a greater number of people.

With the assistance that Sandra hopes to receive, this young woman will be able to support her mother and both of them can sustain their household and move their family forward.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooktop and utensils so that she can prepare more food orders.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is age 27, and a single hardworking woman, charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child, age four who attends school. She runs a retail shop mainly selling of sugar, salt, and soap, among other items. She gets additional income from farming and owning a bar. She desires to expand and develop her business. She will use the loan facility to buy more soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer from Tajiri village in Kaduna. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María, de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo, juntos procrearon 10 hijos de los cuales solo 5 están con ella, pues los otros viven en el extranjero y están casados, María recibe ayuda económica de parte de sus hijos mayores, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Ella tiene una familia muy numerosa por lo que junto a su esposo con esfuerzo y trabajo han logrado salir adelante  y le han brindado educación, alimento, vestuario y todo lo necesario a sus hijos.

María ha emprendido un pequeño negocio que es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo ya lleva varios meses en esta actividad y al parecer le va muy bien.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la compra, de perfumes, desodorantes, cosméticos, entre otros. Su táctica dentro del negocio es comprar productos en variedades y por mayoreo, para luego venderlo a sus clientes y dándoles la oportunidad de cancelar poco a poco.

María desea que Dios le dé siempre salud para estar bien para seguir cuidando de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives with her husband. They have 10 children, but only five still live with them. The others live abroad and are married. María receives financial support from her grown children. Her husband works in agriculture. María’s family is quite large, so she and her husband must work hard in order to get ahead and provide for education, food, clothes, and all of the other needs for their children.

María started a small business in which she sells beauty products through catalogs. She has been in this business for several months and it appears to be doing very well. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, deodorants, cosmetics, and other products. Her business strategy is to buy a variety of products in bulk and then sell them to her customers. She gives them the opportunity to pay a little bit at a time.

María hopes that God will always grant her health so that she can continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello Lenders, meet Margaret. She is a 55-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley of Kenya. Margaret and her husband have been blessed with eleven children. For 20 years Margaret has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. 

Despite prevailing animal diseases, Margaret finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Margaret, however, is taking this a little step further. Margaret is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Abesigwa Mulika Farmers Group

texts.en:
Margret is a 26-year-old married and hardworking woman living in Kagadi, Uganda with three children. She sells alcohol and earns income from farming. She hopes to grow her business despite a lot of price fluctuations, unpredictable weather changes, and defaulters. 

Margret is asking for a loan to buy more alcohol for selling. She is a member of Abesigwa Mulika where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol for resale

loans.name: Bukuru Sung-Bagurugu Group

texts.en:
Fati is a 40-year-old, married woman living with her husband and three children in Bagurugu, a community in Northern Ghana. Fati is the one placing the hand on the basin of shea nuts among those squatting in the group picture. Their group is called Bukuru Sung-Bagurugu Women Association.

All the members are involved in the business of processing shea nuts into shea butter. They have been in the business for the past three years. They process high premium shea butter, some of which is sold to aggregators and are exported to the European and USA markets. 

Fati sells the butter to many other customers in northern Ghana. The group is therefore requesting for a loan of GHS 11,900. Fiti’s share of the loan would be used to buy shea nuts for her shea butter processing business.
 
Fati can now buy school uniforms for her children and prepare better food for the family due to the increased income from her previous loan. She hopes to keep supporting her family to have regular food to eat,  to buy educational materials for her three children, and to repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for her shea butter processing business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man, aged 36 years, with three children aged 11, 07, and 3; two children are attending different schools. He deals in the sale of agricultural produce such as corn and beans and works five days a week and six hours a day.

He also gets additional income from public service. He has been in this business since 2008 and was motivated by the profitability of the business. His businesses are located in rural areas of Rakai district. 

Godfrey hopes to use the loan to buy a stock of beans for his resale business.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his capital base so that he improves his profits. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations, limited capital and unfavorable weather conditions which affect his business. He is described as an honest and hard-working man in business.

loans.use: To buy dried beans for resale

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a final-year student at the University of Ghana, studying for a Diploma in Youth Development Work. The loan is to help pay for his school fees. Prior to this loan, Kingsbridge Microfinance has been supporting him with his fees.

He has always had the drive to help people, thus taking a course in youth development. This, he said, would equip him with the needed knowledge in order to educate his community.

His friends gave him the push to further his education, because they got higher promotion and salary increments after the completion of their education and ordered him about, and that gives him the drive to further his education.

In the next five to ten years, he would have been promoted earlier than is expected and he would also stand the chance of getting job opportunities when he gets out of the military service.

Without the help of this loan facility, he has no other alternative than to defer his schooling and save some of his income and go back to school.

There are so many untapped natural resources in his country, so he would like investors to explore such areas.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for making Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Falasteen

texts.en:
Falasteen is a 26-year-old married woman from Khan Younis. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a simple house. Falasteen started her own business, which is a stall where she sells cleaning products. She buys them from wholesalers and tries to sell them for a lower price than big stores. It is a good business that supports her family with a good income. 

Falasteen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more cleaning products to resell. This will increase her sales and also her income. 

Falasteen appears in the photo, working at her stall.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Esther joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Danyaya, Abubakar, and Rahila.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Esther would have had to sell her maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Esther can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Esther spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eduardo Orlando

texts.es:
Eduardo, de 64 años de edad, actualmente casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive junto con su esposa que es ama de casa.- Sus hijos todavía estudian, Eduardo González es una persona trabajadora que siempre busca lo mejor para su familia, vive cerca de la playa y tiene 45 años de experiencia en el área de pesca.

Con este trabajo él mantiene a su familia, Eduardo tiene desventajas en algunas temporadas del año, por problemas de riesgo, en temporadas de inviernos él no puede ir a pescar y esto le afecta económicamente.

Otro inconveniente es que el no posee su propia lancha para navegar y poder conseguir más pescados. Eduardo con el crédito es para comprar una lancha nueva para poder pescar y obtener mejores ganancias y así satisfacer las necesidades básica de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y para sus hijos desea que en un futuro no solo estudien un bachillerato sino que también saquen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Eduardo, aged 64, is married, has six children and lives with his wife, who is a homemaker. His children are still still at school. Eduardo is a hardworking person who wants the best for his family. He lives close to the beach and has 45 years of experience in fishing and it is with this that he supports his family.

Eduardo suffers from the disadvantage that he is not able to go out fishing during the winter due to the risk involved, which naturally affects him economically. A further inconvenience is that he does not own a boat himself to go out fishing more.

The loan Eduardo is asking for is intended for the purchase of a new boat so that he would be able to go out fishing and increase his income. Thus, he could provide for his household and improve the quality of life of his family.
He hopes that his children will not only finish high school but also go to university.

loans.use: to buy a new boat so as to be able to fish and increase his income

loans.name: Asif Ali

texts.en:
M. Sagheer is 33 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of two children. He is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting his family.

He belongs to a poor family; his whole family depends upon the generated income through his embroidery work. He has been learning this art from his childhood, and now he adopted it for his occupation. He enabled himself to be independent and earn sufficient income.

He requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stock of thread, silk, fancy items, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

He hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for him and for his family. M. Sagheer is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance his embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes and palm oil for selling.

loans.name: Willian Antonio

texts.es:
Willian de 23 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de  3 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato. Pero sigue con sus estudios los fines de semana con el fin de superarse para darle lo mejor a su hijo.

Willian presta sus servicios como Dj en una discomóvil de la ciudad y normalmente trabaja de vendedor en una librería. Solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles para su casa y darle comodidad a su familia, poco a poco ir comprando lo que necesita en el hogar. Sueña con sacar su título universitario y optar a un empleo formal.
texts.en:
Willian is 23 years old. He lives with his girlfriend and has a three-year-old son. He has a high school education. But he is going to school on weekends in order to improve himself and give what's best to his son. Willian provides his services as DJ at a mobile disco in the city, and usually works as a clerk at a book store. 

He is requesting this loan to buy furniture for his house and give his family more comfort. He wants to buy what he needs for the house little by little. His goal is to earn a college degree and access formal employment.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her roof.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 32 years old. She is married with three children aged between 1 and 8 years; all of them go to school. She sells fruits and has been selling in a business for six years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more mangoes, lemons, and oranges for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, lemons, and oranges for sale.

loans.name: Loryn Group

texts.en:
Lorina is the featured borrower of Loryn Group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Lorina is a 34-year-old single mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Lorina is the second lady from the right in the photo. With respect to the other group members, Noraliza is the first lady on the right, Teresita is the first lady on the left, and Edlen is the second lady from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Josselyn Tatiana

texts.es:
Josselyn de 25 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 5 años de edad y 6 meses de edad, su hija mayor estudia 1er grado de educación básica, ella estudió hasta bachillerato, su pareja es agricultor de granos básicos, solo él y sus hijas viven con ella.

Josselyn es ama de casa, sus ingresos dependen del trabajo de su pareja, que por herencia se dedica a la caficultura, pero también tiene una granja de pollos situada a 12 kilómetros de su casa. Solicita el préstamo para reparar el techo de su casa y comprar una nueva camada de pollos para la granja de su pareja.

Su sueño es aumentar la granja de pollos para mejorar los ingresos de su familia con la venta.
texts.en:
Josselyn is 25 years old, lives in a partnership and has two children, aged 5 and half a year. Her eldest daughter is in the first grade of elementary school. Josselyn completed high school.

Her partner is a basic grains farmer and he and her two children live with her. She is a homemaker and therefore financially dependent on her partner, who inherited a coffee plantation but also has a chicken farm situated 12km from the house.

Josselyn is asking for the loan to repair the roof of her home and to buy a new flock of chickens for her partner's farm.
Her dream is to expand the chicken farm so as to improve the family income with the sales.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house and to buy a new flock of chickens.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora de 58 años de edad, se separó de su pareja hace diez años, tiene 3 hijos de 37, 28 y 25 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, dos de sus hijos ahora viven en el extranjero, ella vive con uno de sus hijos y dos nietos que la apoyan económicamente.

Teodora se dedica a la agricultura, desde joven trabajo en lo mismo con su familia, tiene cerca de 40 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, por lo general cultiva maíz y frijol tal y como se lo enseñaron sus padres. Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 12:00 m.

Solicita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra para cosechar el cultivo de maíz y frijol que sembró. Teodora espera Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando y apoyando a la familia en lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Teodora is 58 years old. She separated from her partner ten tears ago and has three children, ages 37, 28, and 25. She didn't have a chance to go to school. Two of her children now live abroad, and she lives with the other one and two grandchildren. They help her financially.

Teodora works as a farmer, as she used to with her family when she was young. She has been farming for nearly forty years. In general she grows corn and beans, just like her parents taught her. Her work schedule is from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm. 

She is requesting this loan to pay for labor to harvest the corn and bean crops that she has planted. Teodora hopes that God will allow her to continue working and helping her family as much as she can.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest her corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano de 54 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijas de 11 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudia 4° grado de educación básica. Él solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado. Solo su pareja y sus hijas dependen de él.

Victoriano elabora petates desde que tenía 20 años, lo hace en su casa y desde hace 15 años tiene una tienda en la que se involucra su pareja. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar petates y productos como granos básicos, productos de higiene personal golosinas y demás para su tienda. Espera Dios le presta vida para formar académicamente a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 54 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has two daughters, ages eleven and three. The older one is in fourth grade of elementary school. He was only able to get a fourth grade education. His wife and daughters depend on him.

Victoriano has been making mats since he was twenty years old. He does this from home, and fifteen years ago he opened a store where his wife helps him. He is requesting this loan to buy materials to make mats, as well as products like basic grains, personal hygiene products, sweets, and other items for his store. He hopes God will allow him put his daughters through school.

loans.use: to buy materials to make mats, as well as products like basic grains, toiletries, sweets, and other items for his store.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: Helene is 37 years old. She is married and has five children, aged between 7 and 17 years. All them go to school. Helene has a shop and has been in business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, lotion, cooking oil, and sugar to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption, and to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more salt, lotion, cooking oil, and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a professional camera for his university studies in journalism and photography.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice used the previous loan to buy shoes for selling. 

Loice is a thirty-eight-year-old woman, married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Loice sells shoes and also owns a transport business as additional income. She has a dream of expanding her business and educating her children. However, she is faced with the challenge of limited capital and market competition. 

Loice wants money to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is a 37-year-old married mother of two children aged 10 and 14 years, both of whom go to school. She has had a shop for 15 years. 

With the loan, Cecile would like to buy more sugar, millet and rice to resell. She will reinvest her profits and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, millet and rice to resell.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdu can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. Like other Babban Gona members, Abdu is looking to earn a better income, to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to make more money, for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
Dúo Cristo Rey de Reyes
Este dúo esta conformado por Demetria y Herminia ambas son casada y madres de familia ellas son originarias de Sumpango, Herminia se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como por ejemplo ejote, maíz, frijol etc.y tambien a la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos Todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para poder trasladarse en el lugar en donde ella y su esposo trabajan diariamente el Cultivo, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas para cultivo y  compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: This duo is comprised of Demetria and Herminia, both of whom are married and mothers from Sumpango. Herminia makes a living planting vegetables such as green beans, corn, beans etc., and also making traditional fabrics. She wakes up very early every day to travel to her and her husband’s workplace where they cultivate the vegetables. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds for cultivation, and to purchase raw materials to make and sell her traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make and sell her traditional fabrics, and to buy seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mercy and Hafsah.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; and to store his harvest so he can sell his maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Alhaji Dayyabu

texts.en: Alhaji Dayyabu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Dayyabu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Dayyabu can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. When asked about his goals, Alhaji Dayyabu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, to ensure that his children (Shehu, Adamu and Rufai) are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en:
Leatu is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Emuran and Safullashi.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Leatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate needs for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Leatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Leatu  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to ensure that they eventually can attain professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Bilha, Yahaya and Ibrahim.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate needs for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Haruna  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure they are eventually able to have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Gilma

texts.es: María tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, su hijo y su nieta de 14 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida. María desea aprovechar esta temporada dado que por experiencia en el negocio es la época donde sus ventas se incrementan, y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, pantalones, blusas, etc. con el fin de aumentar ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, her son and her 14-year-old granddaughter. Maria works selling second-hand clothing and has been doing so for a long time. This is how she makes her living. 

María wants to take advantage of this season, given that in her experience in the business this is the time when her sales increase and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity. Therefore she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of clothing such as: skirts, dresses, pants, blouses, etc. in order to increase sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, pants, blouses, etc. for the shop

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jamilu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Jamilu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, and to store his harvest so he can sell his maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 24-year-old widow. She lives in Kaspi district, with her pensioner mother-in-law, brother-in-law, and sister-in-law. Her sister-in-law gets an invalid pension from a government institution, which is only enough for medicines.

Teona decided to start up a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 400 US Dollars. With the received credit Teona will purchase used clothes at wholesale prices, which she will resell at higher prices. This will give her a chance to generate income and help her family members, financially. Teona awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade in used clothes and generate income.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 45 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder Pascual tiene 38 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el es casado y cuenta con tres hijos los cuales son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad los hijos se ha convertido el motivo principal par poder salir adelante en la vida y tener un futuro mejor.
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 15 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en la vida y la construcción de su vivienda para tener una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 45 year old entrepreneurial and dedicated man who wants to succeed in life. He is not defeated by the obstacles that life gives him, but rather seeks to achieve all of his thoughts and dreams. He is married and has three children who are excellent students in the community school. His children have become his main motivation to get ahead in life and have a better future.

He makes a living producing bananas in the community where he lives. His parents taught him the trade 15 years ago. He sells his product in the market and around his community, and thus has an income to improve his family’s living conditions.

He will use the loan to maintain his banana plants, as it is very important that the plants produce premium quality fruits so that he will not lose customers he counts on.

His dreams are to plant more banana trees, and to see his children grow and become professionals, and to build a home to have more adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain his banana trees.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 38 years old, married to Orema, and has been blessed with three children, aged 18, 15, and 11 years. She has been selling dried maize to her customers for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of 10,000 KES. She intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of dried maize to sell.

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 29 years old. He is not married. He sells wood and firewood and has been in business for six years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more wood and firewood to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and welfare.

loans.use: to buy more wood and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Phylice

texts.en:
Three years ago, Phylice started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Matunda, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of five children sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kitale area. Phylice has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high. 

Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Phylice can achieve their dreams and goals. 

Phylice believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en: Buhari is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Buhari can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Buhari, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en: Jean Marie Vianney is 31 years old. He is married and has two children, aged 2 and 5 years. One of his children goes to school. He has a bar and has been in business for two years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more soda and beer to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and welfare.

loans.use: to buy more soda and beer to resell.

loans.name: Beautiful Girls 2 Group

texts.en:
Vincenta is the featured borrower of Beautiful Girls 2 group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Vincenta is a 38-year-old married mother of one child. She is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved child and improve his living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan to pay her child's school tuition fees in the Philippines.

Vincenta is the second lady from the right in the photo. With respect to the other group members, Ma. Theresa is the first lady on the right, Erlinda is the first lady on the left, and Marilou is the second lady from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru: Анор уроженка района Дангара. Ей 56 лет. Более 13 лет своей жизни она посвятила животноводству. Анор разводит коров и быков при дворе своего дома и от этой деятельности получает хорошую прибыль для поддержания семьи. Муж и сын занимаются ремонтом домов, а дочь помогает матери в ее деле. Анор сейчас хотела бы расширить поголовья своих скотов и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. Благодаря кредиту она сможет приобрести пару крупнорогатых скотов и увеличить доход от их продаж, что улучшит экономическое положение семьи.
texts.en: Anor is a native of the Dangara district. She is 56 years old. She devoted over 13 years of her life to animal husbandry. Anor fattens up cows and bulls in her home yard and earns a good profit from this business to support her family. Her husband and son are involved in home repairs, and daughter helps the mother with her business. Now Anor wants to increase her livestock headcount and requested a loan for this goal. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy a couple of cows and increase her income from their resale, which will then improve her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
From Mayorga, Leyte, Marissa is an industrious married mother of two children, ages seven and five years. For almost seven years she has had a food-vending business, selling snacks such as puto (rice cakes). She also raises and sells hogs. 

Marissa has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more pig feed and food vending ingredients. This loan will be a great help in improving her daily earnings, and hopefully she will be able to provide good food for the whole family.

In the future, Marissa would like to maximize all the materials provided to her for a sustainable livelihood as well as finance the education of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more pig feed and ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en: Gorretti is single with five children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family. Gorretti operates a kiosk at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for 14 years and she works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, flour, soda, rice, soap, biscuits, sweets, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a refrigerator to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, sweets, crates of soda, boxes of soap, and rice

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.ru:
Гайбулло  с малых лет занимался  земледелием и животноводством. Ему 51 лет. Он женат. Все его дети обустроены и семейные, кроме одного который живет с ним. Скотоводством он занимается уже более 30 лет и  знает всё об этом, и сын помогает ему в этом, жена продаёт молоко и молочные продукты домашнего приготовления. Развивая скот он  хочет увеличить доход семьи . Он также занимается  земледелием в приусадебном участке. Он выращивает  сельхозкултуры. Он вместе с семьёй решил  обратится  в МДО Арванд за  кредитом для  животноводства.  
	Он благодарит МДО  Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Gaybullo has been involved in farming and animal husbandry since a very young age. He is 51 years old and married. All of his children are situated and have families, except one, who lives with Gaybullo. Gaybullo has been involved in animal husbandry for over 30 years and knows everything about it. His wife sells milk and home-made dairy products. He wants to increase the family's income by fattening up livestock. He is also involved in farming on the land by his house. He grows agricultural crops. He and his family decided to request a loan from MDO Arvand for the animal husbandry business. He is grateful to MDO Arvand for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a male Kiva borrower. He has two children with ages 3 years and 6 years. He describes himself to be self-reliant. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is in a good location and his primary customers are middle class customers. 

Ali describes his biggest business challenge to be that the rainy season affects business. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to own two more shops within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have as many clothes shops as possible. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to add still more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Hajrije

texts.en:
Hajrije lives in the house seen in the background of the photograph. She is seeking your financial help and compassion to help her build some stairs for the home. Hajrije is very poor and was widowed long ago. “Being all by myself has been very difficult. I had one child to raise, who now is 28 years old and has immigrated to a neighboring country. But, still, it was hard. I was poor and will remain poor and that is for certain, unfortunately,” Hajrije ended her conversation with the sub-branch assistant. 

Hajrije has one cow so far and sells the raw milk to locals. She also plants and sells some veggies. What is characteristic in Hajrije's district is that almost everyone is a Muslim devotee and all of their sons have immigrated either to England or Greece. Hajrije wants to thank you all in advance for your financial help.

loans.use: to build some stairs for the poorly-built house seen in the background of the photograph

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 34 years old. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 11 years; all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been in business for five years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 31 years old. She is married with 3 children between 3 and 11 years old; all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, beans, maize flour and rice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, beans, maize flour and rice to resell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de profesión comerciante, de 55 años de edad, es soltero y solo vive con una hermana, él cursó su 9° grado en una escuela pública; después de sus estudios se ha dedicado al trabajo para mejorar su condición de vida, sus conocimientos están enfocados en el área de electrónica, obtuvo experiencia desempeñándose como ayudante en otros talleres en donde desarrollo sus capacidades. 

Carlos tiene un taller de Electrónica desde hace 3 años, él y su hermana lo administran pues ella también tiene conocimientos básicos de electrónica. 

Carlos desea mejorar su taller y para eso solicita el credito, para comprar mejores herramientas tales como: llaves, destornillador, tenazas entre otros;  también quiere ampliar el local donde tiene el taller, con el objetivo de atender mejor a sus clientes, con este negocio espera tener un mejor futuro y mejor calidad de vida para él y su hermana.
texts.en: Carlos works as a tradesman. He is 55 years old, single, and lives with his sister. He studied until 9th grade in a public school and has been working ever since to improve his living conditions. He specializes in the field of electronics, a skill he developed by working as an assistant for other repair shops. Carlos has had his own electronics repair shop for three years. He manages the business together with his sister, who also has basic electronics knowledge. Carlos would like to improve his shop and is thus requesting a loan to to buy better tools, such as wrenches, screwdrivers, and pliers, among others. He also would like to expand the premises in order to provide better service to his clients. He hopes that this business will enable him to improve his prospects and provide a better standard of living for him and his sister.

loans.use: to buy better tools, such as wrenches, screwdrivers, and pliers, among others.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en: Umaru is a maize farmer from Kaza village, in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Umaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Umaru can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Umaru, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gambo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gambo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Gambo expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken feed and groceries to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Nenita earns additional income raising pigs and fishing. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF).

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She is requesting 11,000 PHP through  NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Cheryl has been in this business for 10 years. Cheryl earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Phibian

texts.en:
Phibian is 21 years old and has two children. She is from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Other than doing domestic chores, Phibian is a very hardworking farmer, which she has been doing for three years. She has gained much experience through those years of farming. Phibian practices mixed farming. She grows maize and keeps dairy cows and has been able to earn a respectable income. She really enjoys taking care of her animals. 

Although Phibian has been earning a profit through farming, not everything has been easy for her. Her farm has not been producing as much harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. Phibian requested a loan for 15,000 KES, which she will use to buy farm implements. With this loan, she will be assured a bumper harvest and more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Phibian will reap more, which will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Phibiian’s plan is increase her farming and  save more money so that she can buy more land.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Michelle has been in this business for three years. Michelle earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Michelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to buy more farm land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nderagakura Group

texts.fr:
Chantal  fait partie du groupe  Nderagakura et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 35 ans  est mariée à Cyriaque, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de  5 à 10 ans, tous étudient.

Elle est tailleur depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de mètres de tissus pour la confection  des habits  à vendre,  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Chantal is a member of the Nderagakura group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and is married to Cyriaque, a mason. Together they have three children, aged between five and 10 years old. All the children attend school.

Chantal has been a tailor for ten years. She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy many meters of fabric, which she will make into clothing to resell in order to earn more.

loans.use: to buy many meters of fabric for making clothes to sell, to earn more.

loans.name: Maa Tarini B Group

texts.en:
Shantilata is an active lady of twenty-four years of age from Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. The lady standing in the middle raising her hand in the photo is Shantilata. She hails from a lower middle class family and lives with her husband and two children in a small tile house.

Shantilata has been running a paper plate and cup-making business in her house for the last five years with the help of her husband. At present she has one paper plate-making machine. She supplies her products to retailers of the same town and other villages in a ten-mile radius. She purchases raw materials from the nearest wholesale market, 200 kilometers away, on a monthly basis. 

This is her only source of income and she gets a monthly income of 5000 INR from this business. Out of this income she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. For her quality product and timely delivery, the demand for her unit is increasing day by day, but she is unable to meet the demand of the customers due to insufficient production due to lack of sufficient money. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

For this reason she formed a SHG (Self Help Group) named Maa tarini B with ten other like-minded women entrepreneurs from her locality and got a loan. From the present loan Shantilata has planned to purchase another paper plate making machine and raw materials like silver laminated paper, silver paper, gold laminated and gold paper, foil covered paper and poly-coated paper in bulk. She is very much hopeful that this will not only reduce her purchasing and transportation costs but also help to generate some additional income. Shantilata hopes to save enough to build a workshop for her business and give a better education to her son. 

The other nine members of the group are doing businesses like vegetable cultivation and vending, transport, electrical work, betel shop and sweet making and Tiffin stall.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a paper plate making machine and raw materials like silver and gold laminated  paper, foil covered paper and polycoated paper

loans.name: Edgar Ernesto

texts.es:
Edgar, es un joven de 20 años de edad, con 9º grado de estudio, ésta acompañado; pero siempre vive junto a su madre; Edgar tiene un año y seis meses de estar trabajando en la planta Marisol de mariscos, ahí desempeña su trabajo como cargador de sal; de eso vive y así puede mantener a su compañera de vida. 

Edgar, no posee transporte para viajar hasta la empresa donde trabaja y se le  hace difícil viajar en buses urbanos,  por la distancia de donde él reside, hacia el lugar de trabajo, por lo tanto se incrementan más sus gastos. El solicita el préstamo para comprar una Motocicleta que le beneficie y que le reduzca los gastos de transporte.

Lo que Edgar busca a futuro es mejorar  su economía y tener una mejor vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Edgar is a young man of 20 years with a 9th grade education. He is partnered, but he always lives with his mother. Edgar has been working for a year and six months at the Marisol shellfish plant. There, he performs his work was a salt loader. He lives from this and can therefore support his life partner.

Edgar doesn't have transportation to travel to the business where he works and it's difficult for him to travel on the urban buses, because of the distance where he lives to the place of work. Therefore, his expenses increase more. He is applying for the loan to buy a motorcycle to benefit him and reduce his transportation costs.

What Edgar looks forward to in the future is improving his economy and having a better life for he and his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that will benefit him and reduce his transportation expenses.

loans.name: Aimira

texts.ru: Аймира, 20 лет, замужем, образование средне-специальное, работает медсестрой. Аймира с 2012 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Аймиры есть 2 коровы, на ежедневной основе она продает молоко, в среднем 15 литров в день. Домашнее и экологически чистое оно пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации молока, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Аймира намерена увеличить поголовье породистых дойных коров и накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aimira is 20 years old and married. She has vocational education and works as a nurse. Since 2012, Aimira has worked with livestock breeding. Aimira has two cows on her farm and she sells milk on a daily basis, on average 15 liters per day. Since it is ecological and homemade, it is in large demand and brings a monthly income of around 12,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to increase the number of livestock and the volume of milk for selling, Aimira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows. Aimira intends to increase the number of purebred dairy cows and save money for renovating her home.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase the volume of milk for selling

loans.name: Knight's Group

texts.en:
Knight is 31 years old and has 5 children. She has been a farmer for 14 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Knight is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Knight started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Knight’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3,5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Roxana Esperanza

texts.es:
Roxana de 28 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato con mucho esfuerzo ya que eran una familia de escasos recursos, es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Solo su hijo depende de ella

Roxana es comerciante, vende ropa y productos cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 2 años, inicio su negocio por iniciativa propia debido a que necesitaba ganar dinero para mantener a su hijo. Solicita el préstamo para comprar cosméticos de catálogo, al ser ella distribuidora autorizada se los venden a mejor precio para que al revenderlos le saque mejor ganancia; además quiere comprar ropa para damas y caballeros para vender en esta época que es en la que las personas andan buscando que comprar para regalar. Roxana se empeña en seguir trabajando por su hijo para darle un mejor futuro del que ella pueda gozar.
texts.en: Roxana is 28 years old, single and has a 2-year-old boy. She studied until high school with much effort, as she came from a poor family. Roxana is a single mother and lives with her parents. Her son is her only dependent. Roxana is a trader; she has been selling clothing and cosmetics from catalogs for two years. The business emerged out of her own initiative and her need to earn money to support her son. Roxana requests a loan to buy cosmetics from a catalog; since she is an authorized dealer, she can buy them at a better price and obtain a nice profit from their resale. She also would like to buy women's and men's clothing to sell during this season when people are looking to purchase gifts. Roxana continues to work hard to give her son a better future than hers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics from a catalog.

loans.name: Bakuwa Saratu

texts.en:
Bakuwa Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bakuwa Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Nuhu, Victoria and Haruna.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Bakuwa Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bakuwa Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Bakuwa Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, and hopes to eventually become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell her corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 49 year old fisherman who has more than ten years experience in the fishing industry. He is a Palestinian refugee living with his wife and seven children inside a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. 
His wife is an orchard worker and his children work too to support their parents in covering the family expenses.  
Ali has a good reputation inside and outside the camp and he is known to be a committed hard-working fisherman. 
He is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa that will allow him to upgrade his old fishing equipment and replace his old net with a new one. 
The loan is expected to boost Ali's productivity and increase his income which will allow him to provide his wife and children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
This skillful woman is Adolat.  She is a dressmaker at the age of 49 years, from Tursun-zoda town. Mavluda offers her services on tailoring women's national dresses. She began her activity in 2009 in order to provide her family with additional income. Mavluda's husband is a farmer, and he is engaged in growing crops.

Mavluda adores her work, and now she would like to take a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to expand her sewing business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Don Esteban es un hombre muy trabajador y a pesar de que tuvo un accidente y ya no pudo trabajar en el oficio de mecánico siempre encontraba alguna forma de sacar adelante a su familia, la cual constituye su esposa y sus dos hijos.  Por mucho tiempo la pareja trabajaba juntos en la pulpería de la familia pero ahora Esteban ha encontrado otra forma de ingreso adicional, que es el servicio de transporte que brinda con su camión. Don Esteban ha obtenido diferentes préstamos a través de Kiva para mejora de vivienda y crecimiento de su negocio. Esta vez solicita el crédito para levantar un muro de su casa para que las gallinas del vecino ya no puedan pasar a su patio y comer las plantas que él y su esposa sembraron. Este tema ha sido un fuerte punto de conflicto entre su familia y el vecino, así que Esteban prefiere levantar este muro, así evitara este tipo de problemas.
texts.en:
Esteban is a hard-working man, and although he had an accident which prevented him from working as a mechanic, he has always been able to find a way to provide for his family which includes his wife and his two children. 

He and his wife have worked together for a long time at the family grocery store, but now Esteban has found another way to earn money - providing transportation service with his truck. 

Esteban has taken out a number of loans through Kiva to make improvements to his house and to grow his business. This time he is asking for a loan to add a wall to his house so that the neighbor's chickens won't go on his patio and eat the plants that he and his wife are growing there. This matter has been a big source of conflict between his family and his neighbor, so Esteban prefers to put up the wall to avoid this kind of problem.

loans.use: Esteban is asking for a loan to build a wall around his property which will provide security for his family.

loans.name: Mirzovali

texts.ru: Мирзовали 33 летний мужчина из района Шахритус. Он примерный семьянин и отец двоих детей. Старшей дочке 3 года, младшей годик. Мирзовали трудится и работает ради своей семьи. Он работает в одном из банков района и хочет иметь дополнительный источник дохода. Он собирается открыть собственный продуктовый магазин. В этом деле ему будут помогать его жена и сестра. Благодаря кредиту у Мирзовали будет дополнительный источник дохода и у его сестры и жены работа. Мирзовали очень ответственный мужчина обещает выплачивать кредит в срок. На заемные деньги он привезет продукты питания на продажу. Поддержите Мирзовали!
texts.en:
Mirzovali is a 33-year-old man from the Shahrituz region. He is an exemplary family man and the father of two children. His oldest daughter is three and his youngest one. Mirzovali works hard for the good of his family. He works in one of the local banks but wants to have an additional source of income as well. He is preparing to open his own grocery store, a business that his wife and sister will help him with. 

Thanks to this loan, Mirzovali will have an additional source of income and his wife and sister will have jobs. He is a very responsible man and promises to pay back the loan on time. He will use the loan amount to purchase food products for sale. Please support him!

loans.use: to purchase food products so that he can start a new business by opening a grocery store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 44 years old. He is married with 3 children between one and eight years old; two of them go to school. He sells soft drinks and has been in a business for five years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more juice, soda and water to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more juice, soda and water to resell.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar es un padre de 3 hijos de 18, 15, 9 años de edad, se encuentra separado de su esposa.
Desde año 2009 se encuentra administrando un negocio de almacén de aceites, y reparación de automóviles y motocicletas  que inicio por necesidad económica y gusto al trabajo independiente.
Este negocio le ha permitido suplir todas las necesidades que se le han presentado, mandar dinero a sus hijos, pagar su educación y su respectivo arriendo.
Sus sueños para su familia son poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, dejar el negocio alguno de sus hijos y como sabe que le quedan todavía años de operación por ello quiere mejorar sus ventas, aumentar su fluido de clientes, para ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de canecas de aceite, este hombre surte a varios almacenes y su objetivo es seguir generando recursos para sus hijos y para su casa.
texts.en:
Omar is a father of 3 children aged 18, 15, and 9. His is separated from his wife. Since 2009, he has been running an oil warehouse and auto and motorcycle repair business that he started due to economic necessity and his like of independent work. This business has allowed him to supply all of the necessities that have come up, send money to his children, pay for their education and their respective rent.

His dreams for his family are to be able to pay for the education of his children, leave the business to his children one day and, as he knows that he still has years of operation left he wants to improve his sales and increase his customer flow. For this he wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of cans of oil. This man stocks various shops and his goal is to continue generating resources for his children and for his house.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil to stock his warehouse that will also provide for various nearby shops.

loans.name: Yessica Yamileh

texts.es:
Yessica de 30 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, su parea trabaja como agente de ventas en una boutique que vende teléfonos móviles; solo él y sus hijos viven con ella. Yesica es empleada en una cooperativa, tomo la iniciativa de trabajar para apoyar a su  pareja con los gastos del hogar, camina cerca de 20 minutos para llegar al lugar de trabajo.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos para su madre que se encuentra mal de salud, y ella quiere apoyarle económicamente. Yessica se propuso lograr que sus hijos terminen sus estudios hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Yessica, 30 years old, is in a relationship and has 2 sons, ages 10 and 3 years old. She studied through her bachelor's degree. Her partner works as a salesman in a boutique that sells mobile telephones. Only him and her children live with her. Yessica works in a cooperative. She took the initiative to work to help her partner with the household expenses. She walks approximately 20 minutes to get to her workplace. 

She is requesting this loan to buy medinies for her mother who is not well, and to help support her financially. Yessica has set out to achieve that her children continue their studies through university.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her mother

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sule joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Barau, Musa and Shaabu. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sule spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the village of Kyotera. 

He raises crops and livestock and wishes to keep milk cows and grow food crops to have additional income. 

In order to have healthy natural products, his cows are fed grass, hay, and grain but no antibiotics or other additives. He therefore wants to buy organic manure and seedlings to plant this season and increase his yield. The food crops are bought by the local community and he will serve more customers if his yields increase.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married with five children aged 12, 11, 9, 5, and 3 years, with four of the children attending different schools.

They own a stationery business, which they started in 2013. They work four days a week and nine hours a day.

They were motivated by the profitability of the business. They mainly sell their goods to schools in Rakai and surrounding areas. They hope to use the loan to buy a printer, photocopying machine, and inverter for their stationery business. Francis thinks this will boost his sales and profit.

They face a challenge of power shutdowns and limited capital, which affect the business. Francis is described as an honest and hardworking man in business.

They appreciate the services offered by lenders.

loans.use: to buy a printer, photocopying machine, and inverter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate the kitchen and the bedroom of his family house

In the past, Baturiya Tiyau would typically have sold her maize soon after harvest, when the price was lowest, in order to cover basic expenses such as food.

However, as a Babban Gona member, Baturiya Tiya can store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. 

When asked, Baturiya Tiyau spoke of her ambition to use the additional income she earns to educate her children, hopefully ensuring they are well-educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.
