loans.name: Chiyanjano Group

texts.en:
Esnart is 40 years old and cares for her five  children and one orphan. 

She owns a grocery as her main source of income and sells sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She started this business  to financially support her family and to reduce their family’s levels of poverty. She will use the loan to buy more items and increase her profits. She hopes of turning her grocery into a wholesale business and dreams of educating her children. 

Esnart is self-reliant and no longer depends on her husband.

loans.use: to buy gloceries.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Gabriel, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman. She has four children, with ages ranging from 8 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a low stock supply. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. 

Her business goal is to be a wholesale distributor of vegetables within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. She will use the anticipated profits to set up a new business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman with 1 child. She is ambitious and operates a tailoring shop to make clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local people. 

A business challenge is the high cost of materials. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy  materials to make and sell more clothes. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 26-year-old married man with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 7, one attends school. 

He has sold chicken for 4 years and will use the loan to buy more chicken to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy chicken to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and more

loans.name: Jose Lino

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos,  de 1 y 7 años de edad, solo el mayor estudia. Estudió hasta 4°grado de educación básica, su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus tres hijo dependen de él.

José es chofer de una ruta de buses desde hace 15 años,  aprendió por iniciativa al no tener otra manera de ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia. Además trabaja como mecánico de medio tiempo y de esta forma es como logra mantener a su familia. Su trabajo que a 4 kilómetros de su casa y trabaja 6 horas al día.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar cemento, hierro, laminas para reparar su casa, en la pasa época lluviosa tuvo problemas con el techo y es momento de repáralo. A José le gustaría conseguir un mejor empleo donde puede dar mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and has a partner. He has two children, ages seven and one years each; the eldest is in school. José has a fourth grade education. His wife is a housewife. José and his partner and children live together with no other persons.

José has been a bus driver for 15 years. He learned this trade as he had no other way of earning a living and supporting his family. He also works as a part-time mechanic and is thus able to look after his partner and children. José’s workplace is four kilometres from his house; he works six hours every day.

José is applying for this loan in order to buy cement, iron bars and metal sheeting to repair his house. During the last rainy season, José had problems with his roof and the time to repair it has come.

José would like to find a better job so that he can give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron bars and metal sheeting to repair his house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a very hardworking, energetic mother with 9 lovely children. Sarah resides in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions for  farming. Sarah farmed for the past 30 years and through those years, she has gathered experience with farming techniques. 

Through the income from farming, she has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her children. Sarah is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. 

The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture she requests a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Sarah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. 

Sarah is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. 

Sarah waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 30 years old. He is married with one child, who is 9 months old and not yet old enough to go to school. He has a shop and has been working in this business for two years. With the requested loan, he would like to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is an ambitious,  married woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business to sell fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Her business challenge is low product inventory. She will use 30,000 KES to buy more stock of vegetables and fruit. Her business goal is to be a wholesale distributor of vegetables within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en: Theophile is 35 years old. He is married, with five children aged between 2 and 13 years. Four of them go to school. He has a shop and has been in business for 17 years. With the requested loan, he would like to buy more rice, sugar and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora de 36 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 18, 15 y 13 años de edad, todos estudiando.  Ella solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica. Su pareja trabaja haciendo viajes transportando persona u objetos.

Dora es comerciante tiene 20 años de administrar una tienda en su casa, también compra cerdos pequeños para para desarrollarlos al peso de sacrificio y venderlos, ambas actividades le garantizan el sustento de su familia junto al trabajo de su esposo.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 8 cerdos pequeños de $40.00 cada uno, concentrado de inicio y desarrollo, vitaminas y medicinas para los parásitos para desarrollar de la mejor manera los cerdos y venderlos sanos. Tiene la meta de dar el estudio por lo menos hasta bachillerato a todos sus hijos y seguir trabajando en la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
Dora is 36 years old. She has a life partner and five children who are 23, 22, 18, 15 and 13 years old, and all of them are in school. She only had the opportunity to study up to the 4th grade. Her partner's job is transporting people and things. 

Dora is a businesswoman and has been running a store from her house for 20 years.  She also buys small pigs to grow them to slaughter weight and then sell them. Both activities sustain the family together with her husband's work.

She is asking for a loan so she can buy 8 small pigs for $40.00 each, starter and grower feed, vitamins, and parasite control medicines. This will allow her to raise her pigs in the best way and for them to be healthy when sold. 

Her goal is to provide at least a high school education for all of her children and to continue her work of raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy 8 pigs, feed, vitamins, and parasite control medicines.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 30 years old. She is married, with five children aged between 1 and 9 years. Four of them go to school. 

She sells fruit, and has been in a business for 10 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more mangoes, cabbages and oranges to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes, cabbages and oranges

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Janet, who is often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 45 years old.  As a group leader, she is representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North Distric, Kenya.  She is married and has 3 children.

Janet is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Janet says that she is happy to have made that decision because since she first joined in 2012, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Janet will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and solar lights

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a 55-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Hellen has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming training.

Hellen described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Hellen’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and solar lights

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Janepher, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old and is married. Janepher has been a farmer for 8 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Janepher isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2011 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Janepher will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Janepher's Group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and solar lights

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet's Group is formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Janet, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children. Janet has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Janet isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Janet will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Janet's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and solar lights

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, has 7 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Beatrice is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Beatrice has been a farmer for more than 20 years and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Beatrice is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.75 acres will be planted by Beatrice's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & solar light

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael is a 49-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Rael has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rael described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rael’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: by seeds, fertilizer & solar lights

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is the group leader of her group in Kakamega North District, and she is representing 9 farmers, including herself. She is married and is a proud mother of 4 children. Margaret joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 7 years.

Like many other farmers, Margaret decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Margaret's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as, even though Margaret decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: buy seeds & fertilizer

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is 78 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Peter has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.  Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Peter also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Peter's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers & solar light

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima is a 49-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 9 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Halima has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming training.

Halima described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize seeds, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Halima’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5,25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & solar light

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary's Group is formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Rosemary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 54 years old, is married and has 4 children. Rosemary has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Rosemary isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Rosemary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Rosemary's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 10.25 acres.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & a solar light

loans.name: Adamu Boby

texts.en: Adamu Boby is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu Boby would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu Boby can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Adamu Boby is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Amina, Haruna and Daniel.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yahaya  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en: Micah is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Micah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Micah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Micah is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman. She has two children aged 10 years and 12 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages, and onions. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods. 

Naomi will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier to other retailers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages and other items

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 34-year-old married man with three children, aged 8, 4,  and 2; only one child attends school. He is a farmer who deals mainly in passion fruits for sale and works five days a week and six hours a day. He also earns income from tomato growing and a produce business. He has been in this business since 2007 and was motivated by the profitability and availability of markets for the business. He operates mainly in the outskirts of Kabira and Zziwa. He usually sells his output to people from all walks of life.

Francis hopes to use the loan to buy herbicides and pesticides for his plantations. His dreams of opening up a farm supply shop. He faces  challenges of price fluctuations, limited capital and unfavorable weather conditions that affect his business. He is described as an honest and hardworking businessman.

loans.use: To buy herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a 37-year-old married woman who deals in an agriculture and produce business, which she started in 2004. She works five days a week and eight hours a day. She was motivated by the profitability of the business. She also owns a market stall in Ddwaniro.

She mainly sells her goods to people in Ddwaniro and the surrounding areas. 

Cissy hopes to use the loan to buy yellow bananas for her stall. She faces a challenge of price fluctuation, and bananas wilt, which affect her business. 

She is described as an honest and hardworking woman in business.

She appreciates the services offered by lenders, and asks for further reduction of the interest rates.

loans.use: To buy yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Hamida is in her early 30s and a single mother of one child who is in school. She has been running a general store for three years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Hamida's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock items in the general tore. She dreams of building her own house.  

Hamida will share this loan with her loan group, Dove, which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in the general store.

loans.name: Las Joyitas Group

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón recién nacido y una hija mujer de 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de madera para pisos. 
Ella es buena madre, generosa, amable, respetuosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Alto Lima’ un área que agrupa a vendedores de materiales de construcción como; madera para pisos, calaminas, yeso, cemento, fierro, ladrillos, etc. de clima frio y seco con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Mary es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español según la lengua de sus clientes (la segunda de la izquierda, sentada, suéter negro, blusa negra). Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica a la obra fina de construcción, y sus hijos; la mayor estudia en la escuela y su bebe acaba de nacer. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua, electricidad y gas. Sus sueños por tener una mejor calidad de vida la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de madera para piso como; Pisos de madera tarugados, Pisos de madera entablonados, Pisos de madera parquet, Pisos flotantes y otros. Su labor la realiza de lunes a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. “Eligiendo la madera para su piso, Existen muchos patrones y colores para que la madera se ajuste a su gusto…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia para su familia. Ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de baldes de cola (pegamento para pisos), que es muy requerida y se acaba rápido. Esta es la 8 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mary solicita un préstamo para la compra de cola para madera por mayor para abaratar costos y cumplir con sus clientes constructores.
texts.en: Mary is 26 years old, married, has a newborn boy and a 9-year-old girl. She makes a living by selling wood for flooring. Mary is a good mother: generous, kind, respectful, responsible, and hardworking. She carries out her business in "Alto Lima", a cold a dry area with daytime temperatures between 2 and 12C where sellers of construction materials (such as wood flooring, corrugated metal sheet, plaster, cement, reinforcing steel bars, bricks, etc.) congregate. Mary has a tan complexion, is short and keep her long black hair tied back. Her native language is Aymara and speaks Spanish to her clients. She is the second woman from the left, seated, wearing a black sweater and a black shirt. Mary lives with her husband, who is a highly-skilled construction worker, and their children: her oldest, a daughter, goes to school and her baby was just born. They live in a rented house made of brick and cement, which has running water, electricity, and gas. Her dream of a better quality of life motivated her to form a group of people engaged in businesses such as the sale of coca-leaf, quinoa juice, perfume, soda, traditional indigenous skirts, ice cream, and empanadas (meat-filled pastries), to request a loan that will enable them to reach their goals. Her business involves the sale of wood for pegged, plank, parquet, and floating floors, among others. Mary works 9am to 9pm from Monday to Sunday. "There are many styles and colors of wood to cater to the taste of clients", she says. Her dream is for her family to have their own house. She would like to buy buckets of flooring glue in bulk, which is in high demand and sells out quickly. This is her eight sequential loan in the six years she has been operating her business. Mary has requested a loan to buy wood glue in bulk to obtain better prices and supply their construction clients.

loans.use: to buy wood glue in bulk to obtain better prices and supply their construction clients.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 5 children ranging in age from 15 years to 36 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows horticultural products. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Margaret's business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient rainfall. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs to increase production. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to increase production

loans.name: Dmitry

texts.en:
Dmitry came to the US seven years ago and recently started his own moving company, VIP Express Moving. He says, “I always wanted to start my own business. I’m so excited about growing it big.” Dmitry’s business has two full-time employees and six part-time employees.

Dmitry still remembers how excited he was to get this business started: “The greatest success was when I started the business and got all the licenses and insurance.” Now, his business has positive testimonials from satisfied customers, like, “True professionals, upfront, honest pricing. I'd never used movers before and was a bit worried about it. But the whole move was really stress-free.”

Dmitry has been relying on word-of-mouth to generate customers and would like a loan to focus his marketing strategy on growing his customer base. He would also like to buy a new truck. He operates out of New Jersey right now, but would like to have offices in Florida and California as well.

Check out his website: http://vipexpressmoving.com/

loans.use: to increase marketing for his moving company and buy a new truck.

loans.name: Smilyn

texts.en:
Smilyn is 32 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Smilyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Smilyn has been farming vegetables for ten years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Smilyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, es soltera y tiene cinco hijos de 2 viven en el extranjero, 3 viven con ella, su hija mayor trabaja y los otros dos estudian. María vivió por un tiempo en el extranjero, trabajo fuertemente para construir su casa en el país, luego regresó para poner su propio negocio.

María es comerciante, se levante desde muy temprano para ir a trabajar, tienda una tienda que administra su hija y es para eso que necesita el préstamo, para comprar productos de temporada para el negocio, bebidas, adornos y productos de cocina que son los que más se buscan para preparar platillos especiales. María solo quiere salir adelante que nunca le falte el pan de cada dia a sus hijos y que logren alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old, single and has five children; two live abroad and three live with her. Her eldest daughter works and the others go to school. Maria lived abroad during which time she worked very hard so she could build a house in El Salvador. She then returned and started her own business.

Maria is a businesswoman who gets up very early each day to go to work. She has a store  that her daughter runs and it is for this store that she needs a loan. She will use the money to buy seasonal items for the business such as drinks, decorations, and kitchen products that people look for in preparing special dishes.

Maria just wants to get ahead, for her children never to go hungry and for them to attain their goals.

loans.use: to buy seasonal items for the business such as drinks, decorations and kitchen products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for meat

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bulus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Isiya, Nehemiah and Yunana.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bulus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bulus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Bulus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; and to store his harvest so he can sell his maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Zakka

texts.en:
Zakka is a maize farmer from Maidawa village, in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Zakka would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakka can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Zakka, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en:
La'azarus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. La'azarus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yowel, Rauben and Rita.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azarus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, La'azarus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Kabiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Chrstopher, Aphodia and Yuwana.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Kabiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Adamu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Inusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Inusa is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rabiu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Shafi, Adulmalic and Zaarau.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rabiu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jaji Galadima

texts.en: Jaji Galadima is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Jaji Galadima joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Dauda, Adamu and Yusuf.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jaji Galadima would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jaji Galadima can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Jaji Galadima spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa Bakano

texts.en: Musa Bakano is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa Bakano would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa Bakano can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Musa Bakano expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a maize farmer from Maidawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Isah, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Idi

texts.en:
Idi is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idi would have had to sell his  maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Idi expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha is a maize farmer from Sada, a village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mustapha can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other members of Babban Gona, Mustapha intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas cerdos y concentrado y así poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been blurred is 20-years-old and lives in a high-risk area. 

She makes her living raising pigs, and she sells the pigs in various markets. With the profits, she is able to come out ahead with her home expenses. She lives in her own house with her family.

She asks for a loan to be able to buy more pigs and feed, and in that way be able to continue to raise the pigs and have better profits.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru:
Санобар 37 лет. Она в настоящий момент начинает новый бизнес, чтобы поднять финансовое положение семьи. Ее интересует купля и продажа мелкорогатого скота. Сама Санобар до этого времени вместе со свекровью работала на поле наемным рабочим. Муж Санобар таксист, он работает по маршрутной линии своего района Спитамен.
Семья поддерживает в решении Санобар начать животноводческий бизнес и будет помогать ей продвигать его. Санобар на свои сбережения и на сумму кредита собирается купить 4-х голов овец и 720 кг ячменя. Она считает животноводческий бизнес прибыльным и стабильным. Благодаря кредиту у ее семьи будет новый источник дохода, что улучшит их финансовое положение.
texts.en: Sanobar is 37 years old. At the present time, she is starting a new business in order to elevate her family's financial status. She is interested in reselling small livestock. Up to this time, Sanobar and her mother-in-law have been working as hired field workers. Sanobar's husband is a taxi driver and works on a set route in his district of Spitamen. The family supports Sanobar's decision to start the animal husbandry business and will help her with advancing it. Sanobar is planning to use her savings and the loan amount to buy 4 sheep and 720 kilograms of barley. She considers animal husbandry business to be profitable and stable. Thanks to this loan, her family will have a new source of income, which will improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep and 720 kilograms of barley in order to start her own business

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Noeme works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Noeme is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell through her general store business.

Noeme has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosemarie has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her manicure and pedicure service.

Rosemarie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her manicure and pedicure service.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 41 years old and married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Betty has a fermented fish business in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her fermented fish.

Betty has been in this business for four years. In the future, Betty would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her fermented fish

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Donna is 38 years old and all of her children are in school.

Donna has a fermented fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her fermented fish.

Donna has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her fermented fish

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura de 51 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 26,23 y 21 años de edad que viven en el extranjero. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque sus padres no podían pagarle el estudio. Recibe ayuda económica de sus hijos, es ama de casa y cuida a su madre quien de pende totalmente de Maura.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y reparar el techo de su vivienda Lámina galvanizada, polines “C”, pernos, puertas y ventanas. Maura no pierde la esperanza de ver a sus hijos, lo que espera tener arreglada la casa para cuando ellos vengan.
texts.en: Maura is 51 years old, single, and has three children aged 26, 23, and 21 who live abroad. She did not have the chance to study because her parents could not pay for her education. Maura receives remittances from her children. She is a housewife and takes care of her mother, who depends completely on her. Maura is requesting a loan to buy materials to repair her home's roof: galvanized sheet, C-beams, bolts, doors, and windows. She hopes to see her children again and to have the house ready for their visit.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet, C-beams, bolts, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Ibro

texts.en: Ibro is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yaro village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibro would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibro can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibro, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yusufu Tunau

texts.en: Yusufu Tunau is a maize farmer from Chiroma, a village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusufu Tunau would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusufu Tunau can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other members of Babban Gona, Yusufu Tunau intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yahaya, Ayuba and Abubakar.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bulus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bulus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Bulus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He hopes eventually to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en: Isiya is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Isiya is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: ‘Kpangmanga-Bagurugu’ Group

texts.en:
Arishetu is 30 years old and has 3 children. She is a member of a shea nut processing women's group from Bagurugu in the northern region of Ghana. She raises her left hand up among members squatting in their photo. Their group is called ‘Kpangmanga-Bagurugu’ Women's Association.

Arishetu and her colleagues are in the business of processing shea nuts into shea butter. They have been in this business for the past 7 years. They process high premium shea butter, some of which is sold to aggregators and is exported to the European and USA markets. Arishetu sells the butter to many other customers in northern Ghana. The group is therefore requesting a loan of GHS 12,200. Arishetu’s share of the loan would be used to buy shea nuts for her to process more shea butter.

Arishetu is able to buy school uniforms for the children and prepare food more regularly for the family due to the increased income from her previous loan. She hopes to keep supporting her family to have regular food to eat, buy educational materials for her 3 children, and repay this loan.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for her to process more shea butter.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Toem is a 50-year-old married rice farmer with five children in her care. She lives in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. 

So far she has been cultivating rice for over 20 years. Her husband is 53 and also a rice farmer. Among all their children, two of them work in a shoe factory, one is a third-year student taking a bachelor’s degree majoring in agriculture, and another is a high school student. Together, they can earn approximately $10 a day. 

Now Toem would like to apply for a loan to pay her child’s tuition fees for two years. This loan will help her child graduate successfully. In the future, after her child graduates, she is going to help him to run a farm and also support her youngest child to earn a bachelor's degree.  For her house, she wants to build fences around it.

loans.use: to pay her child’s tuition fees

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES UNIDAS POR EL PROGRESO” está conformada por socias dedicadas al comercio minorista. Martha tiene 66 años de edad es viuda con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas agua mineral y cerveza en horas de la tarde en su vivienda y en horas de la mañana trabaja como ayude de venta de comida. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más cervezas gaseosas y agua mineral. Su mayor deseo es implementar su restaurant. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Martha es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste chaleco y gorra roja.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso" is made up of women who make their living in retail business. 

Martha is 66-years-old and is a widow with independent children. She makes her living selling sparkling mineral water and beer in the afternoon hours in her home, and throughout the morning she works in food sales. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more beer, soft drinks and mineral water. Her greatest desire is to start her restaurant. 

The group thanks the investors from KIVA for the loan offered. Martha is the second from the left wearing a vest and a red hat.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, mineral water and beer

loans.name: Enkhchuluun

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhchuluun, 48 years old, lives alone in her house in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. She has two sons, both of whom live on their own. 

Enkhchuluun has been running a butcher shop since 2001. 

Last summer, she purchased a car for meat transportation and it resulted in decreasing her working capital. So, she is requesting a loan of MNT 2,500,000 to buy meat in large quantity to sell during the holidays.

loans.use: to buy meat in large quantity.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a resident of Laguna, Philippines. She has children, and she works in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Joan is a Roving Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She collects measurements, such as the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, and number of stitches per inch during sewing operations.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Joan is the improper balance of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Joan is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in repaying the loan because the loan payment was deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response; any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan for her children’s education.

Joan wants to be promoted as supervisor someday or become a successful businesswoman. She dreams of giving her children a better future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.name: Roselynita

texts.en:
Roselynita is 41 years old and a married woman with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Roselynita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Roselynita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julieta is 46 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Julieta has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Julieta has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

She has been in this business for one year now and earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

In the future, Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 27 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcela has been farming vegetables for six years and also earns income from a general store. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 55 years old and married with three children and she works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, spices, etc.

Cristita has been in this business for 30 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Josue Isaac

texts.es:
Josué de 25 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato con mucho esfuerzo ya que él mismo se pagaba los estudios con su trabajo. Vive con sus padres y sus hermanos. Josué tiene 11 años de trabajar como mecánico, tomo la iniciativa después de terminar sus estudios de bachillerato; camina 15 minutos para llegar al lugar de trabajo que es su única fuente de ingreso.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción, ladrillo, arena, piedras, cemento, polines y demás para construir un cuarto cerca de la casa de sus padres para vivir con mayor privacidad, su padre es albañil por lo que le apoyará en la construcción. Josue seguirá trabajando muy duro para algún día construir su propia casa.
texts.en: Josué is 25 years old, single, and has no children. He studied until high school with much effort, since he had to work to pay for his studies. He lives with his parents and siblings. Josué has been working as a mechanic for 11 years, a trade he entered out of his own initiative after high school. He walks to work 15 minutes and his job is his only source of income. Josué is requesting a loan to buy construction materials: bricks, sand, stones, cement, beams, etc. to build a room near his parents' house so as to have more privacy. His father is a builder and will help him with the construction. Josué would continue to work very hard to one day build his own house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: bricks, sand, stones, cement, beams, etc.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Kefas, Adamu and Blessen.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Ishaya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping eventually to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 54 years old and lives alone in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working at the emergency authority since 2006. He is currently living in a rental apartment that has deteriorated over the years. He is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy building materials such as fiberglass, foam and planks for renovation. After renovation, he will conserve energy more efficiently and save cash on electricity and heat.

loans.use: to renovate his rental apartment

loans.name: Jhielchearl

texts.en:
Jhielchearl is still studying and has had previous loans from GDMPC that she used for her school fees and expenses. She wants to complete her degree and practice her profession in order to become successful someday and with a better education; nothing is impossible. 

She never wasted her time and on weekends, she used to help out with fixing their house's mess. She took this loan for to pay the tuition fees for the  second  semester .  Jhielchearl is hopeful to become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Lyka

texts.en: Lyka is single and earns a living by running a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. to make more food to sell. Lyka has been in this business for six years, and also earns additional income from her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and will use this new one to further build her business. Her goal is to save enough money to have a secure future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business.

loans.name: Aneceta

texts.en:
Aneceta is 58 years old, widowed and has six children.

Aneceta is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Aneceta requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Aneceta has been farming for six years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 110,00 from NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers. Jesusa has been in this business for four years, and earns additional income by raising and fattening pigs. She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, and dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toiletries like perfumes, powders, and soaps, which are some items that her customers have requested.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 33 years old, married and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She earns a living by growing vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been a farmer for ten years and has taken out seven prior loans from NWTF. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Blanca Esterminia

texts.es: Con el préstamo anterior cancelo la colegiatura de su hijo que está estudiando medicina y compró libros que necesito ese año. Solicita este nuevo préstamo para pagar nuevamente la colegiatura de la universidad y también comprar los libros que necesita para estudiar en el siguiente curso. Blanca sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean independientes, además de construir una habitación en su casa.
texts.en: With the previous loan she paid her son's school tuition who is studying medicine and bought the books that he needed for this year. She seeks a new loan to again pay university tuition and also to buy the books that she needs for the next semester. Blanca dreams that her children finish their studies and become independent; in addition she would like to build a room onto her home.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition and also to buy the books that he needs for the next semester.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda, pictured here on the day her biodigester was installed, is a Mexican farmer interested in reducing the operating costs on her farm by producing her own energy and fertilizer using her animals' waste. She owns several cows and sheep, and while she dedicates herself to selling their milk and meat, she can now also take advantage of their manure to improve her self-sufficiency. By putting their waste in the biodigester, the natural bacteria and methanisation process will produce biogas to cook and heat water, as well as a nutrient-rich fertilizer for her small plot of land outside the farm. She will be able to displace the expensive and contaminating LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizers by producing everything she needs herself. Her farm will become a cleaner place and with the savings Raymunda will make, she will be able to buy more animals to expand the activities on her farm.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 12 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Siem Reap province, Han is 52 years old and a mother of two children. 

To support her living condition, she grows rice and cassava. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 30,000 KHR per day. 

For Han, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of seven to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for harvesting costs. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting costs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Altanpurev

texts.en: Mr. Altanpurev, 43 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been providing taxi services to local people since 2012. His wife stays at home, looking after their one-year-old daughter. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to buy fiberglass, foam and cement to do some home renovations. After the work is done, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to renovate his house so that he burns less coal

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Молодая студентка Фарида продолжает свою учебу в ВУЗе. В данный момент она повторно обратилась за кредитом для образования. Свой первый кредит она успешно погасила и выражает кредиторам Kiva свою благодарность за оказанную поддержку. Сейчас Фарида снова нуждается в финансовой поддержке, так как наступило время оплаты за учебный год в ВУЗе. Фарида в этой ситуации считает приемлемым получение кредита, потому что не хочет останавливать учебу. Она просит Вас помочь ей снова с финансами и за это обещает хорошо учиться и сделать карьеру по своей специальности.
texts.en: Young student Farida is continuing her university education. At the present time, she is requesting another education loan. She successfully repaid her first loan and expresses her gratitude to Kiva lenders for the provided support. Now Farida needs financial support once again because the time has come to pay for her year of studies at the university. Farida considers appropriate to obtain a loan in this situation because she does not want to stop her studies. She is asking You to help her again with the finances and for this, she promises to study well and create a career in her specialty.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewelry and watches in bulk.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda lives in Carles, Iloilo with her family. For the last 15 years, she has been helping her husband in providing the needs of their three children now aged 8, 15 and 19. While her husband fishes and does carpentry works, she is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells home-cooked meals. Rhoda requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy an engine, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasoning, vegetables and meat.

She will continue to work hard with her husband so her children can go to school. 

In the future, she hopes to expand the location of her business to another branch to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy an engine, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasonings, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Yanira Maribel

texts.es:
Yanira, de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, dejó de estudiar porque quedo embarazada y sus padres no la apoyaron más, es madres soltera de un niño de 2 años de edad, ella vive con su abuela, hermana y su madre. 
	
Yanira, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era muy pequeña, su madre le enseño como ganarse la vida trabajando muy duro, actualmente ella trabaja en una casa en la ciudad, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado y solo puede regresar a su casa los días domingo.
Ese día aprovecha para estar compartir tiempo con su hijo ya que durante la semana ella no puede verlo.

Con el crédito Yanira, realizará mejoras en la vivienda de su madre, hará remodelación de ventanas, les pondrá balcones, y construirá un cuarto: comprara bloque, arena, cemento, hierro; con estos trabajos que realzara en su casa ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia ya que tendrán más seguridad y además, tendrán mas espacio donde puedan convivir como familia.

Ella desea ver todos estos proyectos terminados en un corto tiempo, desea también que su hijo sea una persona sana y que tenga excelente educación, pues quiere que él se gradué de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Yanira is 19 years old and completed a 9th grade education. She stopped going to school as she was pregnant and her parents no longer supported her. She is a single mother of a 2 year old son. She lives with her grandmother, sister, and mother. Yanira has done household work since she was a little girl, learning from her mother who showed her how to earn a living by working hard. Today she works in a house in the city. She works Monday through Saturday and can only return to her home on Sundays. On Sundays she takes advantage of the time with her son as she doesn't see him during the week.

With the loan Yanira will make home improvements to her mother's home. She will remodel the windows, put in balconies and construct a room. The loan will be used to buy cement block, sand, cement, iron; with home improvements she will be able to have a better quality of life for her family and have more safety. In addition, they will have more space where they can live as a family. She wants to see all these projects finished in a short period of time. She also wishes that her son continues to be healthy and has a good education, as she wants him to graduate from the university with a career.

loans.use: to buy cement block, sand, cement, iron; with home improvements she will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice and noodles to support her business.

loans.name: Seam's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Seam is 42 years old and the mother of four dependent children. To make her living and support her family, she grows rice and sesame. She can earn income of about 33,900 KHR per day.

This is Seam's sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more yields than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 48 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She earns a living by running a repair shop in the Philippines. Victoria has requested a PHP 25,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional equipment and tools for her business. She has been in her current line of work for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and tools for her business.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Насим  родился в семьи дехкан. Ему 41 лет. Насим женат  и имеет 4-х  детей. У него очень хорошая и дружная семья.  У него нет высшего образования. Так как у его семьи не было возможности на обучение. Насим занимается животноводством и дехканством. В свободное время он зарабатывает работая разнорабочим. Насим сотрудничает  более 3 лет с МДО Арванд. Он хочет получить  кредит для покупки скота. Он заранее  благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Nasim was born to a family of farmers. He is 41 and married with four children. He has a very good and loving family. He doesn't have a higher education since it wasn't a possibility for his family. He works in animal husbandry and agriculture and earns extra money in his free time doing odd jobs.

Nasim has been working with Arvand for more than three years. He wants to take out a loan to purchase livestock. He is thankful in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Thim's Group

texts.en:
A mother of seven children living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Thim is 55 years old. 

She grows rice on an area of seven hectares as her main source of income and works for others for pay to supplement her income. 

This is the first time for Thim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to pay for harvesting costs. She hopes that she can harvest her rice on time.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting costs.

loans.name: Carolina Emperatriz

texts.es: Carolina de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante con su familia, apoyada en su compañero de vida que se gana la vida como agricultor, al igual que ella ya que el cultivo de chile que tienen es un negocio familiar. Carolina desea solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda, buscando de esta manera tener mejores condiciones de vida junto a su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Carolina is 24 years old and live in her own home with her husband and 2 year old son. She is an enterprising woman who works every day so that her family can get ahead. She is supported by her husband, and earns a living as a farmer. She grows chili as a family business. Carolina seeks a loan from FUSAI to buy floor bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to install a brick floor in her home, and in the way have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy floor bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to install a brick floor in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and lime in bulk.

loans.name: Carlos Arcenio

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto desde hace 5 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man in the photo is 25 years old. His face has been pixelated because he lives in a high risk area. For the last five years, this young man has been making a living raising pasture livestock and selling his products in the surrounding villages. 

The young man lives in his own house with his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock and continue with his work, thus improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Liderazgo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El grupo “LIDERAZGO DE MUJERES” está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras dedicadas a diversas actividades del comercio minorista.
