Sofía tiene 33 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas hace 06 años con la ayuda de su madre. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas. Su mayor deseo es compra un stand de para poder ofrecer sus frutas y así obtener mejorar sus ingresos económicos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Sofía viste chaleco negro.
texts.en:
The “Liderazgo de Mujeres” [Leadership of Women] group is made up of hard-working members who make a living from diverse occupations in the retail sector. 

Sofia is a 33 year old single woman with one dependent son. For the last six years, with the help of her mother, Sophia has made a living selling fruit. She will invest the loan in the  purchase of more fruit. Sophia's greatest wish is to buy a stand where she can offer her fruit and be able to increase her income. 

The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan provided. Sofia is wearing the black vest in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: finish construction of the front part of her house and, thus, guarantee her security.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a busy mother of two children who are 4 and 6 years old. She is a thirty-five-year-old married woman and a resident from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

She engages in a business of buying and selling goods. She sells soap, toothpaste, and even frozen goods like sausage and ham. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 3 years now. 

Ritchel is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional supplies such as frozen goods and a sack of rice.  She could then start to sell a variety of frozen goods and also cater to a variety of customers. Ritchel could also start to sell rice to the neighborhood on a retail basis. This could help improve her daily income, thus providing her family with a nutritious diet.

Ritchel hopes that someday she can be successful in handling her current livelihood as this could help improve their status of living.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies such as frozen goods and a sack of rice

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Elkana, Lydia and Steven.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Hannatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to eventually ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell her corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sreynoun's Group

texts.en:
Sreynoun, 35, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She is the mother of three children; two of them are in school and one is too young.

To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice on two and half hectares. Moreover, she grows sesame on two hectares to earn extra income.

This is Sreynoun's sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. 

Sreynoun leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can harvest her rice on time and get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo decided to invest in a biodigester in order to displace the fossil fuels, chemical fertilizers, and wood he used to buy to supply his energy needs and improve his fields' yield. 

By investing in a Sistema Biobolsa, he will stop producing greenhouse gases by letting his cows' and sheep's waste outside the farm, and instead produce biogas from the methane the manure generates inside the biodigester. In addition, he will also improve the quality and sustainability of his soil by spreading the natural and nutrient-rich organic fertilizer on his field, displacing the expensive chemical fertilizers. 

Producing his own biogas and biofertilizer will allow Ricardo to save money while reducing his carbon footprint. Once he has paid back his loan, he wants to use his savings to improve the infrastructure on his farm, and to invest in his other expansion projects.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in an 8-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Victoria joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Amos, Joseph and Dauda.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Victoria would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Victoria can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Victoria spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, and hopes to eventually become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell her corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Musa is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Las calles de Suchitepéquez es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las blusas, cortes y fajas típicas.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar este producto, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello, es la actividad que María realiza de 22 años de edad soltera que cuenta con un hijo de apenas cuatro meses de nacido.
	
La actividad que ella desempeña es la elaboración de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 3 años ella ha venido realizando un gran esfuerzo para poder elaborar sus actividades de la mejor calidad y diversos estilos para poder atraer a más clientes para tener un mejor ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de materia prima como hilos de diferentes colores y otros insumos que se requieren en la elaboración de su actividad para poder tener un ingreso económico. Uno de las grandes aspiraciones de María es ver que su hijo se convierte en profesional en los diferentes campos laborales y agrandar más su negocio para así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The streets of Suchitepéquez are witness to the very commonly seen colorful blouses and traditional skirts. It is impossible for any tourist to not admire this work, stop, and make a purchase. This is the business that Maria has. She is 22 years old, single, and makes traditional clothing items. She has had this business for 3 years. She has been doing this work with great effort in order to make her products be of the best quality and diverse styles in order to attract more customers, resulting in more income to improve her family's living conditions.

The loan will be used to buy materials and items for her traditional clothing such as different color threads that are needed in making her items and generating income. One of Maria's aspirations is to see her son become a professional and expand her business in order to have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy materials and items for her traditional clothing.

loans.name: Edgar Yovany

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como chofer.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. De 23 años de edad y con grandes aspiraciones en apoyar al transporte a su comunidad de un lugar a otro, ha tenido que acudir a otro préstamo para seguir transportando a las personas a sus diferentes destinos y así generar más ingresos económicos para el beneficio de su familia.

El motivo del por qué solicita otro crédito en ADICLA es por la misma necesidad que lo obliga a serlo para mejorar aun mas las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que tanta falta les hace para tener una condición de vida adecuada.

Antes cuando no tenía acceso a créditos las condiciones de vida de Edgar no eran las adecuadas pero gracias a los prestamos que ha hecho en ADICLA a podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y la de su familia. 

El uso del segundo préstamo que el está realizando es para la compra de gasolina para poder tener a su vehículo en funcionamiento para así transportar a las personas de su comunidad que necesitan de su servicios de transporte.

Gracias al primer préstamo que se le concedió en ADICLA las condiciones de vida de el y la de su familia han mejorado porque ahora ya tienen luz en cada rincón de su casa. Uno de las grandes aspiraciones de el es ver que su comunidad se desarrolle y mejorar aún más las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Life gave him the opportunity to work as a driver. This is what he wished for, not only an open door but whatever was behind the door.  And what he found was something that he wanted to be. He is 23 years old and has big dreams to support the transportation needs of his community, transporting people from one place to another.  He has had to acquire another loan in order to continue transporting people to their various destinations and thus generating more income for the benefit of his family.

The motive behind seeking another loan from ADICLA is for the same necessity that obliged him to seek the first; to improve his family's living conditions since they still lack adequate living conditions.

Before he had received any loans, his living conditions were not adequate, but thanks to the loans provided by ADICLA, he was able to improve his living conditions a little bit for himself and his family.

He will use the second loan to buy gasoline in order to have a functioning vehicle with which to transport the people in the community that need transport services.

Thanks to the first loan from ADICLA, his living conditions and those of his family have improved because now they have light in the house.  One of his biggest dreams is to see his community develop and to improve even further the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Hashimu

texts.en:
Hashimu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hashimu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his son, Mashel.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hashimu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hashimu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Hashimu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his son, hoping to eventually ensure he is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his child's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dina Concepcion

texts.es: Dina es una joven de 18 años de edad que se gana la vida vendiendo prendas de vestir tanto para damas y caballeros la cual realiza de forma ambulante en el mercado municipal y os cantones cercanos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre, su padre y sus 5 hermanos de 17, 15, 11, 9 y 5 años de edad a los que trata de apoyar con las ganancias de su negocio. Dina desea realizar una inversión en su negocio que le permita tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa interior, faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, etc.
texts.en:
Dina is an 18 year old young woman who earns a living selling articles of clothing for men and women, as a street trader in the municipal market and nearby cantons. She lives with her mother, father and five siblings aged 17, 15, 11, 9 and 5 in their own home. She tries to support all of them with the earnings from her business. 

Dina would like to make an investment in her business which would allow her to offer a larger quantity of products to her customers. To do this she has asked FUSAI for a loan to invest in underwear, skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, etc.

loans.use: to invest in underwear, skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS GARDENIAS” está conformado por socias dedicadas al comercio minorista. Elizabeth tiene 54 años de edad es conviviente con 01 hijo educando. Ella se dedica a la fabricación de muñecas de trapo hace un año a pedidos de sus clientes y para expenderlos en forma ambulatoria. Y a la vez presta servicios domésticos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de telas hilos agujas y accesorios (ojitos boquita manos pies cabellos hecho a base de lana). Su mayor deseo es darle una carrera profesional a su hijo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elizabeth es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The “LAS GARDENIAS” group is made up of female members who work in the retail trade.

Elizabeth is 54, and lives with her partner and one child who is in school. For the last year she has made rag dolls to order for her customers, and to sell as a street vendor. At the same time she provides domestic services. She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, needles and accessories (little eyes and mouths, hands, feet and woolen hair). Her greatest wish is to give her child a professional career. 

The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan offered. Elizabeth is the first person on the right.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles and accessories.

loans.name: Flor De La Canela Group

texts.es:
Filomena es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones de 20 y 15 años y una hija mujer de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de telas para la confección de polleras para cholita.
Ella es buena madre, sincera, Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un área caracterizada por la tradicional feria que se realiza los jueves y domingos, donde se puede encontrar desde un aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura ambiente entre 1-12 grados centígrados que varía durante el día y todo el año. 
Filomena es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español para el comercio (sentada, la segunda de la izquierda, suéter gris). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos; el mayor trabaja y estudia y los menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas domiciliario. Sus ganas por ampliar su negocio la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como: taller de costura, venta de productos cosméticos, elaboración de colchones,  venta de chamarras, venta de mandiles y lana, venta de chompas de alpaca y venta de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de telas para la confección de polleras de cholita; La confección de polleras coloridas y brillantes para las cholitas, hechas siguiendo las características de las prendas típicas de la mujer boliviana, han traspasado fronteras en los últimos años y hoy se comercializan en países como: Perú, Argentina, Chile y Brasil. Pero, además son una tendencia para la moda nacional, porque son consideras polleras para la vida diaria. “las prendas para las cholitas se confeccionan en talleres de la ciudad, con telas por rollo que llegan desde Japón, China y Korea a los almacenes de la zona. Allí se encuentran las novedades. La confección de una prenda demora entre dos a tres días…” explica. Su sueño es tener su fábrica de telas artesanales, y desea realizar la compra de tela por mayor, debido a los pedidos que tiene para las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 14 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Filomena solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela para la confección de polleras para cholita.
texts.en:
Filomena is a 39 year old married woman, with two sons ages 20 and 15 and a daughter age 10. She has a business selling fabrics to make traditional layered skirts. She is a good mother, sincere, intelligent, compassionate, responsible and hard-working. She does her business in the "16 de Julio" are of the city and an area known for its traditional market on Thursdays and Sundays, where once can buy anything from a sewing needle to a tractor. The climate is cold and dry, with an average temperature of 12 degrees centigrade that varies between day and night, all year.

Filomena is short, has a dark complexion and long curly hair. She dresses traditionally and her first language is Aymara and her second language is Spanish, which she uses in business. She is seated in the photo, second from the left in the grey sweater. She shares her life with her husband, a construction worker, and her children. Her oldest child works and studies, the others study in school. They lives in a rented home with potable water, electricity and domestic gas. Her desire to expand her business brought her to form a bank of people who have businesses such as: seamstress, selling cosmetics, making pillows, selling jackets, selling tablecloths and wool, selling alpaca sweaters, and selling sweaters. They seek a loan to help their businesses prosper.

Her business is selling fabrics to make traditional layered skirts. She makes colorful and brilliant clothing, in the traditional style for Bolivian women. The items have been sold internationally in Peru, Argentina, Chile and Brasil. But, in addition they are a national style of dress because they are considered for wearing for daily use. She explains, 'the items are made in workshops in the city, with fabrics that come from Japan, China, and Korea to stores in the area. There the accessories are found. Making an item takes 2-3 days.

Her dream is to have a workshop that makes traditional fabrics and wishes to use this loan to buy fabric at wholesale due to the orders she has for the end of the year parties.

This is the 14th loan sequence with the institution in 10 years with this business. It is for these reasons that Filomena seeks a loan to buy fabric to make traditional layered skirts.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make traditional layered skirts.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and married with one child.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, rice, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, beers, etc. to sell.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from prepared food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, rice, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Samai's Group

texts.en:
Samai, 39, lives with family members in a rural village of Battambang province. To support his family members, he can earn income via rice cropping on two hectares' area. Moreover, he can earn more income via teaching in school. This is his third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loans. 

Samai is leading a group of three to get a new loan. He will spend his entire loan portion to buy pesticide, seeds and pay for harvesting fee. He hopes that he can get more yield than before.

loans.use: To buy pesticide, seeds and pay for harvesting fee.

loans.name: Soliga

texts.en: Soliga is a 63-year-old woman who is married and has four children. She has a small bingo business to earn a living. She has been operating the business for eight years. Soliga needs a loan to buy bingo cards, a table top machine, bingo daubers, and a bingo cage. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Soliga joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bingo cards, a table top machine, bingo daubers, and a bingo cage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages, water, soft drinks, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Rusminah

texts.en:
This is the story of Puji, daughter of Rusminah :

"I come from a poor family. My father works as a construction worker. I was the second of four children. My mother was a housewife. My income is uncertain father and just enough to meet daily needs, a job as a construction worker is not steady job. And the cost of the school is still very difficult for our parents.
I hope the loan from Kiva, can assist me in completing school. And can help ease the burden on my parents. I say many thanks to the lender, who has given a loan to me and my friends who are still in need of a loan to finish school. "

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education fees at vocational school

loans.name: Yatimah

texts.en:
This is the story of Eva, daughter of Yatimah :

I was the fifth child of five siblings.  My father works as a laborer with an income of 500,000, - per month, whereas my mother is a housewife.

My father's income cannot provide for the family every month because my sister is also still in school and requires no small cost. Sometimes my mother sells as a peddler on trains. A  little can help, but the conditions of sale on the train are currently very difficult.  Finally, proceeds were not possible and only enough to eat everyday.


With a very complicated condition, I hope to get a loan from Kiva. So that I can stay in school until completion.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter 's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merly is 33 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Merly has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
This is the story of Dede, daughter of Tri: 

"I was born in a poor family. My mother and father work as farmers with an income of more than 400,000 IDR per month. However, these revenues can only provide for day-to-day expenses, while the cost of our school is very difficult. We very much hope that Kiva would greatly help ease the burden on my parents. Thank you."

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education fees at vocational school

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Gerelmaa, 46 years old, lives with her two daughters in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook in a restaurant since 2000. Her elder daughter is pregnant and stays at home. Her younger daughter studies at the university. 

Gerelmaa is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to buy a plot of land for agricultural use. She will grow vegetables on her land and, later, sell them at the local market.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hog-raiser and operator of a motorcycle transport within her locality. She is married and blessed with two children. She and her husband have been doing their best to have a better way of living and to increase their income.

Cynthia plans to buy new chains and tires for her motorcycle transport and some amount will be used for feed for her raised hogs, but her capital is not sufficient.

With regards to this matter, she is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan for further improvement of her businesses. Cynthia has been running her motorcycle transport business for eight years, while running her hog-raising business for ten years.

loans.use: to buy new chains and tires for her motorcycle transport and feed of her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, la joven es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina natural por mayor para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: The young woman with the blurred face is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She sells natural medicine in the municipal market. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her son. She seeks a loan to buy natural medicine at wholesale in order to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Nouern's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Battambang province, Nouern is 43 years old and a mother of seven children. For the sake of her family, she grows rice on a half-hectare area and plants sesame on a half-hectare area. She can earn income about 28,300 KHR per day.  

This is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get more yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 33 years old and married with three children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a food vending in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork rind, cheese, corn, beans, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Deliro

texts.es:
Delirio tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Delirio se dedica a brindar servicios de carpintería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 6 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo compra de material de carpintería-madera, dicha inversión le servirá para realizar trabajos de madera y poder tener en stock artículos de madera, con gran influencia en el negocio; Delirio piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delirio is 36 years old, single and childless.  He lives with his family in a rural area in the Oyotún district in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  His community is primarily devoted to agriculture, livestock and commerce.  Delirious is devoted to carpentry.  He owns his own tools and has over six years of experience in the business.  His business is located in his home.  

He is seeking a loan to purchase wood, an investing that will allow him to complete his carpentry work and have wooden items in stock, which will benefit his business.  Delirious hopes to increase his productivity so that he can serve the diverse needs of his customers.  This will allow him to increase his profits, increase his earnings and in so doing, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: purchase wood.

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre que sabe aprovechar muy bien su, al vivir en una zona rodeada de naturaleza, supo montar en un terreno su negocio de carpintería, donde compra la madera a proveedores autorizados para no dañar su entorno. 
Es el orgulloso padre de una hija de 20 años de edad y todos sus esfuerzos son centrados en ella, en que tenga una buena vida, una educación, oportunidades para salir adelante.
Oscar presenta unas necesidades y es que la falta de madera, madeflex, triple, un sellador, tinte, pintura y por ello solicita un crédito dado que no tiene el dinero para comprar estos importantes insumos que los necesita para trabajos que en el momento se encuentra realizando.
texts.en:
Oscar is a man who knows how to make good use of his environment.  He lives in a region that is surrounded by nature.  He started his carpentry business on a plot of land on which he purchases the wood from authorized purveyors so as not to damage the environment.  He is the proud father of a 20 year old daughter, and all of his efforts are placed on her so that she can have a good life, a good education and opportunities to get ahead.

Oscar is currently in need as he is missing wood, madefllex, triple, a sealer, dye and paint.  For these supplies he is seeking a loan as he does not have the capital to purchase the important materials that he needs to complete the work he has left to do.

loans.use: purchase wood, made flex, triple, a sealer, dye and paint.

loans.name: Meritcho

texts.en:
Meritcho is 35 years old and married with two children currently in school.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Meritcho has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, soft drinks, cereals, coffee, sugar, etc.  In the future, Meritcho would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer, living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Nimol is 27 years old. She is a mother of two children, one is in school and the other one is too young. To earn a living, she grows rice on a five-hectare area as her main source of income.  She also plants sesame to earn more income. 

This is her seventh cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions in a gradual pace. In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide and to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes that she can get more yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide and to pay for harvesting fees.

loans.name: Segundo Juan

texts.es:
Segundo Juan tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Vive con su cónyugue y su hijo. Vive en el caserio puente Techin, el caserio de puente techin es un caserio mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, cuya actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura, ditrito mediano y está ubicado en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaen, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Segundo Juan se dedica a la elaboracion de adobes para construcción de casas, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con clientela en la zona, ademas Segundo Juan se dedica ala cria de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, etc, él es natural de su caserio de puente techin. El destino del crédito es para invertir en su negocio arreglos de sus hornos y herramientas. Invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptale para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo Juan is 39 years old, married, and has one son dependent upon him. He lives with his wife and son. He lives in Techin village, a medium-sized village with the desire to grow. Its main activities are business and farming. It is located in Pucara district, Jaen province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Segundo Juan makes adobe bricks used in the building of houses. He has more than 5 years of experience in the field for his good service and experience with customers in the area. Segundo Juan also raises small farm animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc. He was born in this region also.

The loan will be used to invest in his business by making repairs on his ovens and tools. Investing in his business and being able to acquire utilities will improve his quality of life..

loans.use: to invest in his business by making repairs on his ovens and tools.

loans.name: Marta Monica

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 51 años de edad, separada de su esposo que inicio años atrás su negocio de tienda general como necesidad económica ante la falta de oportunidades para emplearse.
El negocio lo aprendió a medida que conseguir las estanterías, básicamente preguntando a tenderos y hoy gracias a esta tienda puede conseguir el sustento para su hogar.
Marta quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido general básicamente refrescos, lácteos y víveres que son los productos de mayor movimiento.
Los problemas que enfrenta marta son la inseguridad en el sector y los altos costos de insumos por ello el crédito  para comprar en cantidades y poder sacarle una mejor ganancia a sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta is a 51 year old woman and she is separated from her husband.  Years ago, she started her general store due to her financial need and the lack of employment opportunities.  She learned the trade as she went along, basically by asking other shopkeepers.  Today, thanks to this store, she is able to provide for her household.

Marta is seeking a loan to purchase an assortment of beverages, dairy products and groceries, which are the most purchased items.  The problems that Marta faces are insecurity in the region and the high cost of supplies, which is why she is seeking a loan to purchase in bulk and be able to generate a greater profit from her sales.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of beverages, dairy products and groceries.

loans.name: José Fortunato

texts.en:
José Fortunato is already a grandfather and shares his home with several generations. Cooking and providing hot water for his whole family is very costly and time-consuming. LP gas prices are always increasing, and the family collects wood in the forest or buys it on a daily basis to cook and heat water, filling the house of toxic smoke. 

This will change now, since José Fortunato will not pile his cows' waste up outside the farm anymore, but input it in his large biodigester. The methanization process of the manure will produce precious biogas, which will be connected to the cook stove in the kitchen and the boiler in the bathroom. He and his family will cook and bathe using biogas, taking advantage of an abundant and free resource on their farm, cow waste. The bacteria in the biodigester also produces a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer. José Fortunato will not have to buy the chemical and unsustainable fertilizers anymore, since from now on he will spread the biofertilizer, allowing him to increase his corn  yield in a natural way and respecting the soils. His cows' waste will not contaminate watersheds anymore, nor attract flies, and his whole farm will become a more comfortable place to live.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 M3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou is 33 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Malou has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Malou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Put's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Battambang province, Put is 57 years old and a mother of three dependent children. To support her family condition, she grows rice on a two-hectare area and plants sesame to earn extra. This is the fifth cycle for Put with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. 

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy seeds, and pesticide and to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm to get more yields.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide, and to pay for harvesting fees.

loans.name: Astrid Elena

texts.es:
Astrid es una mujer de 33 Años de edad, madre de 2 hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad, felizmente casada y desde el año 2012 inicio con su negocio de decoración el cual aprendió gracias a capacitaciones que tomo.
Astrid busca en su negocio poder generar empleo, ofrecer nuevos productos, siempre innovar, sostenibilidad de negocio, aumentar las ventas, mejorar el flujo y fidelidad de clientes y es por ello que solicita un crédito que usara para la compra de una maquina plana que necesita para realizar diferentes arreglos y sorpresas que ella misma ingenia.
Astrid espera tu ayuda, con esto puede mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir apoyando a la formación de sus hijos
texts.en: Astrid is a happily-married 33 year old woman who is the mother of two children ages 12 and 5. In 2012 she began a decorating business, a skill she learned through some classes she took. Astrid expects that her business generate income, offer new products, always innovative, a sustainable business, improving customer loyalty. She seeks a loan to buy a die cutting machine that she will use to make different arrangements and surprises that she designs. Astrid awaits your help, and with this loan she can improve her quality of life and continue paying for the education of her children

loans.use: to buy a die cutting machine, in order to make innovative surprises that she designs herself.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old, married, and has six children, five children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alma has been in the business for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Byambagerel

texts.en: Byambagerel, 29 years old, lives with her parents and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She used to be a seller at a grocery store in the past two years. Based on her previous experience, she wants to open a grocery store on her own. For this cause, she is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT. This loan will be used to buy food stuffs and pay rent. If her business succeeds, it will be a big help to her family.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Aldemar Antonio

texts.es:
Aldemar es un zapatero muy polivalente, creativo y muy trabajador que se dedica a la zapatería, fabrica calzado de cuero, es padre de 3 hijos de 17, 12, 10 años de edad.
Inicio su propio negocio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo viene de una familia de zapateros y hoy sigue su ilusión en pie y aspira a que una de sus hijos continúe esta tradición.
Aldemar tiene varios pedidos por entregar pero su falta de capital para invertir en materia prima es lo que lo tiene frenado, por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de una máquina para cocer cuero y bastante surtido en cuero y suelas.
Apoya a Aldemar, tu ayuda mantendrá viva, un negocio familiar que ha pasado de generación en generación
texts.en:
Aldemar is a very versatile, creative, and hard-working shoemaker. He makes leather footwear. He is the father of 3 children who are 17, 12, and 10 years old.

He started his own business because he enjoys the work, and it is his calling. He comes from a family of shoemakers, and he hopes that one of his children will continue this tradition.

Aldemar has many orders to fill but lacks money to buy raw materials, which has his business at a stand-still. He is requesting a loan to purchase a leather-sewing machine and to stock up on leather and shoe soles.

Support Aldemar - your help will keep alive a family business that has been passed down from one generation to the next.

loans.use: to purchase leather and shoe soles, so he can keep on steady footing this craft that has been passed down in his family

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo es una sonriente, tolerante, respetuosa y energética persona propietaria de una tienda general donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar.
Es madre de un hijo ya mayor de edad, y a sus 51 años de edad trabaja diariamente entre 9 y 11 horas.
Amparo necesita con urgencia un crédito que se encuentra solicitando pues uno de sus implementos más importantes de su tienda se averió la cual es su nevera y por ello se encuentra tan apurada con el crédito pues necesita lo más pronto posible su ayuda. 
Amparo es una mujer casada de 51 años de edad que solo quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida, apóyala tu puedes hacer la diferencia.
texts.en:
Amparo is a smiling, empathetic, respectful, and energetic person. She is the proprietor of a general store, where she offers products for the basic family food basket. 

She is the mother of a son who is already an adult, and at her age of 51, she works every day between 9 and 11 hours.

Amparo urgently needs the loan that she is applying for, since one of her most implements in her store, her refrigerator, broke down. For this reason, she is very much in a hurry about the loan, since she needs your help as soon as possible.

Amparo is a married woman of 51 who only wants to improve her living conditions. Help her. You can make the difference.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a very important asset, since she runs the risk that the refrigerated products will spoil.

loans.name: Ludys Margoth

texts.es:
Ludys es la orgullosa madre de 5 hijos y gracias a su negocio de venta de granos y verduras ha logrado junto con su esposa mantenerlos y guiarlos por un buen camino en una zona que ha sido muy golpeada por la violencia y pro la pobreza donde se ven cazas de madera, algo inestables.
La falta de capital ha sido el principal impedimento para que esta mujer tenga un mejor volumen de ventas, ya que los clientes están pero no tiene para invertir.
Con la confianza que está depositando interactuar en ella desembolsándole una cantidad de dinero la cual invertirá en abarrotes y verduras podrá mejorar sus ventas, y darle sostenibilidad a su negocio razón por la que se siente muy feliz y pide su ayuda a participar en la transformación de una vida.
texts.en: Ludys is the proud mother of 5 children. Thanks to her business selling grains and vegetables she has been able to support and guide her children, along with her husband, along a good path. Their area has been affected by violence and poverty, with houses made of wood which is not stable. The lack of capital has been the main barrier to her having more sales, as the customers are present but she doesn't have the money to invest. With the confidence from Interactuar she has a loan to buy groceries and vegetables with the goal of improving her sales, giving her sustainability in her business. She is very happy and asks for your help in participating in the transformation of a life.

loans.use: to buy groceries and vegetables with the goal of improving her sales.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La Sra. Pablina es una persona muy trabajadora, que esta luchando para que cada día pueda ir creciendo y mejorando, ella tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, comenta que por medio de este trabajo puede ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, con lo que podrá surtirse con verduras, carnes, frutas, hortalizas y demás, y comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva le fue muy útil.
texts.en:
Señora Pablina is a very hardworking woman who struggles each day to grow and improve.  She has a shop where she works every day from the early morning hours.  She says that through this work, she can help her family and her loved-ones.  

Pablina is requesting this loan to buy various supplies for her store; she will stock up on vegetables, meats, fruit, and other items.  She says that her previous Kiva loan was very helpful.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia is 58 years old and married. She lives in Manukan, Zambo. Del Sur. For the past two years, Vevencia has been a farmer. She earns 3,000 PHP each month for her other side business  retailing vegetables and spices and is a new member of PMPC. Vevencia is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business of selling ornamental plants.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nidia Luz

texts.es:
Nidia es una madre cabeza de familia que tiene a su cargo 3 hijos, se separó de su esposo y este no volvió a responder por los hijos. 
Nidia una vez ocurrido este suceso busco alternativas, desde conseguir un empleo tocando en puertas, donde encontraba un no por respuesta y desesperada hablo con un amigo quien le aconsejo que inicia a vender mercancía que él le enseñaba del oficio y hoy por hoy se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía de uso personal.
Gracias a este negocio ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar y quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una vitrina y variedad de surtido de productos de  uso personal,  ampliando su oferta a los clientes.
texts.en:
Nidia is the head of her family, caring for three children. She separated from her husband, who does not help support them.

When this happened, Nidia started searching for alternatives. She looked for a job by knocking on doors, but she always got "no" for an answer. Discouraged, she talked with a friend, who advised her to sell merchandise herself and he would teach her how to do it. These days, she makes her living selling personal products.

Thanks to this job, she has been able to support her household. She wants to request a loan to purchase a display case and to stock her supply of personal products so she can offer more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a display case and to stock up on personal products to sell

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marciana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Marciana has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap, 51 years old, is a mother of nine children living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She supports her family through rice cropping and plants sesame to earn extra income. This is Sopheap's sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. As leader of this four-member group, Sopheap will spend her portion of this loan to buy seeds and pesticide and to pay for labor. She hopes that she can get a better crop yield than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide and to pay for labor

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 17 mujeres inspiradas por un progreso digno y por mejorar la calidad de vida de cada una de ellas, tienen deseos de superar la pobreza en cada uno de los indicadores del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Irma ella demuestra siempre una actitud positiva dedicándose a su labor de todos los días en la elaboración de encaheju, un tipo de tejido de Paraguay,  frazadas y hamacas está mejorando su nivel de ingresos, además ella comenta que también tiene una actividad secundaria, ya que trabaja como limpiadora en la escuela. Es una muy buena artesana, y por sobre todo una persona luchadora.
 Solicita de este préstamo para la compra hilos, agujas, telas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con la confección de hamacas, frazadas y demás.
texts.en:
The committee consists of 17 inspiring women on a journey of dignity and to improve the quality of life of each member. They have the desire to overcome poverty in each one of the poverty elimination program indicators.

One of the members is Irma. She always has a positive attitude and works every day making "encajeju", a traditional weaving of Paraguay, blankets, and hammocks . Her level of income is improving. In addition, she comments that she also has a secondary job cleaning the school. She is a very good artisan, and above all a tenacious person. She seeks a loan to buy threads, needles, fabrics, and other items in order to be able to continue making hammocks, blankets., and other items.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, fabrics and other items.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Due to its coastal location, most people in the town of Carles, Iloilo, rely on fishing. For the past 18 years, Corazon has spent her time fishing with her husband. She is also engaged in a hog raising business. Corazon has worked hard to support her three children, aged 14, 16 and 18. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for fishing boat repairs, piglets, feed and supplements for her pigs. Her income will be used to pay for school fees, house repairs and healthy meals for her family. In the future, she hopes to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for fishing boat repairs, piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Mary Jenny Vi

texts.en:
Mary Jenny Vi is 28 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Mary Jenny Vi is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jenny Vi has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jenny Vi would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar desde el año 1996 se desempeña como independiente como animador musical, este cantante de música vallenato es muy reconocido por su sabor y la alegría que contagia en cada fiesta que es contratado.
Cesar es padre de dos niños de 7 y 5 años de edad y con este negocio ha logrado llevarles una buena calidad de vida.
Lo que le da nostalgia a cesar es no tener el recuerdo de sus eventos, no poder compartirlo con el festejado estos gratos momentos que solo quedan en la memoria y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos cámaras videograbadoras con el fin de dar un nuevo servicio donde les dará un video de este bello momento que recordaran y contaran a próximas generaciones.
texts.en:
Since 1996, Cesar has made his living as an independent musical entertainer. This singer of vallenato music [popular Colombian folk music] is well known for his stage presence and the happiness that he spreads at every party where he is hired.

Cesar is the father of two children who are 7 and 5 years old. With this job, he has succeeded in giving them a good quality of life.

Cesar regrets not having a way to preserve the memory of his events - he can't give the guest of honor a record of those happy moments that only live on in memory.

He is requesting a loan to buy 2 video cameras, so that he can offer a new service where he gives his customers a video of that wonderful occasion, which they will remember and pass on to future generations.

loans.use: to purchase 2 video camaras

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock men's and women's clothing

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.en:
José Miguel is an experienced Mexican farmer who has been raising cows and pigs for many years. When he found out about Sistema Biobolsa, he was very interested in transforming what he always considered as waste into a productive resource: his animals' manure. By producing his own biogas and biofertilizer from his cows' and pigs' waste, he is making sure he will not worry about the increasing LP gas prices anymore, nor about the purchase of chemical fertilizers. The biodigester is also giving him a space to input the kilos of waste produced every day, which he used to pile up outside his farm. Not only was this contaminating the watersheds, but it was also producing greenhouse gases and attracting swarms of flies. With his biodigester, José Miguel will treat his animals' waste and improve his farms' productivity and the yield of his corn fields in a natural way - all of this by saving money and displacing fossil fuels.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Dorjderem

texts.en: Dorjderem, 26 years old, lives with his mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a construction engineer since 2012. During the past six months, he was so busy doing his work and now winter has come and he has some spare time for renovating his house. As winter comes to Mongolia, it is essential to repair and insulate his house. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as cement, planks and fiberglass. After renovation, he and his mother will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Edilenda

texts.en: Edilenda, 47 years old, is known in the Dapitan area for her sari-sari (convenience) store. She actively participates in the various programs and services that PMPC offers. Edilenda has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and wood because she hopes to live comfortably, in a decent house. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and wood for her house.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro tiene 58 años, está casado, es comerciante tiene una carnicería en su casa, donde vende todo tipo de cortes de carnes, de primera calidad. 
El Señor se dedica a esta actividad hace 1  años, y en este poco tiempo ya se hizo muy conocido y tiene muy buena clientela, gracias al buen producto que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de animales, para poder faenar y vender los cortes de primera en su carnicería. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Pedro is 58 years old, married, and has a butcher shop in his home where he sells all cuts of first-quality meat. He has had this business for a year, and in this short time he has become well-known and has many customers thanks to the good products he has. He seeks a loan to buy animals to butcher and sell the quality cuts in his butcher shop. He is thankful for the opportunity he receives to be able to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy animals to butcher.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Marlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is in the hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is a 33-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 1. She is in need of capital to sustain her hog raising business.

Rosalyn is asking for a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, pig feed and vitamins. These materials will be of great help for Rosalyn and her family to continue her current livelihood. In the coming months, she will raise and sell healthy pigs. With this, she could now prepare nutritious diets for the whole family.

Rosalyn hopes that she could expand her hog raising business to support the education of all her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Ledys Janeth

texts.es:
Ledys es una humilde mujer que con poco ha creado mucho como se puede apreciar en la foto tiene una panadería, montada en un negocio de tablas, un material algo inestable y que en cualquier momento puede caer, pero ella sigue trabajando pues esta panadería es lo que le da el sustento de su familia en la foto ella junto con su hija.
Su mayor sueño es poder algún día comprar una vivienda, pero no tener una vivienda de madera, como las que comúnmente se ven entre sus vecinos puesto que es un sector muy golpeado por la pobreza y el conflicto armado, quiera una en material.
Sabe que para ellos debe mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, tener sostenibilidad de negocio, ofrecer productos nuevos y aumentar su cantidad de inventario lo cual no ha podido hacer ante la falta de un horno para fabricar los panes por ello solicita un crédito que invertirá exclusivamente en un horno para suplir estas necesidades y siempre pensando en que su condición de vida van a mejorar.
Esta morena espera tu apoyo.
texts.en:
Ledys is a humble woman, who has made much out of what little she had. As you can see in the photo, she has a bakery in a building made out of boards. This is a rather unstable material that could fall at any moment, but she continues working. This bakery is how she supports her family. She is shown in the photo with her daughter.

Her greatest dream is to be able to one day buy a house. She wants one that is not made of wood, which is what is usually seen in her neighborhood, an area that suffers from a lot of poverty and armed conflict. She wants a house made of quality construction materials.

She knows that to achieve her dreams, she needs to improve sales, gain more customers, increase her productivity, have a sustainable business, offer new products, and increase her inventory. But she can't do any of this without an oven to make the bread.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she will use exclusively to buy an oven to cover her needs, always keeping in mind that her living conditions are going to improve by it. This lovely woman awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, which she needs to make more bread

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 44 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom are in school.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizers for her farm

Yolanda has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre que se encuentra muy feliz, muy entusiasta y es muy optimista, pronostica que el buen corazón y la ayuda de dios lo apoyaran para este proyecto en el cual busca ampliar sus campos de Maíz.
Este nuevo proyecto no solo le traerá a Ricardo felicidad, le colabora a mejorar su cantidad de inventario a generar mayores recursos, pues es un hombre solitario sin familia que trabaja por sobrevivir.
no solo se beneficiara él si no que gracias a tener campos más amplios podrá ofrecer trabajo a personas y seguir llevando su producto al mercado del cual miles de agricultores gozan pues tiene gallinas que se alimentan de estos.
solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, riegos, y cercos para marcar su nuevo territorio
texts.en:
Ricardo is a man who is very happy, very enthusiastic, and optimistic. He seeks to expand his fields of corn with the support of his good heart and God’s help. This new project will not only bring Ricardo happiness, he will work to improve the amount he grows to generate more resources. He is a lonely man without a family who is working to survive.

He will not only benefit. Thanks to having larger fields, he may offer work to people. He will continue brining his product to market where thousands of farmers shop since their chickens eat his corn.

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, and fences to mark his new land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, and a fence to mark his new land

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rosa de Lima está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las expectativas de poder crecer y salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Noelia, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras frescas y de estación, por medio de este trabajo tiene la forma de poder ayudar a su familia, es una persona por demás luchadora y trabajadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called Santa Rosa de Lima is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee.  It is a new group that has expectations of being able to grow and get ahead.  They are doing the Elimination of Poverty survey, in which six of them find themselves under the poverty line.

One of the group members is Señora Noelia.  She works selling fresh and seasonal fruits and vegetables.  With this job she has a means of being able to help her family.  She is an extremely tenacious and hardworking person.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables.  In this way she can continue with her sales, fighting to improve herself.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu, 41 years old, is separated and lives in Olingan, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. To earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement. 

Marichu wants to earn more, so she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional feed. Marichu really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old, married and has two children, two of whom are in school.

Teresa is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Teresa has been in this business for 19 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Leonor

texts.es:
Desde los años 80 Rosa tomo el negocio familiar el cual heredo de su madre y hasta el día de hoy continua operando una tradición que quiere mantener viva y espera que uno de sus 4 hijos ocupe.
Gracias a su madre Rosa aprendió todo lo que sabe en cuanto a la profesión de confección y le gustaría no solo trabajar a terceros si no que comenzar su línea propia y expandir sus posibilidades de ganancias, por ello solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de telas con la que sacara blusas para dama. 
Su principal ventaja es que tiene largo recorrido y conocidos que estarían dispuestos a comprar su productos solo necesita un voto de confianza y personas que la apoyen para iniciar su proceso de prendas propias.
Apoya se participe de la evolución de una empresaria que quiere cambiar su forma de trabajar para mejorar  sus ventas.
texts.en:
Since the 1980s and to this day, Rosa has operated the family business which she inherited from her mother. It is a tradition that she wants to keep alive and hopes that one of her four children will take over some day.

Rosa learned everything she knows about the tailoring profession thanks to her mother and she enjoys this work.  This includes not only working with third parties but also starting her own line and expanding her earning potential.   

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics with which she will make blouses for women.

Her main advantage is that she has been around for a long time and is well known so people are ready and willing to buy her products. She only needs a vote of confidence and people's support to start her own garments processing. Support is part of the evolution of a businesswoman who wants to change her manner of working to improve sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric to start her own line of work.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor, un hombre que heredo el negocio familiar de producción de leche y que adopto como necesidad económica pues en el campo básicamente o eres agricultor o te dedicas a los animales.
Una dificultad y que se ha convertido en problemática social es  bajo precio del litro de leche que obliga a estos empresarios a comprar más animales, produciendo más para ganar incluso lo mismo que hace unos años ganaban pero lo complicado del asunto es que deben comprar vacas preñadas para que produzcan leche y estas tienen un alto costo por tal razón la suma de la ayuda que solicita Héctor es alta pues comprara dos vacas lecheras, esperando a cubrir el déficit que le ha presentado la reducción del precio del litro de leche.
texts.en:
Héctor, a man who inherited the family business of milk production, adopted this business as an economic necessity. In the countryside, people are basically a farmer or tend to animals.

One difficulty that he has is because of social problems. The low price of milk per liter forces these entrepreneurs to buy more animals to produce even more while earning the same as they earned a few years ago. The matter is complicated because they should buy pregnant cows to produce milk but these have a high cost. For this reason, the amount of the loan requested is high because Héctor wants to buy two dairy cows. He hopes to overcome the shortfall that has led to the reduction in the price of a liter of milk.

loans.use: to purchase two pregnant dairy cows that have a high price

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 66-year-old resident of Dapitan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines, is married to a fisherman whose catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years.  


In 2008, Lydia and her husband joined Paglaum MPC to avail a loan to buy fishing nets. In addition to the financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed add-on benefits such as insurance and savings.  

Since she wants to be more productive, Lydia has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fish for resale. 

With Paglaum’s help, and with her husband's patience and diligence, she looks forward to becoming a successful vendor and eventually owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en: An old woman living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Yun is 61 years old and the mother of six children. To improve her family's living conditions, she grows rice on a two-hectare area and works for others for a fee. She can earn an income of about 26,100 KHR per day. This is the fourth cycle for Yun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the labor fee to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can harvest her rice on time and get a good yield.

loans.use: to pay the labor fee to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 64 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Adela has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as feed, rice, soft drinks, canned goods, chocolate drinks, milk, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, etc.

Adela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Chuluun

texts.en: Chuluun is a professional accountant who has worked for the military department for ten years. Her husband transports goods between districts. Using her previous loan, she and her husband have renovated their house. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to install an electric heater and hardwood floor into her house. These installations will help her family to live in a more comfortable and warmer place where even less coal is required for heating. Less coal means less pollutants in the air.

loans.use: to install an electric heater and hardwood floor in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia tiene una despensa bien completa que con mucho sacrificio fue montando y ampliando, es una clienta recurrente de fundación paraguaya y también de kiva, comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda ya que le permitió poder surtir su negocio.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para la compra de bebidas varias para su despensa, y de esa forma poder tener bien surtido su negocio. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad de acceder al préstamo que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Julia has a well-stocked store, which, with a lot of sacrifices, she has set up and expanded. She is a recurring client of Fundación Paraguaya and also of Kiva. She says that her previous loan was very helpful, as it allowed her to stock her business.
Today she asks for a new loan to buy a variety of beverages for her store, and in this way be able to keep her business well-stocked. She is thankful for this new opportunity to access the loan she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages for resale.

loans.name: Alba Lucía

texts.es:
Alba un día al encontrarse sin trabajo, sin una entrada de dinero, tomo la decisión de dejar de tocar puertas buscando emplearse y decidió optar por el emprendimiento, comenzó su negocio de cría de cerdos y pollos su empresa está en funcionamiento desde el año 1989 y espera seguir en pie esta ya añeja forma de vivir. 
Alba es madre de 2 hijos su mayor aspiración es mandarlos a Medellín a que comiencen con sus estudios que sean profesionales y aspiren a una mejor forma de vida por ello debe trabajar para recoger capital para poder ejecutar este proyecto.
Alba solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y concentrado lo que le permitirá en este mes de diciembre tener mayor número de animales a la venta.
texts.en:
Upon finding herself one day without work and without a means of getting money, Alba made the decision to stop knocking on doors looking for employment.  She decided to opt for entrepreneurship and began her business raising pigs and chickens.  Her business has been functioning since 1989.  She hopes to keep going with this already-established means of living.

Alba is the mother of two children.  Her biggest aspiration is to send them to Medellín to begin studying to become professionals.  She wants them to aspire to a better means of living, so she is working to get money in order to embark on this project.

Alba is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of chickens, pigs, and concentrated feed.  This will allow her to have a greater number of animals to sell this December.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and concentrated feed as she looks to send her children to school in the capital city.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es una madre cabeza de familia de 42 años de edad que gracias a su cafetería ha podido generar el sustento para sus tres hijas, inicio su negocio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y sus conocimientos fueron empíricos, fue más las ganas y la necesidad la que la llevaron a montar su cafetería.
Eugenia Buscando mejorar sus ventas, darle sostenibilidad a su negocio, quiere invertir en su negocio comprara silletería, mesas, surtido, ampliara su oferta de productos para el desayuno y almuerzos, ofrecerá mayor productos, pues busca un sueño ambicioso de poder darle a sus tres tesoros una educación universitaria.
Eugenia Espera tu ayuda.
texts.en: Eugenia is a 42 year old head of the family. Thanks to her cafeteria she has been able to earn income to support her three daughters. She started her business because of her dedication to independent work, and she learned through experience. It was more because of her desire and necessity that she opened her cafeteria. Eugenia wants to improve her sales and strengthen her business. She wants to invest in her business and buy chairs, tables and assorted products in order to broaden her offer of products for breakfast and lunch. She will offer more products because she dreams of giving her three treasures a college education. Eugenia expects your help.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, assorted things in order to broaden her offer of products for breakfast and lunch.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Conchita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, noodles, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, noodles, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 63 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alfreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Alfreda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, sugar, coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Alfreda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres, es un joven muy trabajador, luchador y sobre todo muy sacrificado.
 Enrique  emprendió su actividad hace mas de 8 años, primeramente empezó como cobrador trabajando para otra persona, hace más de seis meses se independizo y empezó compra productos varios para la venta y así trabajar por cuenta propia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas, calzados y demás, para poder vender y seguir luchando para crecer como microemprendedor.
texts.en:
Enrique is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a very hardworking, tenacious young man, and above all, very selfless. 

Enrique got started in his business more than eight years ago, beginning primarily as a collector for another person. Then, more than six years ago, he went out on his own and began buying various products to sell so that he could work for himself.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of garments, shoes, and more, in order to sell and continue striving to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy garments, footwear, and more

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia una mujer de 44 años de edad que supo aprovechar su hogar para conformar un negocio de venta de alimentos, su mayor orgullo es ese pequeño refrigerador que pueden ver en la foto donde puede almacenar sus alimentos no pedeceros sin duda su mayor adquisición que para ella significa un paso grande para seguir progresando.
Es una mujer sin hijos que busca mejorar sus ventas, con la expectativa de en un futuro poder abrir un restaurante su tan anhelado sueño, por ello solo le queda trabajar y ahorrar para llegar a cumplir este sueño.
Ofelia se siente muy motivada y por ello solicita un crédito que usara para invertir en alimentos básicamente en pescado que es el principal ingrediente en sus preparaciones, sabe de las propiedades y que bien preparado puede lograr un sabor.
Ayuda a esta humilde mujer que si se alegró con un refrigerador no se puede llegar a imaginar la satisfacción que le pueden dar, Ofelia espera tu ayuda.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a 44 year-old woman who knew that her household would benefit if she started up a business selling food.  Her main pride is this small refrigerator that you can see in the photo.
