This is where she stores her perishables.  However, being her biggest acquisition, for her it symbolizes a big step toward progress.

Ofelia, who has no children, is seeking to increase her sales, hoping that in the future she can open the restaurant that she has always dreamed of.  To do this she must work and save to accomplish her dream. 

Ofelia is very motivated, and so she is requesting a loan that she will use to invest in food, mainly fish, since this is the main ingredient in her dishes.  She knows the properties of fish, and when it is well-prepared it is very flavorful.

Help this unassuming woman who was so delighted to get a refrigerator.  You can't imagine the satisfaction that you can give her.  Ofelia awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of fish

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Chantha, 40, is a local resident living in Battambang province and a mother of six children. To overcome the family’s hardships, she grows rice and plants sesame to earn more income to support her family’s needs. For Chantha, this is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get a bigger yield than before.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is from the village of Dicayas, Dipolog. She is 52 years old and is a widow. Wilma owns and operates a specialized retail store selling rice cakes, juices and other refreshments in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients, repair her store and use as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and use as working capital

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen las Mercedes  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty.
La Sra. Marciana es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una pequeña despensa, y comenta que desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones y las charlas vaya mejorando en su microemprendimiento.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos varios para su despensa, como ser frutas, lácteos, panificados, verduras, carne y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Virgen las Mercedes group is in its 2nd cycle in the women's committee program. It is in the city of Curuguaty. Marciana is one of the members of the committee. She has a small general store and she says that she wants to improve her micro-business over time and through the help from the trainings and the talks.  

She is asking for this loan to buy different products for her store, such as fruit, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, meat and more. She is grateful for the opportunity that they are all receiving to be able to improve their and their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, meat and more.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Retailing helps Violeta's family survive. She retails rice and brings in a meager income of Php 6,000 per month. She finds the business of buying and selling rice easy and simple because all she needs to do is to weigh and repack the rice for her buyers. Violeta plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of rice to sell. Violeta smiles at the thought of seeing all of her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch a general store business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is managing her eatery business in Olingan. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Vit resides in Kampong Cham province. She is 43 years old and a mother of three children. To support her family, she grows cassava and pepper for her main source of income.

For Vit, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree in university. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job, after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree in university.

loans.name: Maria Abelina

texts.es:
Recinto San Juan de Puerto Quito un lugar de clima cálido húmedo su gente es amable y muy trabajadora, en este Recinto sus habitantes son muy unidos y todas las tardes organizan encuentros deportivos, para fortalecer sus lasos de amistad 
En este Recinto vive y tiene el negocio la señora María una mujer luchadora de 59 años, es madre soltera de su anterior relación tienen 12 hijos el mayor de 42 años y la ultima de 16 años, tiene una casita humilde en la que vive junto con sus ultima hija, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia, cuando se separó de su esposo tuvo que luchar duro para salir adelante junto con sus hijos, al negocio le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias, ella viene de familia de bajos recursos económicos y no pudo estudiar, pero gracias a su esfuerzo sus hijos tendrán una vida mejor ya que estuvo apoyándolos para que se preparen y sean profesionales 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio en el arreglo y ampliación del local, con esta nueva inversión mejorara sus ingresos económicos y podrá continuar ayudando a la preparación de la última de sus hijas, la señora María agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The area of San Juan de Puerto Quito is a place with a warm and humid climate. Its people are friendly and very hardworking. There the people are very united and every afternoon they organize sports events to fortify their friendships. 

This is where María lives. She is a 59 year old woman and she is a fighter. She is a single mother who from her previous relationship has 12 children. The oldest is 42 and the youngest is 16. She has a humble little house where she lives with her youngest daughter. She sells fast food, an activity she learned on her own initiative. When she separated from her husband she had to fight to get ahead with her children. She spends an average of 8 hours a day at her business. She comes from a low income family and she wasn't able to go to school, but thanks to her efforts her children will have a better life because she was supporting them so they could become educated and graduated from college.  
 
She is asking for this loan to invest in the business to fix it up and expand the locale. With this new investment she will improve her income and be able to continue helping to educate her youngest daughter. María thanks the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity they have given.

loans.use: to invest in her business by fixing up and expanding the locale and growing as a micro-business woman.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 27 years old and married, with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase stock, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan, to further build her business. Jessica has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es: Maria  tiene 49 años de edad, es una señora de nacionalidad colombiana, son  4 hijos sus hijos mismos que  son mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive con Maria, el esposo de esta señora se dedica a trabajar al jornal, Maria comenta que tuvo que salir  desde Colombia ya que ahí existen muchos enfrentamientos entre los militares y la guerrilla, por este motivo se traslado a  Ecuador con su familia y comenta que en este país tiene una vida tranquila, y aquí se dedica a la crianza de animales menores para apoyarse en los gastos del hogar, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando y tener para los gastos básicos.
texts.en: Maria is a 49 year old Columbian woman; she has 4 grown up sons, one of them still lives with her.  Maria's husband makes a living doing daily labor jobs.  She mentions that they had to leave Columbia as there is a lot of conflict between the military and the guerrilla. For this reason she decided to move to Ecuador with her family. She says that in this country she has a quiet life and she makes a living breeding small animals to help with the household expenses.  She will invest the loan in buying pigs to improve her business and keep working so that she still has enough for basic expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 54 years old and married, with three children. She is in the agriculture business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Dulce requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock. She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Dulce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis es un empresario de la zona de turbo de Antioquia una área reconocida por su producción de plátano y sede del principal puerto de embarco y desembarco del país.
Luis es un hombre soltero y como urabeño se dedica a la venta de plátano, una actividad que aprendió solo pues prácticamente nacen con dicha habilidad.
En Urabá hay bastantes problemas de seguridad pública, bandas armadas que cobran una cuota por trabajar y es difícil salir adelante en este medio.
Luis quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar plátano en grandes cantidades, abastecer sus clientes y buscar siempre progresar.
Su mayor sueño es tener una plantación de plátano y trabajara para ello diariamente pues quiere ser reconocido como el mayor comerciante de Urabá.
texts.en:
Luis is an entrepreneur from the zone of Turbo, [in the Urabá region] in Antioquia, an area known for its production of bananas and for being the location of the principal port of embarkation and disembarkation of the country.

Luis is a single man, and as an Urabeño, he sells bananas, a business that he learned by himself, since he was practically born with this ability.

In Urabá, there are quite a lot of problems of public security and armed bands that charge a fee to work, and it is difficult to get ahead in this way. 

Luis wants to apply for a loan to buy bananas in large quantities, to stock his customers and always seek to make progress.

His great dream is to have a banana plantation, and he will work for that every day, since he wants to be known as the greatest marketer of Urabá.

loans.use: to buy bananas to distribute to the various merchants who come to Turbo looking for bananas.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a 54-year-old entrepreneur from Carles, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari store business for 34 years where she sells merchandise such as bath soap, biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods, spices and detergent soap. Daisy also invests her time in a hog-raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy shampoo, coffee, sugar, milk, fruit juice powder, bath soap, detergent, canned goods, insect repellent, soft drinks, feed and supplement. Daisy hopes to save and live an abundant life now that her seven children are adults.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is 42 years old, married and has two children, one of whom in school. Marian works very hard to provide for them.

Marian runs a ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell for her business.

Marian has been in this business for 1 years and sells a variety of items.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Chanluch's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Chanluch is 37 years old. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family via rice cropping and working as a construction worker to earn extra income. For Chanluch, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en:
Chhin, a mother of four children, is 44 years old, and a villager from Kampong Cham province. She struggles for a living via selling pork, and she grows rice to earn more income.

For Chhin, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two, to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pork for resale and to pay for labor, for harvesting her rice. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle, better than before.

loans.use: to buy pork for resale and to pay for labor, for harvesting her rice.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Morelia Amparo

texts.es:
Morelia es una atractiva madre cabeza de familia con una hija de 11 años de edad que representa todo para ella, es su fuerza y su inspiración para superarse cada día que busca iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que ha realizado anteriormente en otro empleo similar pero cansada de largas jornadas laborales mal pagas iniciara su propia negocio formalmente.
Como es una persona humilde que carece de dinero lo hará con la ayuda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas grande, compra de implementos, licuadora, picadora, surtido en alimentos. 
Morelia espera de su negocio buena rentabilidad, sostenibilidad y que le permita llevar el sustento y hacer muy feliz a su familia sea con poco pero con lo suficiente.
texts.en:
Morelia is an attractive mother and head of the household, with an 11-year-old daughter who means everything to her. She is her strength and her inspiration to improve every day. She wants to open a business for the sale of fast food, an occupation which she previously had in similar employment. However, she was tired of the long working days and the bad salaries, so she will start her own business, officially. 
Since she is a woman of scarce resources, she will do it with the help of a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of a large food truck, utensils, a blender, a mincer, and stock of food. 
Morelia hopes that her business will have good profitability, sustainability, and will allow her to support and make her family happy, even if it is with little, but at least enough.

loans.use: to buy a large food truck, a mincer, a blender, utensils, and general food stock.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 28 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child, now at his school age. 

Ivy earns income from her hog raising and fattening business and from her little sari-sari store. She’s been engaged in this business for 8 years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of business activity, and that amount is so helpful to support her family needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 6 sacks of booster feeds for her hog raisings and fattening business.
 
Ivy has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Ivy hopes to expand her hog raising and fattening business and to become the supplier in the whole town of Jimenez.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a 56-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married, and her husband is a fisherman. He usually catches squid, because of high demand for dried squid. While he fishes, Ofelia is also busy, running her sari-sari (variety) store to support her family. She also engages in buying and selling of squid from other fishermen. She has four children, two of whom are grown, while the dependents are still aged 17 and 18.

She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline, canned goods, coffee, toothpaste, shampoo, noodles, chips, and candies, and to buy more squid to resell. Her income will be used for the family's daily consumption, tuition fees, and reinvestment in the same businesses.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, canned goods, coffee, toothpaste, shampoo, noodles, chips, and candies, and to buy more squid.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 1 child now at school age. Teodora has been engaged in coconut and copra (dried coconut meat) buying and trading for 10 years already. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a surviving spouse. She earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. 

Teodora has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts and copra for resale. Teodora has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her coconut and copra trading business.

loans.use: buy coconut & copra

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old and married with three children.  Edna is in the agricultural business, fattening and selling pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Edna has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy piglets, feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 52 years old and married with six children. Eliza works very hard to provide for them.

Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, candies, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Eliza has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, candies, cooking oil, noodles, etc.  Eliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 56 years old, married, and has four children.

Loreta is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Loreta has been  for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & farm supplies

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 56 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.   Emelia has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, coffee, shampoo, etc.

Emelia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Crismela

texts.en:
Crismela is 54 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school.

Crismela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan funds to purchase more stock for the store, of groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and she also earns an income from a computer gaming station.

Crismela aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the store, of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 51 years old, married, and has five children. Two of her children are in school.

Norma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 11 years, now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Sib's Group

texts.en:
Sib is 49 years old and married, with five children. He lives in a rural area of the Somrorng Tong district, in Kampong Spue province. To make a living, Sib has been farming rice for about 31 years. He can earn about 15,000 KHR per day.

This is the first microloan for Sib with VisionFund. Now he is applying for a loan. As the group leader, Sib wants to use his portion of the loan to build a decent latrine for using by his family. He hopes that this loan will enable him to have a clean latrine to use, so as to make living better.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for using by his family.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old and a married woman. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Imelda has a business selling spices and vegetables, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more stock of spices and vegetables, to sell at her food stall. Imelda has been in this business for twenty years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business, and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices and vegetables, to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a tailoring and fabric printing services business in the Philippines. Erma has been in this business for 15 years, and she earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more materials for her tailoring and fabric printing services business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her tailoring and fabric printing services business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To rent a harvest machine to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Jhon Edison

texts.es:
John es un hombre serio, amigable, atento, responsable y confiable que quiere iniciar su propio negocio de transporte de alimentos una idea que siempre ha tenido y que ha ido ahorrando para comprar el camión que hoy ven en la foto, lo pagara a cuotas pero para pagar su primera cuota le hace falta capital, razón por la cual solicita un crédito para ajustar el dinero e iniciar a trabajar lo más pronto posible.
Junto a John esta la persona que lo hace sonreír, lo hace feliz, que representa todo para él, el motivo de superarse y arriesgarse a ser independiente con el objetivo de darle una mejor vida a ella su hija de 3 años que saca el lado más tierno de este hombre que espera su ayuda para iniciar lo más pronto posible con su idea de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jhon is a serious, friendly, courteous, responsible, and reliable man who wants to begin his own business of transporting food, an idea that he has always had, and for which he has been saving to buy a truck, which can now be seen in the photo. He will pay for it in installments, but he lacks capital for the first payment, which is the reason why he is applying for a loan, to settle the payment and begin to work as soon as possible.

Next to Jhon is the person who makes him smile, makes him happy, and represents everything for him, his motivation to achieve and to take a chance on being independent, with the goal of giving a better life to her, his 3-year-old daughter, who brings out the tender side of this man who is waiting for your help to begin as soon as possible with his business idea.

loans.use: to make the payment for the truck that can be seen in the photo, with which he will transport food.

loans.name: Christine Mary

texts.en: Christine Mary is 27 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Christine Mary works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Christine Mary has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. She has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, noodles, etc. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sani, Jamima and Serah.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Yahaya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Qariba

texts.en:
Qariba is 50 years old and is married with four lovely children. Qariba is an IDP (internally displaced person) and she lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region.

Qariba has cows. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 22 years and breeds cattle. She prepares dairy products (cheese, yogurt, milk, etc.) to sell in the local bazaar and to her neighbors to earn money. Her husband is a teacher but he is helping her in his free time.

Today she needs 1,500 AZN because the stall of her cows is in danger of falling down. She wants to repair her cow stall.

Qariba is thankful for the help from the Kiva organization and lenders

loans.use: to repair her cow stall.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y comenta que sus metas son estudiar para salir adelante, terminar su carrera y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
En algún momento dado formar un negocio propio, y poder administrarlo.
Pide este préstamo para pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Ramona is from the city of Carapeguá. She is studying in the program in business administration, and she comments that her goals are to get an education to get ahead, to finish her program, and to thus continue helping her family, and at some point, to form her own business and to be able to manage it.

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un empresario inmerso en el mundo de las confecciones, como se puede observar en la foto se especializa en la ropa interior.
Su negocio es una empresa hereda por su familia y en ella emplea dos personas aprendió todo gracias a su padre.
Con la ayuda de un crédito Miguel podrá confeccionar un nueva prenda que serían cami-busos lo que representara para su negocio un gran avance pues llegara a nuevos mercados con la expectativa de mejorar las ventas y hacer crecer su negocio.
Su principal sueño es comprar una casa, una ilusión que le quita el sueño pensando en cuando llegara ese día.
Miguel espera por tu ayuda.
texts.en:
Miguel is an entrepreneur immersed in the tailoring world; as can be observed in the photo, he is specialized in undergarments. 
His business is a company inherited by his family, and there he employs two people. He learned everything thanks to his father. 
With the help of a loan, Miguel will be able to tailor new garments, in this case, sweaters. This will mean a great advance to his business, because he will reach new markets with the expectation of improving sales and grow his business.
His main dream is to buy a house, a dream that keeps him awake at night, thinking of when this day might come. Miguel is hoping for your help.

loans.use: to buy fabric to start a new tailoring line of sweaters.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has a six-year-old daughter. For four years she has been helping her husband in their fishing business, to earn a living. Letecia always makes sure that whatever her husband needs is ready for him to use, and she also sells his catch.

She is asking a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy four drums of crude oil, for his daily fishing. Through this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch and earn a better income for their family.

In the future, she dreams of seeing their fishing business more successful.

loans.use: to buy four drums of crude oil

loans.name: Gisselle

texts.es:
Gisselle  está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Informática, cursando tercer año, comenta que se esta esforzando al máximo para poder ser una buena profesional y también poder servir a las demás personas.
Ella esta poniendo todo de si para poder cumplir con su meta, y también poder ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Gisselle is studying in the program in computer engineering. She is in her third year. She comments that she makes every effort to be able to be a good professional and also to be able to serve other people.

She is putting all of herself into being able to complete her goal and also to be able to help her family. She is requesting this loan in order to pay her university fees and in this way to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

She has been running a pre-paid mobile load business in the Philippines for 3 years, and also earns an income from food vending. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchased additional loads to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Yolanda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchased additional mobile loads to sell.

loans.name: Isily

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Isily works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a personal products retail business.

Isily is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing gear, and other equipment for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman, and she has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old, and she has two children who are still in school.

Flora has a coconut-fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more coconut fruit to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut fruit to sell.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es:
Adalberto es un muchacho muy trabajador, responsable se dedica mucho a sus estudios  desea salir adelante con sus esfuerzos para llegar a su meta. 
Su sueño es de tener su título de ingeniero agrónomo y así poder ayudar a los agricultores, y a las personas más necesitadas. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Adalberto is a very hard-working and responsible young man. He works hard at his studies and wants to advance with his efforts to reach his goal.

His dream is to have a degree in agronomic engineering and thus be able to help farmers and the people most in need.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his program fees and in this way be able to continue with his work, as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo sigue la carrera de psicología, esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser un excelente profesional y poder servir a las personas de la sociedad. Comenta que ya tuvo un préstamo anterior de kiva y que le fue muy útil en sus estudios.
Hoy pide nuevamente un préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Rodrigo continues with his program in psychology. He is putting all of himself into being able to be an excellent professional and being able to serve people in society.

He comments that he had a previous loan from Kiva and that it was very useful to him in his studies.

Now he is again asking for a loan to be able to pay the fees for his program and in this way be able to continue with his studies. He is grateful for the new opportunity that he is receiving and that will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-preparation business.

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
Jonelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has businesses, a general store and clothing sales, in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 32,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, shorts, pants, footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing sales business.

Jonelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Jonelyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, shorts, pants, footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun, a villager from a rural area located in the Somrong Torng district, in Kampong Spue province, is 30 years old and married. She has two dependent children. One is too young for school, and the other one is in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are rice farming and working as a garment worker. Having been in this business for 10 years, she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 14,000 KHR each day, after the expenses.

Sinoun has just come to VisionFund for her first loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sinoun wants to use her portion of the loan to build a proper latrine, for using by her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine, for using by her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es el mayor de tres hermanos, él trabaja para pagar sus estudios. Lo que le inspiro a seguir la carrera de criminalística  es su abuelo, ya que fue policía y su padre también lo es.
 El quiso seguir alguna carrera relacionada a esa actividad ya que tiene buenas posibilidades de conseguir un buen trabajo y le gusta la carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan is the oldest of three siblings. He works to pay for his education. What inspired him to follow a course in criminology is his grandfather, since he was a policeman, and his father is also.

He wants to follow some career related to this work, since he has good possibilities of finding a good job, and he likes this program.

He is requesting this loan to be able to cover the fees at his university and continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan esta estudiando la carrera de medicina, comenta que sueña con poder ser un buen medico, que pueda ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud.
Es un joven con grandes visiones en la vida y está luchando por ellos. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esta forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan is studying in the program in medicine. He comments that he dreams of being able to be a good doctor who can help other people in something as important as health.

He is a young man with great visions in life, and he is working hard for them. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for his program and in this way be able to continue with his education.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rosilyn

texts.en:
Rosilyn is a married woman with four children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Her oldest is 14 and the youngest is 2 years old. She engages in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic items including cooking oil, sugar, eggs, noodles, canned goods and soap. Her husband earns a living by farming and being a driver as well.

Due to financial problems, Rosilyn is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy various groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and a few sacks of rice.  With these supplies, she will fill her store and attract buyers to purchase. Slowly, Rosilyn can now manage her finances, and hopefully will augment her income and she will be able to provide the needs of her growing children.
 
Rosilyn would like to operate her business well and successfully for the improvement of her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy various groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and a few sacks of rice

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 62 years old and married woman with eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mildred has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mildred has been in this business for 40 years.  In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a fifty year old, married woman with one grown child. She lives in the town of Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living by raising and selling ducks. To make additional income, she also raises and sells hogs. She has been engaged in this kind of business for two years now.

Violeta is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy duck feed, pig feed and vitamins. This will help improve the quality of animals raised by Violeta. In the coming months, she could raise and sell more animals, thus creating a higher income that will help with the family's daily expenses.

Violeta dreams of expanding both her businesses to make them productive. Hopefully, that would lead to a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy duck feed, pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha lives in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. Sokha is a 46-year-old married mother of five children. To make a living, Sokha has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day.
 
Sokha has been with VisionFund for six cycles and she completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Reyceber

texts.en:
Reyceber is a 34-year-old mother to two children ages five and twelve. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in fishing together with her husband. She also operates a sari-sari store and direct sells Personal Collection products.

Reyceber is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and Personal Collection products such as hand and body lotion, cologne and fabric softener. Her income will be used for her children's needs like food and school fees.

Reyceber hope that she can have the chance to improve her family's living conditions through the loan's help and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and Personal Collection products

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 45 years old and has seven children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Gorgonia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Gorgonia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Gorgonia has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gorgonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Chhnang province, Rithy is 50 years old and a mother of two children. For her family, she grows rice on a two and half hectare area as her main source of income. Moreover, she earns additional income via pig-raising.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Technology.

She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Technology.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Samaki Meanchey District

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Rithy, 53, is from a rural village located in the Kong Pisey district of Kampong Spue province. He is married with one kid. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice. He and his wife have been in this business for 35 years. The current business earns his family about 25,000 KHR per day.

Rithy has just been with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to build a decent latrine for his family.

He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for his family's use.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
This is Charity; she is thirty six years old and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. These skills have enabled her to run her enterprises more effectively.

Her economic activity is dairy farming and she also operates a greengrocery store selling kale, cabbages and paw paws. She needs a loan to expand her business by adding more stock. This will enable her meet her customers' rising demand for her products.

She looks forward to more profits and plans to use the anticipated income to provide basic needs such as food and clothing to her family.

Charity is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kale, cabbages and paw paws to help meet customers' rising demand.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Leah is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of  saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Pon's Group

texts.en:
Pon is aged 53 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two sons in a rural area located in the Korng Pisey district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer and she has been in this business for 35 years. The current business earns her family about 25,000 KHR per day to feed the family and she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day.

Pon is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to construct a proper latrine for her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use.

loans.use: to construct a proper latrine for her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est née  à  Tabligbo  en 1972 et vit dans le quartier de  d’Adidogomé . Elle est mariée et de quatre enfants. Elle veut cet appui pour faire le commerce de petits poissons fumés. Elle achète ses produits à Dénou au Ghana et revend  devant sa maison. Elle souhaite  acheter 6,5 paniers. Elle s’approvisionne 2 fois par  mois. Ce Crédit lui permet de réduire les charges liées au déplacemnt et  d’augmenter ses gains    pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akoua was born in Tabligbo in 1972 and lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. She is married and has four children. She wants this support in order to run a business selling small smoked fish. She buys her products in Dénou in Ghana and resells them in front of her house. She wishes to buy 6.5 baskets. She stocks up twice per month. This loan will permit her to reduce the costs tied to her travel and to increase her profits in order to take care of the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase six baskets of fish.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Alfredo es una persona que esta luchando por ser alguien en la vida, es por eso que esta estudiando, sigue con su carrera de administración rural, donde se destaca por ser un buen estudiante, aplicado. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para seguir sus estudios.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera y seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en: Alfredo is fighting to make something of his life. That's why he works hard studying toward his career in rural administration where his is a distinguished student. He would like to mention that his previous loan was very helpful in allowing his to pursue his studies. Today his is requesting a new loan to pay his tuition and continue to pursue his studies. He is very grateful for the opportunity received.

loans.use: To pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Musaenda Group

texts.es:
En parte de la sierra que cruza el estado se encuentra la comunidad donde fue constituido el grupo Musaneda, para poder llegar al lugar de la reunión se deben recorrer cerca de 35 kilómetros, la carretera está rodeada de sembradíos de caña, hule, café, pimienta, canela, clavo, comino, bambú, limón y naranja. 

El nombre del grupo se atribuye a una flor de la región. Los miembros activos del grupo son:
Leoba -Venta De Verduras
Pascuala -Venta De Dulces
Liliana -Venta De Comida
Margarita -Venta De Tortillas
Antonia –Venta De Ropa 
Deysi - Venta De Frutas Y Verduras 
Senobia -Venta Cosmeticos
Maria Salome -Venta De Antojitos
Alexis -Venta De Papeleria
Eva -Venta De Ropa Y Comida
Barbara -Calzado Por Catalogo
Elvia -Vende Bisuteria, Ropa, Toper, Lenceria Y Comida
Lizbeth - Venta De Ropa Por Catalogo
Joel -Mantenimiento De Equipos De Computo

Deysi tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de un pequeño de 6 años, Christofer, quien estudia en el preescolar ubicado a una cuadra de su casa, ella siempre ha contado con el apoyo de sus padres y hermanos para poder proveer a su hijo. Desde hace 4 años, Deysi decidió iniciar con la venta de frutas, verduras y legumbres en su casa para facilitar a las personas de la comunidad la compra de los ingredientes que más utilizan en la preparación de sus alimentos. Normalmente, las personas debían viajar hasta 30 minutos para comprar o aprovechar cuando otro proveedor entraba a la comunidad de vez en cuando para vender los mismos insumos, pero los productos no tienen la mejor calidad y los precios son demasiado altos.

Deysi necesita comprar jitomates, chiles, cebolla, cilantro, zanahorias, chayotes, acelgas, calabacitas, col, lechuga, jícama, plátanos y manzanas para continuar ofreciendo el servicio de mini verdulería a sus clientes. También ha pensado en adecuar o construir una casita de madera para expandir su negocio y de esta manera acomodar mejor los productos. A veces, por las tardes Deysi también corta café, o va a picar los arboles de hule que se encuentran a un costado de su casa para extraer el material y poner todo a la venta para tener una ganancia extra. La máxima motivación de Deysi es su pequeño y por ello sabe que necesita expandir su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias. 

* La fotografía se tomó en la hulera que esta al costado de la casa de Deysi quien viste un chaleco color azul y está parada delante de Alexis quien viste playera blanca y short beige.
texts.en:
In the part of the mountains which cross this state, you find the community where the group Musaneda is located. To get to their meeting location you have to go about 35 kilometers along a highway surrounded by fields of cane, rubber, peppers, cinnamon, cloves, cumin, bamboo, limes and oranges.

The name of this group comes from a flower in the region. The active members of the Musaneda group are:
Leoba - vegetable sales
Pascuala - candy sales
Liliana - food sales
Margarita - tortilla sales
Antonia - clothing sales
Deysi - fruit and vegetable sales
Senobia - cosmetics sales
Maria Salome - snack sales
Alexis - paper product sales
Eva - clothing and food sales
Barbara - catalog clothing sales
Elvia - jewelry, clothing, lingerie, tupperware and food sales
Lizbeth - catalog clothing sales
Joel - computer equipment maintenance

Deysi is 31 years old. She is the single mother of a six-year-old son, Cristofer, who attends the preschool located one block away from their home. Deysi has always had the support of her parents and siblings to provide for Cristofer. She decided to begin selling fruits, vegetables and legumes four years ago. She sells from her home, and is able to help people in her community purchase the ingredients they use the most in their food preparation. People typically need to travel up to 30 minutes to purchase or obtain from other providers who sell the same supplies but come to their community every once in a while. But their products aren't of very high quality and the prices are very high.

Deysi needs to purchase tomatoes, chiles, onions, cilantro, carrots, chayote, chard, pumpkins, cabbage, lettuce, jicama, plantains and apples to continue offering the service of a mini-vegetable shop to her customers. She has also been thinking about adapting or building a small space out of wood to expand her business, and in this way arrange all of her products better. 

Sometimes, in the afternoons, Deysi also cuts coffee, or to poke the rubber trees which grow nearby her house to extract the material and to put it up for sale to earn some extra money. Deysi's main motivation is her son, and for his sake she knows she needs to expand her business to increase her earnings.

*The photograph was taken in the rubber field adjoining Deysi's house. She is in the blue jacket and is standing directly in front of Alexis who is wearing the white t-shirt and beige shorts.

loans.use: comprara; jitomates, chiles, cebolla, cilantro, zanahorias, chayotes, acelgas, calabacitas, col, lechuga, jícama, plátanos, manzanas

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary; she is forty years old and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. These skills have enabled her run the enterprises more effectively.  

Mary earns her living by doing vegetable farming of kale and onions. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and manure that will help improve on crop yield. She hopes to harvest more, thus improving profits. Mary plans to use the anticipated income to provide family needs such as food and education for her children.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se encuentra ubicado “Grupo Un Futuro Mejor” es una zona productora de caña, sus integrantes decidieron solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund para invertirlo en sus negocios, el nombre surgió porque día con día se esfuerzan para ofrecer un futuro mejor a sus familias. Los integrantes y sus actividades son:

Ernesto- Venta De Abarrotes
Alicia -Venta De Ropa Y Dulces
Dulce- Venta De Ropa Y Caseta Telefónica
Everardo- Venta De Abarrotes
Roberto -Venta De Ropa
Teresa -Venta De Pollo Destazado
Sandra -Venta De Ropa 

La señora Sandra es madre un chico de 13 años y de una joven de 21 quien ya también es madre. Desde hace tres años, Sandra se ha dedicado a vender ropa casual, bolsas, sudaderas y mochilas en un local ubicado en el centro de la comunidad. Recuerda que en un inicio era difícil conseguir clientes, especialmente con la competencia que tiene aunque claro está que las personas siempre buscan la mejor atención, precio y variedad y eso es justo lo que ella ofrece. Sandra inició su actividad para no estar sola en casa y como una manera de aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Además, sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de sus seres queridos: su esposo Tirso siempre la acompaña a comprar la ropa, mientras que Nuria, su hija, se encarga de cuidar la tienda cuando sus padres van a conseguir la mercancía. Por otro lado, su hijo le sugirió recientemente ampliar la tienda y rentar videojuegos a niños y jóvenes, incluso él mismo se ha ofrecido a ayudar a atender esta actividad por las tardes después de terminar su tarea. 

Sandra está muy agradecida con la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo para mejorar su actividad.

*La fotografía tomada en casa de la señora Alicia quien viste de blusa rayada, la señora Sandra viste una blusa color naranja.
texts.en:
The community where the A Better Future Group is located is in a cane producing zone. The members of this group decided to request a loan from VisionFund to invest in their businesses. The name of their group came about because, day after day, they work hard to offer a better future to their families. The members of the group, and their business activities, are: 

Ernesto - grocery sales
Alicia - clothing and candy sales
Dulce- clothing and phone tape sales
Everardo- grocery sales
Roberto - clothing sales
Teresa - sale of butchered chicken
Sandra - clothing sales

Sandra is the mother of a thirteen year-old son and of a 21 year-old daughter, who is also a mother. For the past three years, Sandra has sold casual clothing, bags, sweatshirts and backpacks from a post located in the center of the community. She recalls that, initially it was difficult to attract customers, especially because there was a great deal of competition, although customers always look for the best service, price and variety, and that is exactly what Sandra offers. She launched her business so that she didn't have to stay at home alone, and as a way to augment her family's income. Additionally, she can count on the support of her family: her husband Tirso always goes with her to buy the clothes, and Nuria (her daughter) looks after the store while her parents go out to purchase merchandise. On the other hand, her son recently suggested that she grow the store and start renting video games to children and young people - he himself offered to help look after those sales in the afternoon after finishing his homework.

Sandra is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan to grow her business.

The photo was taken in the home of Alicia, who is wearing a striped blouse. Sandra is wearing an orange-colored blouse.

loans.use: to buy coats and sweaters.

loans.name: Amonon

texts.fr: Amonon est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle est âgée de 56 ans et vend   et vend de la bouillie de maïs et mil il y a 6 ans ; elle achète les  produits de transformation au marché d’assiyéyé Adidogomé. Elle sollicite un crédit  l’achat  de 2,5 sacs de maïs et un sac de sucre. Avec les revenus elle pourra  participer au charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Amonon is 56 years old, married and has five children.  She has been making and selling maize porridge for six years.  She buys all the things she needs for this at the Assiyéyé market in Adidogomé.

Amonon has requested this loan so she can buy two and a half sacks of maize and a sack of sugar.  Her profits will help to pay the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize and 1 sack of sugar for her food production business.

loans.name: Marvin Heriberto

texts.es:
Marvin, de 28 años de edad, está acompañado, no poseé ningún grado académico debido a que sus padres fueron personas de bajos recursos económicos, es padre de un bebé de 6 meses de edad, su compañera de vida se dedica a los labores del hogar y el a la agricultura.

Marvin, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre, se dedica a este trabajo desde la edad de 16 años, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo para poder ayudarle a sus padres y a su familia económicamente y así poder brindarles condiciones de vida más adecuadas.

El utilizará su préstamo para comprar fertilizantes e insumos para su cultivo, Marvin, espera que con lo que obtenga de ganancia cancelará el crédito y con lo restante comprará lo necesario para su hogar.

El sueño de Marvin es seguir trabajando para poder obtener mas ganancia y poder mejorar el nivel de vida para su hijo y demás familia.
texts.en:
Marvin is 28 years old and has a partner. He never went to school owing to his parents having very little money. Marvin is father to a six-month-old baby. His partner is a housewife while Marvin himself is a farmer.

Marvin grows crops and raises cattle, a trade he learned from his father. Marvin has been doing this work since he was 16 years old. He chose this trade so that he could help his parents and family financially and offer them better living conditions.

Marvin will use this loan in order to buy fertilisers and supplies for his crops. Marvin hopes that the profits he earns can be used to pay off this debt and that there will be some leftover to buy necessary items for his home.

Marvin's dream is to continue working in order to earn higher profits and attain a better quality of life for his son and the rest of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Women Of Faith Victory Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Grace. She is forty-one years old, married and lives with her husband and three children. She is a member of Women of Faith Victory Group, and she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to be trained on financial management and enterprise creation.
 
She sells clothes and also runs a hair salon. In addition to that, she does dairy and poultry farming. She has applied for a loan to add stock of clothes and salon products such as shampoo and hair gel to help meet customer demands. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her income, which will then help her to improve her living standards and to provide quality education for her children.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes, hair gel and shampoo which will help improve on sales and service efficiency, and thus generate more income.

loans.name: Celina De Jesus

texts.es: Celina de 27 años vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace varios años, quiere me mejora de su vivienda repellando paredes y colocando piso, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no logar solventar ese gastos por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Celina is 27 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her parents. Celina has been making living selling seafood for a number of years. She wants to make improvements to her house, by plastering the walls and laying a floor, but her income is not enough to pay for this. As a result, Celina is applying for a loan in order to buy cement, bricks and sand, and to pay labourers so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Teresa Margaríta

texts.es:
Teresa, tiene 38 años, está acompañada tiene un hijo que estudia segundo grado, ella solo logró estudiar hasta quinto grado, su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura y ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar y de igual manera le ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo agrícola.

Teresa, junto a su esposo trabaja en la preparación de la tierra donde sembrará el cultivo. En los tiempos que le queda libre, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante casa por casa, para poder generar un ingreso económico más en su familia.

Con el préstamo comprará lo necesario para la siembra de dos hectáreas de cultivo como la semilla , cuatro sacos de abono y los fertilizantes para la preparación de la tierra.

El sueño de Teresa, es utilizar las ganancias del cultivo para poder agrandar su negocio de venta de ropa y poder sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 38 years old and has a partner. She has a son who is in second grade while she herself only attained a fifth grade education. Teresa's partner is a farmer; Teresa is a housewife and also helps her partner with his farming work.

Alongside her partner, Teresa works to prepare the land where the couple sows their crops. When she is free, Teresa works selling clothes as a door-to-door saleswoman in order to order another income for the family.

Teresa will use this loan to sow crops on two hectares of land, and to buy two bags of manure as well as fertilisers to prepare the land.

Teresa's dream is to use profits from the crops in order to expand her business selling crops and to help her son to progress in life.

loans.use: to sow crops on two hectares of land, and to buy two bags of manure as well as fertilisers to prepare the land.

loans.name: Gatarakwa Great Vision Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Gatarakwa Great Vision group, from a small village in Limuru, joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from training on savings mobilization and entrepreneurship development.

The person raising her hand is Loise, who is a member of the group. She is twenty-five years old, married and blessed with one child. She does vegetable farming  for maize, beans and potatoes, and also sells second hand clothes.
 
She is taking out the loan to add stock to her second hand clothes business to help improve on sales volume. She feels that this loan will assist her in increasing her income level, and hence in being able to feed her family.

Loise is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to help improve on sales volume.

loans.name: Shalom Beeds Women Group

texts.en:
Shalom Beeds Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 in order to get training on enterprise creation and management. The group has been able to embrace the training and they are now able to manage their incomes well.
 
The person raising her hand is Wangari, who is a member of the group. She is married and blessed with two children. She does poultry and vegetable farming. 

She is taking out a Kiva loan in order to buy certified seeds that will help improve on crop yield. She hopes for a bounty harvest leading to more income. She plans to plough back the anticipated profits to help in achieving her long term goal of large scale farming.

Wangari is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy certified vegetable seeds that will help improve crop yield and thus increase her supply of vegetables to the market.

loans.name: Victoria  Adjo

texts.fr: Victoria est âgée de  52 ans, mariée elle est mère  trois enfants. Elle vit dans le quartier d’Awatamé.  Victoria est restauratrice et elle prépare et vend   la pâte de maïs et de riz   depuis 2017. Avec ce crédit elle pense acheter  90 bols de maïs et 17 bols de riz. Avec les revenu des ce commerce elle peut contribuer aux charges de la famille et  au besoisn des enfants.
texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old, married and mother to three children.  She lives in the Awatamé district.  She runs a restaurant business and has been preparing and selling maize and rice mash since 2007.

Victoria plans to use her loan to buy 90 bowls of maize and 17 bowls of rice.  Her profits will be used to contribute to the day-to-day expenses of her family and the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 90 bowls of maize and 17 bowls of rice for her food production business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: A djo, âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée  et mère  cinq enfants. Elle achète et revend les épis depuis 2012. Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Lomé  et revend  dans les quartiers environnants.   Elle veut avec ce crédit acheter  6 bols d’aïls, 4 sacs de gingembres et 6 bols de poivres.   ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter la quantité d’achat et ainsi avoir un revenu plus consistant pour participer aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Adjo is 29 years old, married and mother to five children.  She has been buying and selling spices since 2012.  She buys her supplies at the main market in Lomé and resells them in neighbouring districts.

Adjo will use her loan to buy six bowls of garlic, four sacks of ginger and six bowls of pepper.  The loan will allow her to buy more than usual which will enable her to sell more than usual and make more profit.  Her profit will be spent on the expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy 6 bowls of garlic, 4 sacks of ginger and 6 bowls of pepper for resale.

loans.name: Upendo Tumaini Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Upendo Tumaini Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to be trained on financial management, enterprise development and savings mobilization to help improve their livelihoods. 

The person raising her hand is Risper. She is thirty-one years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children. She operates a mobile money transfer (M-pesa) and a general kiosk where she sells items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour and other household items. She has applied for a loan to add stock to her shop so that she can sell more and meet her customers demand. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her income thus she will be in a position to meet family needs such as food.

Risper is very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Nyarukere Group

texts.fr:
Thadée est exclu du groupe Nyarukere après l'octroi du crédit.Sur la photo,il est sur la première ligne et porte une chemise à carreaux. 
Méthode est le représentant du groupe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 36 ans et est marié à Marie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 4 ans.
Il a sous sa charge son beau frère qui étudie.

Il est tailleur et commerçant des habits  depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de mètres de tissus pour la confection des habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  faire un élevage moderne de vaches, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Thadée (seen on the front row, wearing a checked shirt) was excluded from this group after the loan was arranged.

Méthode is the group representative and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 36 years old and married to Marie, a farmer.  Together they have three children aged between one and four years old.  He is also responsible for his brother-in-law who is studying.

Méthode is a tailor, and has been making and selling clothes for twelve years.  This will be his first loan from the field partner, Turame.  It will increase his working capital and allow him to buy many metres of fabric to make clothes.  This will improve his earnings.

In the coming years, Méthode would like to start raising cattle using the modern methods.  He would also like to see his children study.

loans.use: to buy many metres of fabric to make clothing for sale.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
На фотографии девушка по имени Нигора. Ей 25 лет. Она живет на районе Шахритус. Нигора замужем, но детей пока не имеет. Она живет с мужем, свекровью и свекром. Нигора не имеет высшего образования. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина, и поэтому она не сидит дома без дела. Нигора успевает одновременно заниматься домашними делами и работать на скотном дворе. 
   Нигора около 4 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает телят и бычков и после откорма перепродает их с наценкой, таким образом, она приносит в дом значительный источник дохода. На сегодняшний день ей необходимо купить еще пару голов маленьких телят, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить доход. Ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, но для нее такая сумма является большой. Она просит ей помочь собрать недостающую сумму денег.
texts.en: The name of the young woman on this photograph is Nigora. She is 25 years old. She lives in the Shahrituz district. Nigora is married, but does not yet have children. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law. Nigora does not have a college education. She is goal-oriented and hardworking woman and this is why she does not sit at home doing nothing. Nigora manages to concurrently be involved in household work and working on a livestock yard. Nigora has been involved in animal husbandry for about 4 years. She buys calves and bulls and, after fattening them up, resells them with a mark-up, and this is how she brings in a significant source of income home. Today, she needs to buy a couple of young calves in order to save her business and increase her income. She is short a small sum of money, which to her is big. She is asking for help putting together the remaining sum of money.

loans.use: to buy a couple of young calves in order to save her business and increase her income

loans.name: Humura Group

texts.fr:
Espérance  fait partie du groupe  Humura et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Gustave, un électricien. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 3 à 5 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle est tailleur et fait le commerce des habits et des unités téléphoniques depuis  17 ans. 

Elle est son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  du matériel de couture (du fil, tissu,…) pour la confection des habits et des unités téléphoniques à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire dans sa   parcelle, et voir se enfants étudient.
texts.en:
Espérance is part of the Humura group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is 38 and is married to Gustave, an electrician. Together they have two children, three and five years old, both in school.

She is a tailor and has been active selling clothes as well as phone recharge units for the past 17 years.

This is her second loan with Turame. She will use the Kiva loan to increase her working capital and buy sewing materials (yarn, fabric, ...) to make clothes, and buy phone recharge units for resale, to increase her earnings.

In coming years she would like to build on her plot of land and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy sewing materials (yarn, fabric, ...) to make clothes, and buy mobile phone recharge units to resell, to earn more.

loans.name: Ntidusigarinyuma Group

texts.fr:
Dieudonné fait partie du groupe  Ntidusigarinyuma et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 39 ans et est marié à Claudette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 2 à 21 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge sa belle sœur. 

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits,  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire une maison, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Dieudonné is a member of the Ntidusigarinyuma Group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 39 years old and married to Claudette, a farmer.  Together they have seven children aged between two and twenty-one years old.  Currently, three of his children attend school. He is also responsible for his sister-in-law.

Dieudonné has been selling clothing for ten years.  This will be his second loan with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase his working capital and permit him to buy many items of clothing.  This will improve his earnings.

In the coming years, Dieudonné would like to build a house and see his children study.

loans.use: to buy many items of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Pélagie est célibataire et elle est née en 1987. Elle vit dans le quartier de Dabarakondzi. Elle est coiffeuse DEPUIS 2009 et vend aussi des produits de beauté depuis  2013 comme activités complémentaire suite à  nos formations.  Vu la période des fêtes pour éviter la rupture de stock elle veut ce crédit pour acheter 40 unités de mèches outrés et 40 unités de mèches sublimes et 28 pommades bio 16 pour les besoins de ses clientes. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour être plus autonome et aussi aider ses parents dans les charges de frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
Pélagie is single and was born in 1987.  She lives in the Dabarakondzi district and has worked as a hairdresser since 2009.  She has also been selling beauty products since 2013.  She expanded into this business after training supported by the field partner.

She has requested this loan in order to prepare for the end-of-year festivities, and ensure she doesn't run out of stock.  Pélagie will buy forty units of fancy hair extensions, forty units of subtle hair extensions and twenty-eight organic hair creams for her customers.  Her increased earnings will make her more independent and allow her to help her parents provide for her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to buy 40 units of fancy hair extensions, 40 units of subtle hair extensions and 28 organic hair creams.

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr: Félicia est mariée et née en 1977. Elle est mère de quatre enfants et vit à Djifa. Elle fait le commerce des habits pour enfants et produits de talcs depuis 2010 et avec nos formations fait aussi la fabrication de gâteau. Elle veut ce crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de farine de blé, 2 bidons d’huile et les divers. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Félicia was born in 1977, is married and has four children.  They live in Djifa.  She has been selling children's clothes and talc products since 2010.  Now, thanks to training provided by the field partner, she also makes and sells cakes.

Félicia will use this loan to buy six sacks of wheatflour, two drums of oil and various other ingredients.  Her loan will result in a higher income for Félicia and allow her to contribute to the expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of wheatflour and 2 units of oil for her food production business.

loans.name: Makhkam

texts.ru:
Махкам  родился в древнем  городе Истаравшан в семьи рабочего.Махкам женат и имеет 3х детей. Махкам живет со своей семьей душа в душу. Супруги очень уважает друг друга.  Они живут в доме, который недавно построили сами.  
Махкам профессиональный  пекарm с 20 летним опытом работы. Каждый день он готовит до 500-550 штук лепешек.  Ему помогает старший сын Алишер и его дочка Гулчехра . Махкам активный клиент МДО Арванд. Он обратился за  кредитом для ремонта своего пекарного цеха. Заранее благодарит за поддержку для получение кредита.
texts.en: Makhkam was born in a historic town of Istaravshan into a working class family. Makhkam is married and has 3 children. Makhkam lives with his family heart and soul.
