The spouses really respect each other. They live in a house that they recently built themselves. Makhkam is a professional baker with 20 years of experience. Every day he prepares up to 500-550 pieces of flatbread. His oldest son, Alisher, and daughter, Gulchehra, help him. Makhkam is an active MDO Arvand client. He requested this loan to repair his bakery. He is grateful in advance for the support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair his bakery

loans.name: Dédé  Thèrèse

texts.fr: Thérèse est  née en 1956 , elle est  veuve et mère de 02 enfants.  Elle fait le commerce de  de pagnes  il  y a 31 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé  et  revend dans les quartiers environnants. Elle veut avec ce crédit acheter  7 pièces de pagnes de trois différentes sorte pour augmenter son stock vu les périodes de fêtes de fin d’année et ainsi avoir plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses 2 enfants qui sont  à sa charge.
texts.en:
Theresa was born in 1956. She is the widowed mother of two children, and has been trading pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for the past 31 years.

She resupplies at the main market in Lomé and resells in surrounding neighborhoods. She wants to use this loan to buy seven lengths of pagnes in three varieties, and increase her stock in anticipation of the year-end holiday season.

This will generate more income to meet the needs of her two dependant children.

loans.use: buy seven lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Bassiratou

texts.fr: Bassiratou est agée de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle vend divers produits dont : savons détergents omo, savons de toilettes et spirales anti moustiques depuis 2003. Elle s’approvisionne 3 fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé qu’elle revend aux marchés environnants. Elle veut ce crédit pour acheter 8 sacs d’omo so clean, 50 unités de savons de toilettes santex et 58 unité de spirales anti moustique. Ceci lui permet d’avoir plus de revenu et aider son mari dans les charges de famille.
texts.en:
Bassiratou is 34 years old, married and mother to four children.  She has been selling various products (Omo detergent soap, toilet soap and anti-mosquito spirals) since 2003.  She buys her supplies three times a month from the main market in Lomé, and then sells them in local markets.

Bassiratou will spend her loan on eight sacks of Omo 'So Clean', fifty units of Santex toilet soap and fifty-eight units of anti-mosquito spirals.  Her resulting profits will help her husband to provide for the expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of Omo, 30 units of Santex soap and 58 units of mosquito repellant.

loans.name: Jose Yobani

texts.es:
Yobani, de 34 años de edad, es motorista, estudió hasta séptimo grado, por el bajo nivel de ingresos económicos que tenían sus padres le fue imposible continuar, ahora está casado, tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y le apoya en la elaboración y venta de pan, ya que han instalado una panadería en su hogar. 

Yobani, tiene un camión que le sirve para hacer viajes a los equipos de fútbol de su comunidad  y esto le genera ingresos adicionales para ir cubriendo las necesidades de su hogar.-  Además tiene un año que instaló una panadería en su casa, su esposa es quien le apoya mucho en este trabajo, se levantan muy temprano para preparar el producto y luego salen a vender a las casas de su comunidad.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar: harina, huevos, azúcar, leche y ampliar la panadería, ya que está teniendo bastante demanda pero, se le dificulta realizar ésta labor porque el lugar donde hace el pan es demasiado pequeño.

El sueño de Yobani es ampliar la panadería, generar más empleo  en su comunidad, aumentar las ganancias y darle a su familia un nivel económico digno.
texts.en:
Yobani, 34 years old, is a biker. He studied until 7th grade, but due to the low level of economic resources his family had, it was impossible to continue. Now he's married and has two children. His wife spends her time on household activities and supports him in baking and selling bread, as they've installed a bakery in their house.

Yobani has a truck that he uses to make trips to football teams in his community, and this generates additional income to cover his household's necessities. He also installed a bakery in his house about a year ago. His wife is the one who supports him in this work. They get up very early to make the product and later go out to sell it to houses in their community.

He will use the loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar and milk to expand the bakery, since he's having a lot of demand that's difficult to meet because the location where he makes the bread is too small. 

Yobani's dream is to expand the bakery, generate more employment in his community, increase his income and give his family a dignified standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar and milk to expand his bakery.

loans.name: Rahbarjon

texts.ru: Рахбарчон учтивая, энергичная женщина с города Худжанд. Ей 41 год. Она замужем за трудового мигранта, ее муж постоянно ездит в Россию на заработки, чтобы прокормить жену и детей. Рахбарчон живет в городе Худжанд с двумя дочерьми, которым 18 и 9 лет. Рахбарчон сама занимается торговлей. Вот уже 10 лет как она занимается продажей парфюмерии и хозяйственных товаров в магазине. Эту деятельность она начинала при поддержке сестры. Старшая дочь в данный момент помогает матери в бизнесе. Рахбарчон хочет увеличить количество и разнообразие товаров в своем магазине, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов и увеличить объем продаж. Для реализации цели она просит кредит. В канун Рождества она верит в чудо и доброту людей.
texts.en: Rahbarjon is a respectful and energetic woman from the town of Khujand. She is 41 years old. She is married to a migrant worker. Her husband constantly travels to Russia for work in order to provide for his wife and children. Rahbarjon lives in Khujand with her two daughters, who are 18 and 19 years old. Rahbarjon is involved in retail sales. She has been selling perfumes and household goods at a store for 10 years. She started this business with her sister's support. Her oldest daughter currently helps her mother with the business. Rahbarjon wants to increase her quantity and selection of merchandise in her store in order to attract more customers and increase her sales volume. She is requesting this loan to achieve this goal. With the upcoming Christmas, she believes in a miracle and kindness of people.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and household goods in order to grow her business

loans.name: K.  Evamé

texts.fr: Evamé est né en 1983, elle est divorcée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait le commerce de friperie depuis 2010. Elle achète ses produits au marché d’Hédzranawé et revend dans les quartiers environnants. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois. Avec ce crédit  elle veut acheter 75 unités de serviettes, 46 unités de jupes et 50 unités de draps de lits. Les revenus de cette activité lui permettront de s’occuper de l’éducation de son enfant et être autonome.
texts.en:
Evamé was born in 1983, is divorced and has one child.  She has been selling second-hand clothing since 2010.  She buys her products, once a month, from the Hédzranawé market, and sells them in the surrounding neighbourhoods. 

Evamé will use her loan to buy seventy-five towels, forty-six skirts and fifty bedsheets.  She will be able to be independent and pay for her child's education with the earnings that she will make.

loans.use: to buy 75 towels, 46 skirts and 50 bedsheets for sale.

loans.name: Sang's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Korng Pisey District where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Sang is a 37-year-old mother of two dependent children. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income, which she and her husband have been doing for 19 years. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

This is the first microloan for Sang with Kiva’s partner. Now leading her group of four to apply for a loan, Sang, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine, including a latrine bowl, tile draining and sewage. She hopes to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a decent latrine, including a latrine bowl, tile draining and sewage

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Hannah. She is married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to get training on enterprise creation and financial management.

She does dairy, poultry and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed that will help improve milk production. She looks forward to a rise in income thus putting her in a position to meet the family's needs, such as food and clothing. Hannah is happy for Kiva’s support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed that will improve milk production.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Aged 38 years old, Phat is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Korng Pisey district of Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. Her husband supplements their income by working in a garment factory. She has been in this business for almost 20 years, which is challenging with drought.

Phat has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to construct a proper and clean latrine for her family.

loans.use: to construct a proper and clean latrine for her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Mary. She is 46 years old, married and living with her husband and their three children.  She keeps poultry and farms maize and beans. 

She has applied for a loan to buy poultry feed and fertilizer. She hopes that her farming will improve, thus increasing her income by selling more products, which will improve her living standards with decent clothing and better diet.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and fertilizer that will help improve her poultry and crop yield, respectively.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zolia de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de  productos de uso personal y ropa desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Zolia is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. 

Zolia has been making a living selling personal products and clothing for several years. Her business is located in her place of residence.

Zolia is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale merchandise in order to continue with her sales and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase personal products and clothing in bulk

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est marié et père de huit enfants. Il est soudeur depuis 1990 et depuis 2013 il a une activité complémentaire qui est la vente de soja suite à nos formations sur multiplier ses activités. Avec ce crédit il veut acheter 90 bols de sojas et ceci lui permet d’avoir des revenus additionnels pour faire face aux charges des sa famille et à l’éducation de enfants.
texts.en:
Kodjo is married and the father of eight children. He's been a welder since 1990, and in 2013 he started selling soy after following a course provided by the MFI on how to run multiple businesses.

With this loan, he wants to buy 90 bowls of soy to have an additional income in order to cover his family's expenses and the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy 90 bowls of soy

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Fernando de 26 años de edad casado, el motivo por el cual el está impulsado en realizar otro préstamo es para una nueva inversión el cultivo de papas.

Los préstamos eran con otras instituciones, pero no contaban con los beneficios que nos da ADICLA como lo es la forma de pago, intereses mensuales y el capital al vencimiento pus son beneficios que nos ayudan a soñar en un futuro mejor para nuestros futuros hijos.

El uso respectivo que dará el segundo crédito es para la compra de semillas de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder empezar a cultivar más productos para luego venderlas en el mercado de su comunidad y así obtener una ganancias para el sustento de su familia y para que tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada. 

El cambio que realiza un crédito es principalmente asegurar  la cosecha con los insumos y el manejo en general de las cosechas agrícolas, para que las personas obtengan productos de la mejora calidad y es lo que a ocurrió con Fernando que por medio de los prestamos que se les a concedido el a podido obtener mejores cosechas.

Una de las metas de el es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para una condición de vida adecuada y estudios para sus hijos para que se conviertan en profesionales en la vida y seguir cosechando las tierras fértiles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
He works the land under the grueling sun, but he is willing to put in the sweat to offer a better future to his children. Fernando is 26 years old and married. The reason he has been driven to ask for another loan is to make a new investment in his potato crop.

He has had loans with other institution, but they didn't have the benefits that ADICLA gives, such as forms of payment, monthly interest and capital upon maturity. These are benefits that they offer for a better future with his children.

The respective use he will give the second loan is to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer to be able to start to grow more products to later sell in the market in his community. This way, he can make some profits to support his family so they can have good living conditions. 

The change the loan will bring is mainly ensuring the harvest with general management materials for agricultural harvests for people to obtain better quality. Fernando has been able to obtain better harvests through the loans given to him. 

One of his goals is to build houses for his children so they can have a good quality of life and an education so that they can graduate from college, as well as to keep harvesting the fertile land in his community.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 22, 16, 19 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable, emprendedora y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad; un área caracterizada por el comercio informal y popular, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (al centro inclinada, blusa roza). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayor es independiente, los demás estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. La necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso y venta de refrescos, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; masaco de yuca (yuca, carne molida y frita), masaco de plátano (plátano, carne; molida y frita), tamales a la olla (choclo con queso; molido, envuelto y hervido), tamales al horno (choclo con queso; molido, horneado) y zonzo (yuca cocida y molida, queso al gusto, sal al gusto; a la parrilla).  Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana, 2 veces al día  a la hora de almuerzo y cena, en la puerta de su domicilio; “la comida tradicional es un negocio rentable que a todos les gusta comer y es parte de las costumbres diarias…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes y generar mejores ingresos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente, anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante conocido.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida y atender a muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, is single and has four children, ages 22, 19, 16 and 8.  Her business is sellling typical foods.  She is a kind, generous, understanding, patient, supportive, responsible, hard-working, enterprising woman.  She works in the southern part of the city which is known for its informal, popular commerce, warm, tropical, humid climate and a temperature that varies between 18 - 35 degrees Celsius.

Maria has a dark complexion, is rather short and has long black hair.  Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish (she is the one kneeling, wearing pink).  She shares her life with her children, the eldest of which is independent.  The others attend school and the family live in their own brick home which has running water, electricity and a sewage system.  The need to improve her income is what encouraged her to form a communal bank with businesses such as food sales, sport clothes sales, convenience store, meat store, sandwiches, plaster crafts and soft drink sales in order to request a loan and prosper in their activities.  

Maria sells traditional food such as yucca masaco (fried yucca plant and ground beef), banana masaco, tamales (corn and cheese), zonzo (ground, grilled yucca and cheese).  She works every day of the week, twice a day at lunch and dinner times, outside her home.  "Traditional food is a profitable business because everyone enjoys eating every day..." she says.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She wants to invest in her business buying tables and chairs so she can attend to more customers and generate more income.  This is her first loan through the institution in the four years she has been in business independently.  She used to work as a cooking assistant in a well-known restaurant.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her food stall.

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, dedicada al oficio doméstico, acompañada, estudió hasta 8° grado. Actualmente vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos, de 8 y 5 años de edad, su hijo mayor está cursando 3° grado.

María, a través de los años ha adquirido experiencia  en ventas y de esa manera se ha superado, a tal punto que ahora tiene un puesto de ventas de mariscos. Tiene dos equipos de pesca para abastecer la tienda, ella ya tiene 8 años de estar trabajando con ese negocio.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 2 redes para el equipo de pesca ya que las redes que tiene están desgastadas, también necesita darles mantenimiento a los dos equipos de pesca que tiene. 

Por otra parte, busca un futuro mejor para sus hijos, dándole lo necesario para que ellos puedan continuar estudiando y ser profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old. She is a married housewife and has an 8th grade education. Right now she lives with her life's companion and their two children, aged 8 and 5. Her oldest son in the 3rd grade. 

Over the years, María has acquired experience in sales and that is how she has gotten ahead to the point that she has a seafood stall. She has two fishing units to supply the store, and she has 8 years' experience in the business. 

She needs the loan to buy 2 fishing nets because the nets she has are worn out. She also needs to do maintenance on her fishing equipment. 

She also seeks a better future for her children, giving them what they need so that they can continue to go to school and be successful at their jobs.

loans.use: to buy 2 nets for fishing equipment because the ones she has are worn out. She also needs to do maintenance on some fishing equipment she has.

loans.name: Farmonqul

texts.ru: Фармонкул   родился  в кишлаке  Обиборик Ганчинского  района в семье дехканина. Ему 30 лет. Он  женат  и имеет троих детей.  Фармонкул  занимается  животноводством и он очень любит животных. Также он работает строителем, от которого каждый месяц получает 1500 сомони дохода.  Фармонкул хочет увеличитm количество скота. Он подал заявку для получения кредита в МДО Арванд. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и сотрудничество.
texts.en: Farmonqul was born in the village of Obiborik in the Ganchi region of Tajikistan.  He comes from a family of farmers.  He is married and he has three children.  He is involved in animal husbandry and truly loves animals. He also works in construction, an activity from which he makes a monthly income of 1,500 somoni.  Farmonqul wants to increase his livestock headcount.  He has applied for a loan with MDO Arvand.  He thanks you in advance for your support and cooperation.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: Santos de 45 años de edad vive en cas propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la crianza de pollos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: Santos, 45, lives in his own house with his family.  He raises chickens to earn a living to cover household expenses.  He wants to improve his home by building a wall around it in the place shown in the photograph.  But he does not have sufficient capital and is in need of a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and to hire workers.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and to hire workers.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Yadira tiene 42 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, los que estudian en una de las universidades de Managua y trabajan al mismo tiempo. Doña Yadira es dueña de una pequeña pulpería la cual atiende durante la semana mientras el fin de semana vende Nacatamales desde su casa. Toda la familia contribuye en los gastos del hogar pero a pesar de ello la casa todavía no está del todo terminada la cual está construida junto a la pared del vecino, por lo que este siempre se queja cuándo hay ruidos del otro lado. Para evitar estos problemas Yadira quiere construir una pared propia para que ella y su familia puedan vivir en paz y seguir con la venta de Nacatamales. Para la construcción necesita bloques, cemento, hierro, arena y piedrina, lo cual quiere comprar con el préstamo solicitado por Kiva.
texts.en:
Yadira is 42 years old, married and has three adult children who study in a university in Managua and work at the same time. Yadira owns a small grocery store, which she opens on weekdays. She sells nacatamales [a dish similar to tamales] at home on weekends. All the family members contribute to the home expenses. However, their house is not fully built yet: they share a wall with the neighbor, who complains about the noise all the time.

To avoid this problem, Yadira wants to build another wall so that she and her family can live in peace and continue to sell nacatamales. For this, she needs bricks, cement, iron bars, sand and gravel. She plans to buy these things with a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a wall that will help her to avoid problems with her neighbor.

loans.name: Rosa Mabel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 43 años de edad, soltera, realizó sus estudios hasta 9º grado; tiene un hijo de 14 años que vive con ella. Durante el transcurso de su vida, ha obtenido suficiente experiencia en ventas, las cuales hoy en día le han servido para abrir su propio negocio.

Rosa, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, usando como local su casa de habitación, a través de su pequeño negocio ha salido adelante con los gastos básicos de la casa. Rosa, solicita el crédito para poder adquirir más variedad de productos, por ejemplo: camisas, camisetas, pantalones para hombres, ropa de mujer, entre otros.

En un futuro Rosa, desea mejorar su negocio y poder  darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, is single and studied up to ninth grade.  She has a 14-year-old son who lives with her.  During her lifetime she has acquired considerable experience in sales which has allowed her to open her own business.

Rosa sells clothing from home and, through her small business, has been able to cover basic household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products, such as shirts, t-shirts, men's pants, women's clothing, etc.

In the future Rosa wants to improve her business and give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products, such as shirts, t-shirts, men's pants, women's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
En Sololá existe una variedad de negocios donde la gente puede escoger donde consumir sus necesidades diarias.  Pero lo importante no es la cantidad de consumo sino la calidad de esos servicios al cliente.

Margarita mujer de 40 años se ha dedicado, con su zapatería en la comunidad donde ella vive, servir al público con una calidad de servicio.  Se necesita una vocación especial para ello y ella lo tiene porque es una de las negociantes de calzados más buscadas en su negocio.

Dos razones le han motivado para solicitar  un préstamo: ampliar su negocio de zapateria por la cantidad de clientes que le buscan y la necesidad que tiene de construir una casa para sus dos hijos.
  
Las aspiraciones que ella tiene es la ampliación de su tienda para obtener mejores ganancias y para la construcción de su casa para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
In Sololá there are a variety of businesses people can choose from to make their daily purchases.  But the important thing is not how many there are but the quality of the customer services they offer.

Margarita, 40, has served the community where she lives through the quality of her shoe business.  A special vocation is needed for this and she offers it at one of the most popular shoe shops in the area.

There are two reasons why she is requesting a loan: to expand her shoe business to serve more customers and a need to build a house for her two children.

Her goal is to expand the shop and earn more profit to build a house to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business and build a house.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deysi, de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, ella estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica; su esposo es pescador y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa, solo tienen una hija que viven con ellos que también les ayuda a trabajar. 

Deysi, se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos desde hace diez años, su madre fue quien le enseño éste tipo de trabajo,  también vende comida a los pescadores de la zona, a quienes ella les compra el marisco. 

Deysi, solicita el préstamo para comprar más mariscos, porque para esta temporada de Diciembre en la comunidad donde ella reside, realizan eventos turísticos y se vende a mejor precio; el sueño de Deysi es comprar su propia lancha para trabajar y obtener mejores ganancias y así de esta forma ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Deysi, 38, is married and has two children. She studied up to the sixth grade of elementary school. Her husband is a fisherman and helps her with the home expenses. One daughter lives with them and helps them with some work.

Deisy has been buying and selling seafood for ten years. Her mother taught her this activity. She also sells food to the local fishermen that sell her the seafood.

Deysi is requesting a loan to buy more seafood. There are many events for tourists where she lives during the month of December, so she can sell her food at a better price. Her dream is to buy a boat so that she can work and make better profits. This would allow her to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more seafood.

loans.name: Federico Antonio

texts.es: Don Federico, tiene 73 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 4 hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Siempre se dedico a la agricultura y hace 10 años decidido por establecer una pulpería en su casa lo que le genera los ingresos necesarios para sacar a su familia adelante. Vende productos alimenticios como ser azúcar, arroz, frijoles, pan, manteca, huevos, verduras, pastas, condimentos, churros, dulces etc. Ha obtenido varios préstamos para mantener el negocio surtido y con las ganancias cubre los gastos del hogar. Actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 lempiras para comprar mas producto como granos básicos, refrescos, churros, carnes, lácteos, verduras, y otros abarrotes con el fin de seguir vendiendo y obteniendo ingresos y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en: Fransisco is 73 years old, single and has 4 children.  He lives in Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  He has been farming for 10 years and decided to open a store out of his home, which generates income for his family.  He sells food such as sugar, rice, beans, bread, lard, eggs, vegetables, pastas, condiments, churros, candy, etc.  He has had several loans to keep the business stocked and covers his expenses with the profits.  He is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lemiras to buy more products such as basic grains, soft drinks, churros, meats, dairy, vegetables, and other grocery items so he can continue selling and growing his business.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Dúo Dany De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dany de Santo Tomas 
Este dúo está formado por doña Celinda Noemi ella tiene 43 años de edad  y se dedica a la costurería y a la venta de pollo, embutidos en general, pollo rostizado, pollo empanizado, pollo crispy,en su pollería de nombre MI POLLITO ubicado en Santo Tomas Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de pollo amarillo, pollo blanco, embutidos y chuletas de marrano y pollo rostizado, su deseo es seguir surtiendo la pollería darles a sus clientes el mejor servicio que ellas merecen,agradece el apoyo que le han brindado en su negocio y espera que la sogan apoyando ya que nececita agrandar mas su negocio
texts.en:
Dúo Dany de Santo Tomas

This duo includes Celinda Noemi.  She is 43 years old and sews and sells chicken, sausages, roast chicken, breaded chicken, and crispy chicken out of her chicken restaurant called MI POLLITO, located in Santo Tomas Milpas Altas.  She is asking for a loan to buy chicken, sausages, pork chops, and rotisserie chicken.  She wants to be able to provide her customers with the best service they deserve.  She is grateful for the support her business has gotten and hopes that you continue to support her so she can grow her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Guellerma

texts.en:
Guellerma works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Guellerma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Guellerma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jerioth

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Jerioth, who is 31 years old, works hard to support her family. She is both a dairy and a vegetable farmer on her farm. 

Jerioth is taking loan to purchase manure for her vegetable farming business, which she has been operating for the last two years. She hopes this will improve on the crop yield, and thus more supply to the market.  

She hopes that this business will go long way in helping her support her family and improving the overall living standards, such as a quality education for their children.

Jerioth is happy for Kiva, and the support of their lenders.

loans.use: To buy manure that will improve the yield of vegetables.

loans.name: Gabriela Mercedes

texts.es: Gabriela de65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de  pupusas desde hace 7 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de quesillo, frijoles, maíz, chicharrón, harina de arroz, etc. para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Gabriela, 65 years old, live in her own hosue with her husband. She has worked selling pupusas for 7 years. Her business is located in her home. She is asking for a loan to purchase farmer's cheese, beans, corn, pork rind, rice flour, etc. to continue with her work.

loans.use: to purchase farmer's cheese, beans, corn, pork rind, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es: Jose de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de sandias, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sandias por mayor para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en: Jose, 37 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children. He works selling watermelons. His business is located in the municipal market which is near his house. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to get ahead.  He is asking for a loan to purchase watermelos in bulk to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons in bulk.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is separated, with three children now at their adult and school age. 

For her source of living, Leonida earns an income from agri-business, specifically in vegetable gardening and copra trading for almost 20 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing these type of business activities. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and re-trading. 

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Leonida hopes to expand her copra re-trading business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and re-trading

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. 

Maricel is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, shoes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, shoes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for seven years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, rice, soft drinks, coffee, chocolate drinks, sugar, etc. 

Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 55 years old and a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Luzviminda has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 40,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucila is 40 years old, and has three children who are currently in school.

Lucila has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucila has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 31 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Marissa has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell to her customers.

Marissa has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making votive candles and to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Jordin Alexander

texts.es:
El joven Jordin  de 21  años de edad,  no tiene hijos que dependen de él, no tiene esposa y vive en su casa que alquila en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras  y se dedica desde hace 01 año  al negocio de venta de ropa nueva.
Jordin sus clientes son los amigos y personas que le conocen, es una joven trabajador con deseos de salir adelante.
Jordin está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas, chores, blusas, camisas, etc. y tener la mercadería suficiente ya que se acerca la época navideña y vende y es cuando más se vende, con el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante es su en su negocio y poder hacerlo crecer espera también obtener las ganancias necesarias para poder apoyar a su familia.
 Su sueño es tener su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Jordin is a 21-year-old young man. He doesn't have any children who depend on him, he doesn't have a wife, and he lives in his house which he rents in a community of San Lorenzo, Valle in the south of Honduras. He has worked for one year at his business selling new clothing. 

Jordin's customers are his friends and people he knows. He is a hard-working young man with desire to get ahead.

Jordin is asking for a loan to purchase pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, etc. and to have sufficient merchandise since the Christmas season is approaching and that is when he sells the most. With the support of this loan, he wants to get ahead in his business and to be able to make it grow. He also hopes to have the earnings necessary to be able to support his family. 

His dream is to have his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Eduvejes

texts.en:
Eduvejes is 71 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Eduvejes has a little sari-sari store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She is also engaged in a snack vending business, and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for her retail business. 

Eduvejes has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is gaining a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. At the age of 50 and married, she never get tired tending her store since she has driven her passion in selling and she earns a meager income from it that sufficiently supports her family. 

Ma. Fe is a full fledged member of PMPC, and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. 

Now she applied a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase inventory and her sales. 

Ma. Fe continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase inventory and her sales

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.en:
Ruperta has a banana farm in Dullan, Aloran. This is her primary source of income for her family. Ruperta makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and have a good income. 

Recently she needed an amount to pay for irrigation costs, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. 

Ruperta wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor for irrigation to soften tillage pans

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Myrna works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell herbal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Myrna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of herbal products to sell for her buy and sell herbal products business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal products to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna offers a variety vegetables, and runs her hog raising business.She is 51 years old, and married to a construction worker.The couple has been blessed with two children.

Lorna aims to have a stable source of income, so she is requesting financial assistance amounting to 5,000PHP, which allows her to buy more squash and eggplant to sell.

She knows that this amount of loan will help her in increasing her sales and income. In this way, she could improve her living conditions and sustain their family basic commodities.

loans.use: to buy more squash and eggplant to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia offers a variety vegetables and dried fish within her community. She is 55 years of age and happily married. Lydia would like to increase her sales and income but her capital is not sufficient. In this regard she is asking for a loan of PHP5,000. She will use this amount to buy dried fish and a variety of vegetables to sell. She knows that this loan will enable her to improve her sales and income. She hopes that lenders will grant her the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and a variety vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 62 years old; she lives in Oroquieta City, Philippines. Nelia and her husband are both farmers, and this is how they raised their family in sustaining their needs and supporting their children's education. 

Nelia applied a loan from PMPC, of which she became a full-fledged member in July of 2011, amounting to PHP35,000 to purchase additional materials for house completion. 

Nelia wishes nothing more than to provide her family with a decent and comfort living.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to complete the house

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 62 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nelia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as coffee, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell .

Nelia has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as coffee, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remedios is 52 years old, and has two children who are still in school.

Remedios has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has been in this business for 16 years. 

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. Winnie has been in this business for 22 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Winnie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 51 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 25 years, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Karla

texts.es: María, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella trabajo en una empresa privada pero al quedar sin empleo decidió vender ropa como ser blusas, pantalones, camisas y ropa interior. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende por encargos también. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar mercadería como camisas, blusas y jeans para vender en la temporada. Su meta es lograr comprar una motocicleta para salir a otras comunidades a vender ropa.
texts.en: María is 22 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner with whom she has a child and lives in a village of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She worked for a private business but when she was left without work, she decided to sell clothing such as blouses, pants, shirts and lingerie. She has this business in her house and also sells to order. She has asked for a loan of 12,000 lempiras to purchase merchandise such as shirts, blouses, and jeans to sell in this season. Her goal is to be able to purchase a motorcycle to be able to go to other communities to sell clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as blouses, shirts and jeans to sell and to have an income.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, sus padres se separaron y ella quedo viviendo con su madre, quien no daba abasto para cubrir los gastos de la casa, y menos para poder continuar en la escuela; Reina, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, uno de 17 y otra de 10 años de edad, solo su hija menor estudia actualmente, pero los dos dependen económicamente de ella.

Ella elabora tortillas con queso para vender, trabajo que ha sido su fuente de ingreso desde hace muchos años.- Desde pequeña se dedica a este negocio, su madre le enseño como ganarse la vida desde pequeña.

Reina, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m para hacer todo el proceso de las tortillas y sale al mercado a comprar el queso que incluyen las tortillas.- No tiene más fuentes de ingresos, siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, nadie más se involucra en el trabajo, su horario de ventas es de las 9:00 am a 5:00 pm. 

El préstamo será utilizado como capital de trabajo, para comprar los insumos básicos del negocio como quesos y maíz.- Con este dinero comprará por mayor y los guardará en su casa para ir sacando lo que necesite a diario. Reina podrá estar tranquila, pues dispondrá de sus propios fondos y ya no tendrá que preocuparse por buscar quien le preste el dinero.

Reina, espera que sus ventas crezcan y con eso tener mejores ingresos y poder cubrir todas sus necesidades y la de sus hijos.- Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Reina, 34 years old, went to school up to the third grade. Her parents separated and she was left living with her mother who didn't have enough to cover household expenses, much the less to be able to continue with schooling. Reina is a single mother. She has two children, one age 17 and the other age 10.  Only her younger daughter is a student right now, but they both depend economically on her. 

She makes cheese tortillas to sell, work that has been her source of income for many years. Since she was young she worked in this business.  Her mother taught her how to earn a living since she was little. 

Reina gets up at 4:00 am to to everything in the process of tortilla-making and leaves for the market to purchase cheese, which the tortillas include. She doesn't have any other sources of income, she has always worked in this business, no one else is involved in the work, and her schedule for sales is from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm.

The loan will be used as working capital to purchase basic supplies for her business such as cheese and corn. With this money, she will buy in bulk and will store the supplies in her house to be able take out what she needs every day.  Reina will be able to be relaxed since she will have her own funds and won't have to worry about looking for someone to loan her the money. 

Reina hopes that her sales grow and also to have more income and to be able to cover all her needs and those of her children. The earnings will be invested in making the payments and expanding the business.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies for hre business such as cheese and corn.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 49 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children, now at their adult age. 

Rosita earns income from her little sari-sari store. She’s been engaged in this business for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP3,500 each month doing this type of business activity, in which that amount is so helpful to support their family needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods for retail. 

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children now at their adult age. 

Gloria has been engaged in a coconut buying and copra trading business for one year. She earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of business activity, an amount is so helpful to support her financial needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in buying more nuts for copra processing, and copra for sale to copra buyers. 

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her coconut buying and copra re-trading business.

loans.use: to buy more nuts for copra processing and copra to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell. Rowena has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from her bicycle taxi.

Rowena aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 53 years old and married with one child.

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Rosita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analyn has been farming sugarcane for twelve years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lilya

texts.en:
Lilya is married and has children. She has her own business.

Lilya grows early and late vegetables in greenhouses. She grows tomatoes, potatoes, and cabbages. Lilya is a responsible person that has goals. She wants to develop her business to get a bigger harvest this year.

Lilya is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to make repairs in the greenhouses and install drip irrigation. Also she needs to buy film, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.use: to make improvements in her greenhouse and to buy fertilizer and seeds
